text:
The champagne of beers!!! I just cant get enough:-).
Caramel, citrus, spruce, dough, butterscotch, amber, cloudy, frothy, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, umami, full body, thick feel, lively, long finish,

I have always appreciated really good Belgian beers, but this one takes the cake! The carmel finish and incredible balance make this one of the best beers I have ever tasted. If you love Belgian strong ale, then this is a MUST! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vintage 2001 Cuvee keiser blue at Delirium. Black with a chocolate brown head. Aroma of dusty chocolate malt, slight vinegar. Very mellow taste with flavour of dusty malt, slight sweet chocolate, alcohol coming out of the throat rather than coming in. Oak, dry red wine tones, Ends with slight coffee bean bitterness and a mellowed alcohol taste along with some peachy undertones. 3,6/5

Bottle Vintage 2013 4,5/5

Pours dark brown, ruby color with thick, dense beige head. Aroma is caramel malts, walnuts, dried plums, yeast esters and some alcohol. Taste is candy sugar, raisins, figs, dried plums, bready yeast, dough. Full bodied, medium carbonation, thick mouthfeel. Good.

W aromacie figi, rodzynki, kandyzowane owoce, trochę estrów, przyjemnie i intensywnie. W wyglądzie czarne z ładną białą pianą. W smaku znów rodzynki, figi, melasa, bardzo słodkie. Ciało dość ciężkie, degustacyjne. Ogólnie przyjemny quadrupel, choć zdecydowanie idący w stronę słodyczy.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2017 consumed a while ago - notes from phone: surprised at the hype of this ale, given its taste was redolent of standard (albeit high quality!) brune fare - figs, hella yeasts etc. Potentially aging unlocks hidden potential.

Dark brown with small tan head. Aroma brown sugar/caramel, some toasty malt, some dark fruits. Full body. Not really a ton of alcohol but a warming presence. Flavor is sweet and sticky up front, toffee, dates, remains drinkable though. Good complexity, excellent.

Pours a hazy ruby brown with a foamy off white head. Aroma of stone fruit, grapes and candy. Taste is very sweet up front, but not cloying. Notes of candy and fruit with a dark cherry note that finishes off the taste with a slightly bitter offset.
Sin duda la mejor de carolus, aroma de caramelo, muy sutil en el sabor, dejando gusto a frutas con un ligero toque picante, sin ser empalagosa,y dejando un agradable regusto muy bien equilibrado.

Best Belgian strong ale I've tried. It got dark dried fruit, subtle hint of banana. Exceptional beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle. Caramel sweet aroma with creamy notes. Full body with thick beige cap. Medium carbonation. Extrea dark brown color. Sweet taste with some fruity notes (grapes, banana), long sweet aftertaste.

Bottle shared with Frank. Aroma is barrel, dark fruit, raisins, figs, molasses, excellent. Appearance is dark brown, hazy, light light tan head. Taste is molasses, figs, spices, dark fruit, wood, some booze, great. Mouthfeel is medium body, light bubbly carbonation, woody molasses spice aftertaste. Overall, this one is excellent.

Bottle from beergium. Appearance is light hazy red, brown, black. Medium thin brown head. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter. Carbonation is medium to high. Aroma and flavour is caramel, malt, chocolate, coffee, wood, vanilla, dried fruits.

75cl bottle (2015) from Chez Sophie. Pours a deep dark brown, good light tan head. Aroma is rich treacle, brown sugar, raisins. Taste is smooth, exceptionally rich and fairly sweet with a well-represented quadrupel character, dried dark fruits, cassonade & dark treacle. When other Belgian dark beers seem a little tamer in recent years (Chimay Blue, Westvleteren 12...) this really shows whos boss. A great, lazy evening warmer.
Шикарно& пиво, шикарны& аромат, красивы& цвет, отличны& мощный сладков& вкус и послевк& Алкогол& почти не ощущает& но после дает о себе знать. Сварено в 2016 году, срок годност& 10 лет.

Bottle. Pours a dark opaque brown with a lasting foamy beige head. Aroma is of nuts, caramel, dried fruits, figs, raisins, ginger, honey, coffee. Taste is of Fifa, raisins, chocolate, coffee, blackcurrant, fudge, honey. Smooth, heavy, oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Bouteille 2014
De couleur acajou, avec très peu deffervescence, la lie est bien présente et vague dans le bas du verre sans être au fond ni sur la surface. Une petite robe sexy qui danse sur le contour du verre. 

Une odeur bien dosé de fruit noire, de pruneaux, de raisin sec et de cerise. Le tout agrémenté de sucre et de caramel. Un arôme bien boisé fondu dans le chocolat et la noisette! Plus la température augmente plus lalcool se fait sentir, mais quau nez. 

Les fruits noirs font leur entré, raisin. pruneau, figue, cerise entremêlé de caramel et de vanille. Des notes levurés apportes des traces sans équivoque, de banane et dépice.

Larrière goût semble être comme le goût de la réglisse rouge! Les épices bien choisi donne un effet assez rond, une finale lente qui perdure dans le fruit noir et un malt caramel saupoudré de cacao. Larrière goût est tellement dure à déchiffrer... cest fruité, sucré, doux, chaleureux par son alcool, un bon arrière goût de véritable caramel, jen ai les lèvres sucrée!
Flaska systembolaget. Åtgång 2016. Mörkbrun kulör. Doft av torkad frukt, äppelmos, nötter och jäst. Kryddig smak, russin, plommon, knäck och äppelmos. Söt och djup munkänsla

750 ml bottle. Pours dark red with tall, creamy, long-lasting, beige head and nice lacing. Aroma is of funky yeast, caramel malt, spices and dark fruit. Body is full and smooth. Taste is on a sweet side, herbal hops, caramel malt, sherry, spices, dark fruit and alcohol. Finish is long and spicy. Great brew.

On tap at Bangers and Lace. Pours dark translucent black. Rich fruity aromas. Sweet but not cloyingly so. Relatively light bodied - not syrupy at all. Some earthy notes. Clean finish. No alcohol burn. An outstanding strong ale.
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 one of the my all time favorites. perfectly strong taste with wood, dark fruits and caramel. full bodied, creamy texture. warm finish. amazing aftertaste!

Rond aroma, evenals de smaak: rozijnen, gedroogde vijgen kandijsuiker, kruidig, misschien een tikkeltje te zoet voor mijn smaak en voor de absolute top. Ik ga zeker proberen er eentje te bewaren. Afdronk is plakkerig maar complex.

anno 2016, colore ambrato scuro, schiuma fine compatta e persistente, al naso vaniglia canditi e amarena, bassa carburazione, sapore costantemente dolce, banana, cocco e vaniglia. Non si sente lalcol nonostante gli 11 gradi, molto equilibrata. una delle migliori birre in assoluto
Burgundy colour, almost like the blood of charles the fifth. Smells of pinot noir, red berries mixed with sugary malt. Warm scintillating aftertaste. An oily sugary wonder.
(à la maison) un vrai régal. Un goût épicé et bien marqué , bonne longueur en bouche . Une bière à déguster à lapéro , avec du fromage ou avec quelque chose de sucré.

Autant le dire tout haut, on sait tout de suite à quoi sen tenir avec cette Cuvée De LEmpereur cordon bleu ! Cest le très haut de gamme, voir le top du top de la bière Belge, donc de la bière mondiale... Très belle brune avec des reflets pourpres profonds et une mousse fine beige à bulles fines, ultra-stable à quelques millimètres. Nez exceptionnel, soyons clairs. Un côté beurré très présent, liquoreux, alcool puissant, des malts sublimes (chocolat, café, caramel, sirop dérable, cassonade, miel, châtaigne, pain viennois etc.), beaucoup de fruits avec des notes de fraise, pruneau, pêche, abricot, banane, goyave, mangue, raisin, figue, mûre, myrtille, noix, poire, pomme cuite, en veux tu en voilà ! Des épices avec ce côté vanillé et cannelle très prononcé, mais aussi, et cest là quelle se démarque (aussi), un côté boisé très intéressant, comme mûrie longuement en fût de chêne. La levure est droite, longue, ample, un régal. En bouche, lalcool emplit tout lespace tout en laissant sexprimer les arômes, et il y en a une palanqué ! Les 11% ne sont pas là pour faire rire, mais en même temps ils soutiennent parfaitement lensemble, léquilibre est une merveille. On retrouve les notes de liqueur de mirabelle ou de prune... La texture est soyeuse, liquoreuse, presque sirupeuse même, les sucres sont doux, ronds, avec des saveurs de sucre candi, de miel, de sirop de canne ou dagave. Lamertume quant à elle est présente, surtout en début de gorgée tout comme la carbonatation, plutôt correcte pour une bière de ce calibre éthylique. Le final est sur les esters, très huileux, les notes boisées et de cuir, les malts torréfiés et ce sucre enivrant. Le palet est littéralement caressé et en redemande à chaque gorgée ! Même si ce nest pas son fort, on retrouve de la fraicheur, les houblons sont discrets dirons nous, mais ils font le job. Une véritable symphonie gustative, à déguster en écoutant Symbolic de Death, un bon Devin Townsend, la cinquième de Beethoven ou la chevauchée des Walkyries ! Le brassage élevé au rang dart... Fantastique. Bouteille 75cl, V&B Grenoble.
Pleasant aroma of caramel with cognac, some black fruits/berries jam, raisins, some yeasts. Sweet taste with quince, peach and green walnut jam, some rum with raisins, a bit of yeast. Very balanced!

Bought at local bottle store, shared with friends. Pours dark brown with a thick, foamy, off-white head. Delicate aromas and tastes of dark fruits, plum, caramel, with sweet malty notes. Heavy in alcohol, yet very balanced. Great!

Bottle 75cl (vintage 2016)
Poured red brown with a creamy tan head.
Aroma of raisins, dried plums, caramel, ripe fruit, alcohol.
Taste of sweet and dark fruits, bitter like dark chocolat, toast.
Sweet warm alcohol finish.
Reddish brown, small head. Smells port, ripe fruit, some alcohol, very clean. Full body, sweet, malty, well balanced. Long warming finish
Pours medium brown with a thick, creamy head. Aroma of dark candy syrup, plums, raisins. Sweet, minimal hops. Alcohol is well hidden, just Belgian deliciousness.

750ml bottle (vintage 2008). Bruna/rossiccia un filo torbida con schiuma beige leggera e poco persistente. Al naso frutta matura, mela grattugiata, alcol, pan di spagna, miele, ossidazione. In bocca è dolce, maltata, sbilanciata, ancora miele, manca di rotondità. Corpo pieno ma inferiore alle attese, carbonazione bassa. Deludente, andava bevuta prima.

Bottle 750 ml, Bucharest at Bistro GUXT. This is definitely one of the best dark strong beer I ever tasted. Dark amber color eith almost no head. Aroma is senzational with lots of dark fruits (raisins, dried plums, figs and dates), caramel, molasses, dark bread, toffee, some hints of chocolate, sweet wine and vanilla.
Taste is really complexe, with sweet and dark fruits hints, moderate bitterness, perfectly integrated alcohol.
In my opinion this beer is almost perfect, maybe a little too sweet to really reach perfection, but still very close. Really excellent!

Bottle 0.75L, labelled 2016.
Hazy brown body with small frothy, frothy, tan head, mostly diminishing with some nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (roasted, caramel) aroma with notes of red fruits, plums, raisins, wood, and some coffee and licorice.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet and light-to-moderate bitter flavour with a long-lasting sweet/vinous finish.
Medium-to-full body with creamy texture; soft carbonation.
Maybe a bit young, but a nicely complex beer.

Intense notes of dark fruits, dates, raisin, blueberry, plums, hints of caramel, beautiful dark brown with a thin ocher head, full body, law carbonation, again fruity notes with a good sweet final...one of the best belgian strong until now.

the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of milk chocolate, vanilla, toffee, raisin, candy and some spices.. the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of sweet chocolate, vanilla, toffee, bisquit, raisin, dark fruits and sweet wine... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...
Shared 750 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of dark fruit, plum, caramel, apple, alcohol. Taste follows nose. Sweet finish. Very good.

Marrón cognac, limpia, bonita espuma cremosa y duradera. RIco aroma, barrica y whisky, caramelo. Notas lácteas. En boca es muy sabrosa, de predominio dulce y algo licórica. Azucar tostada, ricas maltas, madera, levadura belga con notas lácteas. Compleja y potente.

L:
-poiurs a cloudy ruby-brown with a hig frot beige hea
-hig carb vis
S:
-cherr,car,pluums,figs,,sug,clov
T:
-Fo the nose
-finishes way too sweet
F:
-medium to high carbonation
-medium body
-alcohol noticeable
O:
I expected a bit more Balance.
The Sweetness is hard to take, especially with a 750ml bottle.
Sample, Dark brown beer, medium head. Aroma is dark fruit, caramel, malt. Taste is the same, very nice.

Aroma: sweet, rich and boozy; Appearance: very dark amber with creamy offwhite head that lingers; Taste: follows nose but very smooth and muted; lots of plums; wish it had a little more backbone; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: very enjoyable Belgian; would definitely get again.

25cl draft at the Brick Store, Decatur, GA. Dark mahogany with some white head. Raisin/prune aroma with clove, cinnamon and chocolate covered cherries. Sweet spiced taste like a Christmas pud. Maybe a bit too sweet - it borders on cloying - but a wonderful treat for the tongue nonetheless. Long, sweet, carbonated, spiced finish. Sip it gently. Tasty.

Mooi donkerbruin bier. Aroma is zoet, met tonen van donker fruit. Smaak is aangenaam zoet(niet te zoet) met rozijnen. Bier drinkt zeer gemakkelijk weg.
Misschien wel de beste BSDA.

2014 bottle. Appearance is mahogany, with a half finger beige head. Aroma- plum, raisin, Christmas cake, vanilla, port wine, Christmas pudding, sweet malts, cherries, fruitcake. Taste- chocolate, ripe dark fruits, raisin, nutty sweetness, marzipan, brown sugar, cherries, puréed Christmas cake, sweet fluffy finish, dark malty bread. Excellent.

Big bottle from elevated with commonmac. Plum almost purple color with medium white head. Thick and murky look. Smells of dark fruit, chocolate, and booze. Taste is very smooth. Alcohol well hidden. Light raisin, dark fruit, lots of dark cherry. Great mouthfeel and body. Very sweet, but I didnt mind it. Delicious. Fit for an emperor.

Large bottle purchased at Elevated and consumed as part of Belgian planning session with commonshawn. Belgian snifter glass. Deep ruby, cola color with plenty of sediment. Lots of tan head that quickly exits the party. Nose has an intriguing and surprising malty chocolate element. You also get the traditional dark fruit you associate with Belgian quads. Taste has an impressive combination of sugary dark fruit, chocolate, cherry. An amazing ability to hide the alcohol content with a surprisingly smooth, silky mouthfeel. Some caramel and brown sugar characteristics. Finish is hard to beat with a cherry, port like presence.

Look: clear brown, almost no head.

Aroma: caramel, candied fruits, sweet roasted almond.
Taste: sweet with light spicy bitterness.
Flavour: dried sour cherries, some earthy and mushroom notes, light woody hops, some mature alcohol notes.
BOTTLE 75 CL. Clear ruby-brown, beige head. Big dark fruit, nutty cookies, some booze. Sweet fruity taste, mildly boozy. Smooth taste of a well aged beer.
I tested all types of Carlous, it is very delicios. But this beer is from my favorite type. Too sweet for me, but overall is good!

Deep dark and sweet Belgian. This was the 2011, have been laying around for 3-4 years so not sure if this affects the taste. Could use a bit more complexity in taste but still a very enjoyable dark and sweet beer with a crisp alc. level.

2016 750ml bottle from Beer Cartel pours dark amber with generous off-white head. Aromas of caramel, liquorice, molasses and spiced rum. Tastes of caramel, brown sugar, dates, burnt toast, roasted malt, dark fruits, herbal characters and spices. Long and balanced finish with a fair bit of sweetness and warming hum from the 11% alc vol. This rich and full bodied dark Belgium strong ale represents everything great about this style perfectly and leaves me wanting more.

Bottle vintage 2012
Pors redbrown with lattecolored head with minimal bubbles. Rich toffea aroma, vort bread, sweet aroma. Little plums. Complex, yet very balanced. Feel that it has aged well. Not as du s other Belgian strong ales, to its advantage. Nice!
Bottled. 2016 version. Rich fruity aromas, deep dark brown color with big head which decreased after while. In taste dark malts, plum, a little bit of dark chocolate and gentle alcohol.

Bottle at home. 2013 vintage but with a 2008 from last weekend in mind. Also remembering it as new three years ago. So. Heavy, thick body and taste as new. As years go by the body gets thinner and the taste goes from something like a sticky toffee pudding with wine to a balanced beer with tastes of figs, raisins, wood, caramel and sweet liquorice. In the years between the body thins out but the sweetness stays. Actually think its best as new or at least 6 years old. Two different beers.

2016 bottle (1 pt 9.4 oz). Pours cloudy dark brown with thin tan head and lacing. Nose of plums, raisins, and candied sugar with some apple notes. Plum with prominent caramel flavor following. Sweet, effervescent finish. Thus would be interesting to try after a few years of cellaring. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
75 cl från systembolaget. Fantastisk. Ren magi. Tur att jag har en till på lagring!
Bottle. Dark brown, creamy foam. Aroma: esters, even a little acetone, dried fruit, raisins, dried figs, toffee. Taste: esters, wine, raisins and port wine, toffee. Just awesome!
Rich taste, beautyful color, very fruity and sweet, no taste of the high abv at all. Really fantastic beer

Proefglas van 75cl-fles op WBA-tasting bij Freddy. Merci! U: Donkerbruin met licht bruine schuimkraag. G: Geroosterde mout, rozijnen, vijgen, chocolade en karamel. S: Zoete quadrupel, veel chocolade, gedroogd fruit, wat gist, banaan en een licht rokerige toets. NICE! M: Volmondig en sticky.
Deep red. Rich, sweet, fruity, and spicy, with a lightly bitter finish. Medium body. Overall, a wonderful belgian strong ale. Beautiful color, very rich taste and no sign of the high abv.

Dégustée avec mon Appiantiqua.Belle robe brun-rouge avec reflets cuivrée surmontée dune mousse de couleur crème moyennement persistante qui laisse une fine épaisseur.La carbonatation est assez bonne et le nez nous offre rapidement des arômes de Porto,fruits secs,raisins,pruneaux......La bouche nous amène sur un agréable velouté de toutes ces saveurs déjà senties avec une légère amertume et alcool chaleureux qui restent en finale.Great beer!!!!!!!18,5

Dégustée avec mon Kittenbieer dans un verre Maredsous.
Température de début 9 à 10°.
Très belle robe brun rouge surmontée dune mousse crème qui retombe assez rapidement pour laisser une fine couche; bonne carbonatation.
Nez très agréable et complexe sur les fruits noirs(raisin,pruneau) et le porto.
Le goût est tout simplement exceptionnel : équilibre parfait entre lamertume et la douceur avec des saveurs furtives de dattes,figues,caramel et le retour du superbe vin cuit.... dautres dégustations seront nécessaires pour mieux apprécier limmense palette quoffre cette très grande bière.
La finale est tout aussi plaisante et de bonne longueur avec un alcool parfaitement intégré. 
Le très haut de gamme!!!
18,5/20
Peppermint, red berries, chocolates, and toffee aroma. Taste is Coca-Cola, Dr Pepper, bitter herbs, peppermint candycane, berries, and coffee. Lots of vanilla too. Complex and amazing.

Cuvée 2014 aperta l8 ottobre 2016.
Tonaca di frate con riflessi caramello, schiuma beige chiara non molto persistente.
Aroma etilico, banana matura, bourbon, note di mela, fichi, lieve cioccolato e lieve tostato, note di ciliegia.
Al palato banana matura, mela, fichi, note ossidate che ricordano il bourbon, finale delicato con cioccolato, bourbon e note tostate.
Non molto carbonata, corpo pieno.

2015 bottle. Dark brown shade. Short off-white head. Notes of apple, raisin, grape, coffee, toffee, earthy malts. Mouthfeel is the best part. Really well poised, thick and slightly sweet but not cloying. Lovely.

Bottle 750ml (2015)  cellared for 1 year. Served at room temperature. Pours a hazy burnt copper. Head is medium sized, foamy, beige and lasts well. Aroma is sweet and complex; lightly toasted wholemeal rolls, blackcurrants (strong), stewed plums (strong), dried currants, dried apricots, cooked brown sugar, cherry liquor chocolates, aniseed balls (red), dried leaves and rich pudding spices. Flavour is velvety smooth, sweet, and slightly vinous; virtually no bitterness at all; vintage port (strong), spiced prune paste (strong), overripe figs (strong), golden raisins, cassis, stewed rhubarb, rich chocolate truffles, cooked sticky brown sugar, a touch of golden syrup and hints of old red wine barrels in the finish. Full bodied with very soft carbonation, a velvety texture and a long finish. ABV is extremely well hidden. Would make for a perfect after dinner/desert beer.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2016 750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Cloudy dark amber with a small off-white head. Strong malty aroma of caramel, syrup bread, brown sugar, resin, rasins, plums and yeast. Taste reflects the aroma. Medium body, with a slick texture. Low carbonation. Low bitterness.

75cl bottle. Dark mahogany pour with a medium height, fine-grained beige head with good retention. Notes of chocolate, dried fruit (plums, raisins, figs), toffee, molasses, sherry, cherries, caramel. Medium to full bodied, soft mouthfeel, low carbonation and a sticky-sweet finish.

75 cl. Bière très intéressante où le sucre et lalcool dominent. Les arômes de prunes, de raisin et de caramel sont vraiment agréables. La bouche est plaisante, ronde et apporte des sensations fraîches. Mais lalcool est vraiment trop dominant de lensemble !
Bottle. Pours brown with white/gray head. Really sweet with notes of chocolate, cinnamon, clove.

0,75l bottle shared by lotheac @ Dungeon de Munde. Pours clear deep brown with a low head. Aroma is sweet malts with fruits and perhaps some sherry. Flavor is sweet malts, caramel, sherry, alcohol and a hint of hops. Excellent.

agosto 2016, bevuta VDK del 2007 presso Dome di Nembro. Scurissima, con schiuma poco persistente, profumo deciso di frutta rossa, corpo medio, carbonazione lieve, finale morbido senza ossidazione, resta in bocca a lungo. Non stuccevole. Birra eccezionale ed entusiasmante

75 cl 2013 edition. Deep dark red with beige foam, dissipates quickly leaving slight lacings. Aroma is malty with vinous sourness, slight sweet nuances, dark fruit, coffee. Very complex. Taste is moderately sweet with strong malty notes, dark overiped fruit, slight vinous tones in the back preserving a certain freshness, finishes with warming round sweet flavours, slight alcohol, dryness. Big body with low carbo, fairly sharp bubbles. This is a mouthful, and damn good. Very rich.
Bottle 75 cl. Deep red, clear with a nice creamy lightbrown head. Nice fruit, caramel, and sugar aroma. Sweet taste with light bitterness, nice fruit end, the alcohol is well hidden. Great!

Tummanruskea kirkas olut melko pienellä mutta pysyvällä vaaleanbeigellä vaahdolla. Tuoksussa sokerista makeaa mallasta sekä vahvaa hedelmäisyyttä, ennen kaikkea luumua ja rusinaa. Taustalla lievää anismaisuutta. Maku ensimmäisellä otoksella vahvan sokerinen ja makea. Maku tuntuu jyräävän kaiken muun alleen. Alun makeuden jälkeen maku kuitenkin laajenee vahvaan luumuiseen hedelmäisyyteen. Maussa lisäksi siirappista makeutta, anista, lakritsia ja hapanta mausteisuutta. Melko täyteläinen suutuntuma, lämmittävä kokonaisuus, mutta alkoholi pysyy hyvin piilossa. Oikein laadukas olut jälleen kerran mainiolta panimolta.
Bottle, 750 ml from Svijet Piva. Shared with Miro and JFK10000. Pours dark brown with small beige head. Malty, caramel, dark fruit, chocolate. Sweet. Complex, but not overly. Full bodied. Great brew.
Tap at the Answer. Dessert! Dark fruit, bready. Very sweet but clean- not cloying. A hint of bitterness to balance. I want more of this when its cold out.

The average score of vintage 2005, 2010 & 2015, all tasted 2016. 2005; Intense sweet fruit & brown sugar (10). Clear red/brown, with long lasting tanned head (5). Taste of sweet fruits (8). Medium body, sticky texture & average carbonation (4), 18. 2010; Oaky dried fruits (10). Black with foamy light brown head (5). Sirup sweet & dried fruits (10). Full bodied, oily texture & soft carbonation (5), 20. 2015; Dusty, discreet fruit (6). Clear red/brown, with long lasting tanned head (5). Sweet fruits with syrup finish (7). Medium body, sticky texture & lively carbonation (4), 16.

One of the greatest beers I have ever had. Perfect in every way. 

Great aroma, takes over the room. 

Balanced taste. Awesome.

Editie 2016. Mooi robijn rood/bruin bier. In eerste instantie een metalig aroma (bloed?) maar dat veranderde snel in rood fruit. Smaken van rood fruit, gedroogd fruit, pruimen, mout. Een flink zoet bier, maar heel lekker zoet, alcohol is bijna niet te proeven. Een prachtig bier. Binnenkort maar eens een paar flessen aanschaffen om te laten rijpen in de kelder.

Dark reddish brown with silky smooth head that stays long. Aroma of raisins, plums, dark fruits,sweet malt sugar. Sweet sugary taste with plums, raisins, and dark fruits. Finishes with sweet syrup. Overall this is very good beer, challenging yet sweet and alcohol doesnt taste on it at all. Spicy chocolate cake in bottle

Vertical tasting with 2013 and 2015 releases. Brown color. Aroma of brown sugar, yeat, fruits, raisins and caramel. Sweet taste of dried fruits, raisins and apricot. The 2013 year release is a bit more mellow and that adds to the balance. Sweet finish with some lingering spice.
Dark clear reddish brown with small light brown head. Dark malt, herbs, caramel and belgian yeast. Sweet and complex with lots of herbs and earthy tones.

Smell of malt, caramel, floral, dark fruit. Come in dark brown with thin creamy crown. Taste of malt, caramel.... way too sweet for beer. Sweet overcome every other good things. Right texture, slightly slimy. Everything is good just need less sweetness.

Een van de meest prachtige romige caramelachtige binnenkomsten..Een portige zoete en heerlijk smeuig in de afdronk. Fruitig en verfrissend een zachte bitter en zachte afdronk. Een bier om te koesteren. Prachtige combinatie tussen de smeuigheid en de romigheid met een tintelende en prikkelende carbonatie.
Wonderful and complex flavour with cocoa and fruit hints with roasted notes. An absolute wonder!

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 26D). Bottle 75 cl - Batch 16013 14:43. AROMA: predominant alcohol aroma with a medium-high solventy note, giving way to a peppery alcohol character. moderate malte intensity with slight toasty notes. APPEARANCE: dark amber color and translucent with ruby body. light brown medium head with average retention. lace formation. TASTE: moderate-high malty sweet flavor with caramel and slight toasty notes. very faint dried plum note. low bitterness with malty balance and a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium body and creamy. moderate carbonation. smooth alcohol warmth. OVERALL: an interesting belgian dark strong ale without much complexity. good for celaring.

Une bière exceptionnelle, relativement sucrée et peu amère mais avec une saveur unique, des arômes de café grillé, un équilibre subtil avec une pointe damertume très légère. Une bouche agréable, très douce et onctueuse. Seul bémol, le coté sucré peu légèrement écurer si on en boit une deuxième.

75cl bottle, vintage 2015. Served in tulip glass. Poured a dark reddish brown with a two finger tan head. Wonderful aromas of raisins, caramel, dates, vanilla, dark fruits, very vinous. Taste: Raisins, caramel, tannine, dates, figs, dark fruit, vanilla, bread, spices, licorice, Belgian yeast. Lots of vinous qualities. Very sweet. Drinks like a good port. Alcohol is very well hidden and sneaks up on you just after a while. Very bready, chewy mouthfeel. Medium to full body with a vinous, spicy, sweet finish. Overall a delicious vinous beer which will also age magnificently in your cellar. Top Class!
Donkerbruin bier met licht beige schuim. Geur: gistkarakter, brood, geroosterde mout. Smaak: zoet, basterdsuiker, fruitig, overijpe banaan. Volmondig en plakkerig. Afdronk: zoet
Bottle @ home, Vintage 2012. Dark brown, creamy beige foam. Sweet nose of dark fruit, plums and caramel. Very well balanced. Sweet, light bitter finish. Nice sipper.
Aijaijai, vaahto siirappia ja makea olut täyttää makunystyrät. Ei mitään liikaa.

750 ml cork bottle 2014 vintage opened with loud pop bought at Craftissimo in Tsim Sha Tsui East.
Looks: Cloudy hazy deep ruby red colour with a layer of yeast sediments; Three-quarter finger head and light beige foam which last for 1 minute; Beautiful sticky lacing with active small carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and sweet dark malt, with Brandy-like liquor, strong liquorices, strong plums, figs, sugar, spices, bread, strong Bel yeast and lemon.

Taste: Strong sweet dark malt, with strong caramel, light toffee, dark fruits, light red fruits, syrup, light spices, light bread, strong Bel yeast, lemon, light bitter hops and light grass.

Body: Full body. Oily, creamy and very slick palate.

Mouth feel: Solid dark maltyness in a thick and very smooth background. Strong caramel followed by pretty strong dark fruits and touches of red fruits. No apparent boozy taste so common with strong Belgian Dark, amazing! Syrupy sweet but in a nice, slightly nectar-ish manner. Yeasty with moderate lemon to round. Very nice!

Booze: Strong in Brandy-like aroma, the 11.0% alcohol is completely hidden in taste, even liquorices is very light. This is art!

Hoppiness: Spices and lemon in nose. Lemon and light grass in taste. Bitterness is moderately low for a lasting, fairly low astringent sweet malty finish.

After Taste: Slightly dry. Creamy, sweet and light bitter to mouth.

Comments: Compares to hard hitters like Chimay Blue, Piraat, Bush de Noël, etc., this one has the heavy liquor-ish attribute in aroma, yet surprisingly booze-less in taste, makes it very easy to drink if you dig the strong syrupy sweetness. Rather straight forward in taste but taster friendliness is the key. Excellent!

P.S.: What a way to celebrate my 1400th ratings!
Butelka. Rocznik 2001. Piwo jednak troche stracilo na leżakowaniu lub slabsza warka niż pity dawniej 2013.

75 cl, bottled. Vintage 2016. BB 14/01/2026. Pours nearly clear red with a pretty decent head. Aroma: Toasted notes, nuts. Spices. Taste: Quite sweet. Toffee, malt, caramel. Spruce. Spicy tones. Red berries. Festival feel, i.e. yule day. Some pleasant mild bitterness. Syrupy overall. Palate: Medium, quite thick body. Syrupy texture. Mämmi. Some mild bitterness in the end. Pleasant peppery notes in the end. Coffee. Enjoyably complex. Good but syrupy. Sipper. Interesting material for maturation.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2016 Jargaan 2015, consumida en 2016, Servida en Tulipán.

APARIENCIA: color marrón muy oscuro, con algunos destellos rojizos en la parte baja. Corona de espuma color beige de buena retención, de burbujas compactas en su mayoría, algunas abiertas.

AROMA: Muy licorosa, se inhala y exhala el alcohol, muchas notas caramelo, azúcares quemados, melaza, toffee, algunos frutos oscuros ya maduros.

SABOR: Mucho caramelo, azúcares quemados, el alcohol se percibe pero sin ser agresivo, las maltas tostadas están ahí, melaza,toffee, frutos oscuros ya maduros como higos, dátiles. El retrogusto es seco, no astringente y se siente el alcohol en la garganta de manera cálida. 

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio algo creomoso con carbonatación media.

RESUMEN: una excelente y compleja Belgian Stron Dark Ale que cumple dentro del estilo, muy rica, debes probarla si gustas de este tipo de cervezas,
Brown/Red liquid with a nice amber head. Sweet aroma of malt, grapes and caramel. Fantastic taste, perfectly balanced. Starts sweet and ends with a pleasent biterness. Excellent beer.

2015 - Marrom avermelhado/rubi, média turbidez, espuma bege de boa formaçao e persistência, aspecto cremoso, acima do esperado. Aroma bastante maltado, uva passa, morangos, açucar queimado. Paladar de dulçor intenso, leve amargor torrado do malte. Corpo licoroso, média carbonatação. Álcool incrivelmente não aparenta os 11%. Final de dulçor um pouco exagerado, malte se dispersa mais rápido que o ideal. Muito boa, mas esperava um pouco a mais no geral, aparência e aroma são os destaques.

Bottle @ DØE Ringsted. Appearance: pours clear red-brown with ok beige head and lacing. aroma/taste: brown sugar, alcohol, dried fruits, a bit of chocolate and some spicy notes. palette: strong malty and yesty aroma, average carbonation, full body, high sweetness, unbalanced by a medium bitterness, long duration and an oily texture. Overall: extremely tasteful, but too sweet.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2016 750ml 2011 bottle shared with Seb. Aroma: candied fruits, licorice, raisin. App: hazy brown, murky, minimal white head, little lacing. Taste and palate: full body, high sweetness.  Overall: good stuff but so sweet. Wonder how this was a few years ago. Maybe it didnt age so well.

On draft. Pours quite dark with a quick tan head. Nose is strongly candied and yeasty with a bit of booze, background hops, and a touch of spice. Flavor is an epic exposition of the best things Belgians have to offer: a modest but never too strong sugary sweetness through, huge esters, lots of variation in fruits and dessert feels, a semi-thick feel, and well-hidden but warm alcohol. This is one of the best beers out there and a pinnacle of what Abbey-style strong Belgian ales can be.

Blijft voor mij een topper! Héérlijk! Klassieker maar zo goed! 
Mmmmm
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Wow. En superlækker øl, med masser af lækker smag. til pas med sødme og smag af øl.

Denne belgiske strong ale har et mørkebrunt udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en kraftig maltet og sød aroma og smager sødt af karamel og stærk malt, samt en bitter afrunding. Medium karbonering.

Pana drobna, nieduża ale trwała, ładnie zdobi szkło. Barwa miedziana, klarowna. Aromat słodko winny, czuć owoce suszone, cukier kandyzowany, syrop klonowy, porto, sherry, melasę drewno dębowe... W smaku od razu zaskakuje gładkością, aksamitnością przypominającą kawę ze śmietanką. Jest słodycz kandyzowanej moreli i niewielka kwaskowość czerwonego jabłka, ciemne winogrono, figi, przypalany karmel, delikatna ziemistość i likier czekoladowy. Goryczka niska, pikantno ziołowa. Wysycenie średnie, treściwe, wyklejające, z nieźle ułożonym alkoholem, który objawia się w postaci charakterystycznego rozgrzewania w gardle.
Ciekawe piwo, dość gęste, kisielowate jak na Belgian Strong Ale, co akurat zaliczam na plus. Nieco przeszkadza mi w odbiorze jabłkowa kwaskowatość, ale ogólnie dobre piwo.

2013 batch. Pours clear dark copper with small creamy head. Aroma is caramel, molasses, nutty, toffee, sugar, alcohol, some vegetable, some cola. Heavy sweet, medium bitter, light acidic, sweet aftertaste. Body is full, palate is oily, carbonation is soft. Aroma and taste is typical for Carolus.

2000 edition , almost no foam but excellent notes of caramel ,nuts and wood.
Amazing body for 16 years old, one hell of experience!

NEVER seen this on draft before... Super stoked I stopped in at Bittercreek!!

Nice lite tan head that drops to a good collar and substantial lacing... Deep chesnut brew with beautiful dark ruby highlites when held to the light.

Aroma is deceptively complex .. alot of well hidden spice with brandy mascerated dark fruits... plums.. raisins.. figs.. and dark caramel.. smell is not as sweet as expected.

Flavor is amazing.. hugely complex profile.. a touch more spicy than the nose led me to believe. Tawny port notes without nearly as much booze... alcohol is there but only the tie that binds all these great spicy fruits together. Big plum and swelled prunes ... dried sweet cherries and a very present sweet cigar characteristic. Fairly thick viscosity.. with the perfect amount of carbonation.

Benchmark for the style.

750ml bottle (Beerfox, Riga). Clear dark chestnut color. Small size, creamy white head, stays. Sweet, yeasty, caramel, bit of plastic, metallic in aroma. Horribly sweet, hazelnut skins, minerals in taste. Yeasty and sweet in aftertaste. Sickly sweet eeehhhh....

Bottle, 2015 vintage, 11% abv (from firma-bier). Pours copper-brown with beige head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, malt, caramel, fruits, alcohol. Flavor is sweet and malty, dark fruits, caramel, some dryness. Finish is fruity and dry with some alcohol showing. Overall: very good.
Bottle. Hazy chestnut brown with a medium sized nicely lacing tan head. Brown sugar, hay, caramel, honey, dark dried fruits. Full body, sticky texture, syrupy sweetness with warming alcohol. Sticky.
From a bottle. Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, dark fruits, and some alcohol.
Bottle, vintage 2002, rated February 6, 2016. Port nose with figs, dates and raisins. A little dirt as well along with old wet cloth. Sweet flavour matching the nose.

750ml bottle, vintage 2013. Deep ruby/brown with a creamy beige head that leaves thick rich lacing. Lots of berries in the aroma, dark dried fruits, strawberries, licorice, nuts, chocolate and phenols. Full bodied without being heavy, silky smooth and well rounded mouthfeel. Very deep and rich taste prunes, dates, figs, marzipan, fudge, licorice, blue cheese. Very good!

F: good off-white, good retention.
C: very dark red-brown.
A: complex, grainy, molasses, sweet dried fruits, figs, dates, hint of coffee, dark caramel, banana, hint of anise-coriander-spicy, raisins, candy sugar, hint of alcohol.
T: 0,75l bottle 2015 from beerfest in Zottegem in october 2015 great beer for just 5e, complex, malty, molasses, caramel, raisins, dates, candy sugar, dry figs, hint of plums on the palate, dark fruits, some alcohol but quite easy drinkable sipper, very smooth, rich in taste, a must try beer.
Pours deep ruby with small white head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, bananas. Medium body with lively carbonation. Taste is all sweet. Great, complex beer but a bit too sweet.

Flaska från SB. Provning med ölsällskapet. Flaska från 2013, drygt 2 år gammal. Mörkbrun, mörk mahogny med beiget fluffigt skum. Söt doft av brunt socker, russin, kola, lite kakdeg. Söt och fyllig, något kryddig i avslutningen och ett lätt humlebett.

2008 vintage 2L magnum. Pours a murky copper brown with thin ring of bubbly tan brown head that leaves light lace. Aroma of dark fruits, sweet malts, burnt sugar, banana esters, and alcohol. Taste is dark chocolate and molasses up front, followed by cherries and plum, then fades to faint earth. Booze is hidden on the mouth except for a slight burn, still moderate carbonation, really complex, held up exceptionally well.
Forte, corposa. A naso tanti odori, i malti in evidenza: frutta secca, datteri, cacao, note di marzapane., Non stucchevole, finale corto.

Surnotee ?
On ne peut pas ne pas ne pas laimer. Ronde caramelisée, un équilibre décole.
Un grand classique, sans surprise mais aussi simple que fédératrice.
Wonderful and complex flavour with cocoa and fruit hints with roasted notes. An absolute wonder!
Bottle, vintage 2012. Pours a dark brown with a decent, beige head. Aroma is caramel, dark fruit, prune, date. Taste is sweet with caramel, prune, date. Liquorice, cinnamon. Full, tad too sweet.

2015 Bottle in Trappist glass
A - Amber brown with thick beige head
A - Caramel, Plums, sweet and malty
T - heavy sweet, lightly sour, lightly bitter, 
P - full body, thick rich creamy, average carbonation, long finish
O - wonderful rich beer
Vintage 2013. Sweet dark coloured body. Very rich and hints of chocolate, very malty and dark fruits. Excellent to share due to the intense flavour.

December 24, 2015. Bottle, 2012 vintage. 

Clear deep amber red with a small off-white yellowish head. Aroma is sweet with toffee, prunes, plums, hints of licorice and spices. Taste is very sweet, light bitter and hints of alcohol. Finish is sweet, light fruity and spicy with caramel, prunes, figs, pear and warming alcohol. Medium bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

Quite sweet but with a very nice balancing bitterness and light boozy notes in the finish.
Bottle, 2014 vintage. The regular Gouden Carolus Noel is already incredibly good, but this one is even smoother, rounder and better balanced. What a beer!

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 Vintage 2014. Brown color with tan head. Aroma is dark fruits, caramel, lots of darkness and mystic character. Taste is spicy, dark caramel, very rich. A Belgian Strong with character, and so many Belgian Strongs lack character!

2011 batch. My 7th 750ml bottle. Pours a hazy dark brown. Off white head. Nice lacing. Sweet dark fruits, caramel and Belgian yeast aroma with slight hints of Shiraz red wine. Taste is full flavoured dark dried fruits, caramel, a rich sweetness. Smooth. Boozy warmth. Lovely
Flaske. farven er rødbrun og skumkronen er lysbrun. Aromaen er malt og alkohol medens smagen er alkohol, blommer, kaffe og vanille. Bestemt en øl der er anbefalelsesværdig.

2013 Bottle
Aroma-caramel, honey, dark fruits
Appearance-dark amber, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-heavy cloying sweetness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect
Bottle from real ale store. Newark. Hazy mid Amber brown with a thick foamy heAd. Fruity and yeast aroma also a touch metallic. Taste mid sweet to bitter sweet finish. Really nice.
Pre-Xmas at Brams. Zooeeet mijn god, wel lekker voor een keer in de kerstsferen maar veel te zoet en iets te veel alcohol wat mij betreft. Backlog from 2014/12/21.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017

Aroma:

Medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruit, bread and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/dark brown beer with a slight/medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts heavy sweet with malts, caramel, Belgian yeast and dried fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread and spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Very sweet, slightly too sweet even, but still complex. Tastes amazing, but the quality is sadly not of that level.
Geweldig bier. Beter dan dit is er niet, of ben ik althans nog niet tegengekomen.
Beer tastning @ Jorn69 20/11-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Dried fruity with marzipan and yeast, also sweet. Body is medium to full, the finish is dried fruity and sweet with warming alcohol.

Beer tasting @ Havregatan 151120. Bottle (750 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty, yeasty and sweet with lots of dried fruits, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is sweet with dried fruits and warming alcohol.
Deep red-brown color, beige head. Dried fruit nose, marzipan, candi sugar, Belgian yeast. Yeast taste, candi sugar, dried fruit, nuts, licorice, alcohol. Full body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, edycja 2014, pite przy okazji slepego testu: http://tiny.pl/ggmvg . Niewysoka piana, ciemne, lekko oleiste pryz nalewaniu piwo. Aromaty owocowe (suszone sliwki, rodzynki, wisnie), melasa, pralinki skrzyzowane z wanilia imarcepanem. W ustach slodkie, wyklejajace, rozgrzewajace. Bardzo ladnie wywazone, a zarazem wyrozniajace sie sposrod innych swoimi deserowymi nutkami,. Jedno z najlepszych piw jakie mialem okazje pic. Choc w zwiazku ze swa swego rodzaju ulepkowatoscia, sadze, ze nie kazdemu bedzie pasowalo.Edit - a propos food pairingu - to jest piwo, do ktorego wybitnie pasuje papieros ;)Pity rocznik 2001 (dzieki, Swaroga!!!) - to doswiadczenie mentalne a nie piwo bylo :)Rami Rami is drinking a Gouden Carolus Cuvée van de Keizer - Blauw (2013) by Brouwerij Het Anker at Muzeum Azji i Pacyfiku#teammegaslodyczka, kandyzowane owoce ciemne, karmel, migdaly, melasa, slodziuchno, jak ja lubie takie piwa. Zero alko. Aromat jak z beczkiOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

750 ml bottle from Pacific Liquor in North Park. Pour is opaque black with a one finger, off-white, creamy head that maintains and leaves thick lacing. Nose is powerful, with black raspberry, cherry, port, hard candy, raisin, and alcohol aromas. Taste is quite sweet and syrupy, malt forward, almost cloying, strong molasses presence. Overall quite fruity and sweet with plenty of alcohol. Sticky texture, soft carbonation, long, sweet finish. Pretty decent, but probably wouldnt repeat.
750ml bottle, year 2013 bottle. Hazy brown body with a medium/liw head. Molasses, figs, milk chocolate, dark sugar and raisin. The alcohol is well hidden (by now?).

Poured from bottle, 2015. Pours dark with small tan head that quickly vanishes. Definitely can taste the alcohol, but hopefully that goes away with age, placed another bottle in the cellar to find out. Has some molasses and raised flavors. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75cl bottle. Opaque dark brown colour with a thin off-white head. Roast, caramel, molasses, raisins, figs and vinous in the aroma. Medium carbonation and medium to full body. Taste is complex with spicy, nutty and liquorice notes but mainly sweet. Overall, a very good beer.

2011 bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a hazy chestnut brown with tan head. Deep smell of molasses, rainsins, nuts, figs and some vinous notes. Complex taste of raisins, nuts, figs with some deep hazelnut notes and some liquorice. Perfectly balanced and perfectly hidden alcohol leading to a well-rounded semi-sweet raisin/prune finish. Lovely.

Pours a deep brown with a frothy and lacey light brown head. Aroma of brown sugar, dark dried fruits, caramel, alcohol and dates. Taste is brown sugar, caramel... Basically all the same as above with some residual sweetness bit its all so smooth and a great winter or festive warmer/share bottle!
From small bottle. Wonderful dark fruit aroma with thin lacy head. Complex flavors, strong alcohol content, but incredibly smooth. Sweeter than other dark strong ales with perfect carbonation
Flaske 2014, duft svesker brun farin sød, smag sød rosin maltet, vanilje mørke toner,

(2013 750ml bottle from Systembolaget, ~2yr old) Pours cola colour with a big bubbly fading off white head and lace. Aroma is rich toffee malt, molasses, dark rye bread, cola, figs, dark berry/fruit compote, a bit of clove and pepper. Taste has a spicy peppery bite initially, clove and herbal feel, almost woody. Fills in rapidly with sweet toffee, molasses, stewed fruits and jam. Finish has a bit of bready overtones, more sweet toffee and stewed fruits, a bit mineral and dusty for the weight of the beer. Light bitterness and peppery herbal notes, some cigar box mark a drying finish. A bit of alcohol. Medium bodied with moderate effervescent carb. Still pretty sweet with a bit of age but I expect the time has prevented it from being overly syrupy or hot, so its a pretty smooth drink. Nicely complex, maybe just a hair off the Westy/Rochefort/Struise level, and a definite warming sipper.
My Overall rating is a purely mathematical amalgamate of the other ratings.

Bottle, 75cL. 2013 Cuvée. @Naintré, shared with daddy. A dark brown opaque beer with a medium beige head ; medium retention ; good lacing. Roast, caramel, fig, walnut, toast, raisin, prune. Medium to heavy sweet, light warming, light dry. Medium voluptuous body, medium texture, light silky, medium carbonation, sweet warming toasty finish. Overall, really enjoyable toasty strong belgian ale ; nice texture ; (too easy) drinkable.
Really nice aromas and Flavors of caramel, bread pudding but not sweet, Belgian yeast spice. Not too boozy. Dark caramel color and a weighty plate with an even smoothness.
2014 bottle. Drinking Oct 2015. Taste of caramel, chocolate, nuts, dried fruits, fresh bread, ripe bananas.

A 2015 bottle, I know I should save it BUT I have another that I will store...
Pours almost black, very thin head as is typical for Belgian ales.
Aroma with leather and caramel...
Taste is amazing, rather lively mouth feel,sweet, caramel, hints of coffee and chocolate bitterness. Yet it is refreshing and inviting. Some hints of warm boozy feel in the palate as well... But not a wine feeling..
Overall.. Amazing

0,75 l flaske fra Bierzwerg.de. Årgang 2013. Dyp klar mahognifarget kropp med et tett beite fingertykt skum. Innbydende smørkaramell- og kandisaroma med krydret innslag av belgisk ølgjær. Kraftig sødme og alkovarme. Fyldig med lang søt ettersmak.

2015 bottle. Dark color with a small light tan head to it. Raisins, figs, molasses, malts and a nice bubblegum/banana yeast aroma. Really well balanced and nice. Flavour is also really nicely balanced. Notes of yeast esters, malts, sweet raisins, candi sugar. Full mouthfeel and velvety smooth texture.

Aroma: caramel, stone fruits, raisins
Appearance: clear dark amber, tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious

2012 vintage, Pours medium, hazy brown. Tan head. Nose is molasses sugar, dried fruit, especially raisins and jam. Taste is sweet and malty. Tiniest bit of warmth but truly well balanced considering the strength. Rich and full bodied and cloying but in a good way! Truly magnificent beer.

0.75 l bottle from Pivoteka Zagreb. Missed it in Mechelen back in 2008., finally drinking it. Malty, fruity, dry fruits, syrup, brown sugar, fruit jam. Sweet, heavy alcohol presence. Metallic taste from aftertaste. Fruity sweetness. Medium body. Not impressed.
UPDATED: SEP 22, 2015 From elcervecero. In Maredsous chalice. Shared with Carlos.So softly drinkable you wouldnt guess its high ABV. Not too expensive (6?) To repeat. 2014 bottle
Wish someone would brew this beer for me every birthday as it is a stunner. Rich and rounded with a bit of syrupy goodness that is to expected at this alc content.

Pours light, translucent brown. Taste is the top of creme brûlée - burnt sugar. The alcohol is completely hidden. This is a good one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une robe brune, une belle mousse. Un nez superbe qui allie des notes maltées, chocolatées, épicées, de la fourrure, du cuir, et du houblon. Bouche à lattaque ample, une superbe présence de bouche, une longueur kilométrique et une finale parfaitement équilibrée. Une très grande bière qui pourrait évoluer quelques années.

A 750ml corked and caged bottle. 2014 vintage with a best before date of 29th April 2024. Poured into a Chimay goblet. The beer poured a dark brown colour with a slightly less than one finger tan head which quickly settles to a nice thin creamy layer leaving spotty lacing. Strong aromas of caramel and toffee, also lots of dark fruits, plum, raisin, prunes, dates, fig with hints of butter. Taste is on the sweet side with dark fruits dominating especially plum, raisin, fig and prunes. Caramel and toffee are in the background and hints of banana and bubblegum sweetness at the finish. Smooth and creamy, light warmness, medium bodied, light carbonation. Overall a very good beer that is a must buy for me. Even at 11%, you dont taste the alcohol. Great for a late night sipper. Im going to age a few bottles and see what happens!

Fresh yeast aroma upon opening the bottle. Weak in the glass though. Powerful sweet and alcoholic taste. Feels like caramel and sticks to the mouth. A rich heavy brew prefect for a cold winter night. Creamy mouthfeel.
Sample at beer bloggers conference, Brussells 2015Rich, dark fruits, figs, caramel, slick, low carbonation, warming, black cherries and prunes

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2016 bottle, 2013. Poured murky reddish-brown with a creamy tan head. Subtle aroma, slightly tart and alcoholy. Medium body, creamy smooth carbonation with a buttery mouthfeel. Flavour of dark fruit, sherry-like, sweet molasses and anise notes, an earthy quality to it.

Bottle, deep dark brown with a lasting fine head, lightly woody and toasted toffee nose, sweet and warming, notes of liquorice and toffee, a little cocoa and earthy herbal bitterness, a bit cloying in the finish.

Merci à Ju-Lo pour la dégustation, cette bière fut partagée sur la terrasse en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina, Dominique et Carine. Cheers! La bière est très foncée, entre noire et brune. Parfaitement opaque avec toutefois quelques minces reflets rubis, de belle mousse et de fortes bulles, la bière pourrait très facilement passer pour une Quadrupel/ABT lors dun test à laveugle. Nez de malts vieillis, de raisins bleus et de vanille; je suis émerveillé! Je pourrais passer une soirée complète à respirer ces arômes caramélisés et je ne parviendrais sûrement pas à nommer chacune des teintes composant cette palette aromatique tant celle-ci est complexe. Rondeur impériale et douceur divine, cette bière veloutée ne laisse aucunement transparaître ses 11% dalcool. Je ressens du sucre brun chauffé à la gazinière, de la crème brûlée, des figues, du caramel, toffee...Cest tout simplement miraculeux! Merci Seigneur pour cette offrande!

25/07/2015 @home  75cl bottle 2013 from Bierhalle Deconinck
Hazy brown with sticky foam. Dark malts, caramel, spices, dark fruits, creamy, sweet, some licorice, easy drinking but however complex taste.
2009 vintage. Haha, finally knocked off this one, I believe i bought this in 2010. Great standard quad, nutty molasses and caramel. Rich and thick, very delicious.

Very nice body. Big nose. Dark dried fruits, lots of plums, big banana bubblegum, sweet yeasty bread. Decent alcohol almost brandy-like, comes along with the big body. Little earthy notes in the background. Big and sweet without being cloying. Very long finish. Its a bit sweet for me, but I keep buying it here and there, its a classic !!

I dont care much for these types of beers anymore but I have to say this one is really good. Brown clear pour with tan frothy head. Aroma is nutty light cocoa, some banana, toffee, and raisin, with a nice earthyness. Taste is sweetish upfront with a drying roasty nuttyness and fruityness on finish. great beer.

750ml bottle. Dark brown color with red notes, no head. Malty and yeasty aroma, fruity, dark dried fruits, spicy, caramel, some chocolate notes, wineous, wood, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter taste. Medium to full oily silky body with soft carbonation.
Bottle. Very good aroma of dark fruits: cherries, plums. Aroma is very sweet. Beer is very dense. In taste is sweet and very fruity. Great Belgian Strong Ale.

Bottle from 2010 @ La Capsule, Lille and one from 2000 shared with Dark, happyhoppy and RudolphSayven - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: nice caramel and malt domination. Good sweet notes, like sirop. Taste: very sweet and smooth. Good palate (degraded with time), caramel and malt. Like a sirop on your mouth. This beer is amazing! Aftertaste: caramel and malt. Sweet brown sugar.
Very dark brown chestnut pour, small brown head. Aroma of figs, dates, dark fruit. Flavor of plum, dried fruit, light chocolate. Complex and delicious.

2014 edition 75cl shared bottle at home from Mitra, Maarssen. Body is hazy dark brown, head is big, beige, creamy, mostly lasting, good lacing. Nose is cocoa, flavor is milk chocolate, candy sweet, dried fruits, brown sugar. Heavy sweet, medium roasty bitter. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium bittersweet, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, sticky texture, average carbonation. Nice dessert beer, too sweet for me.

Bottle from Saveur Bière (2015). Frothy, beige head. Smells nutty, yeast, currants, apple. Tastes nuts, spicy, plum, apricot, apple. A bit salty but mostly sweet with a sugary and bitter finish. Great brew.

2013 Vintage. 
Bought at Systembolaget, Sweden in april - 2014. 

Dark mahogny colored, clear beer with a three finger high, beige, creamy head. A lot of lacing stays on the glass. 

Nose: Caramel, raisin, fudge, toffee, butter, oak, dried fruit, vanilla, sugar and yeast. 
Taste: A complex, sweet taste of dried fruit, red berries, nuts, molasses, roasted malt, nutmeg, spices, malt and syrup. 
Body: Smooth, complex texture. Light carbonation.

Beatiful beer!
75cl bottle from 2008, 11% abv. Dark brown color. Aroma of dates, sweet raisins and malts. No alcohol in aroma. Tastes sweet, fruity and malty.

75 cl bottle at home. Dark brown to black color. Nose roasted malts, caramel, yeast, some citrus. Taste toffee, brown sugar, alcohol, yeast, some red fruit. Mouthfeel kinda sticky and sweet dry, with little hoppy bitterness. For me the sugars are way too overwhelming, despite all the flavors that it does have to offer.

750ml c&c bottle from Tim for Fathers Day. Poured a hazy orange brown with a larger creamy light beige head. Aroma is rather vinous, fruity, plum, brown bread, dough, red wine. Medium mouthfeel, smooth with lighter carbonation, and a long lingering aftertaste along with a good dose of heat. Flavor of red wine, prunes, plum, dry breads, grains, dough and yeast. Good stuff but BIG and it doesnt hide it.

Poured from a 750cc bottle. Cloudy dark brown with a beige head. Nose is caramel, roasted malt, dark dried fruit, nutmeg, and a hint of expresso. Flavour is dark dried fruit, molasses, dark chocolate, and roasted malts. Excellent Belgian strong ale.

Pours a deep, dark reddish brown with an offwhite head. Complex aromas of dark fruit, molasses, and a hint of hops at the finish. Smooth flavor thats sticky on the palate with a tinge of alcohol on the back end. A good, and potent, strong Belgian ale.

Classic! All qualities needed for great Belgian strong are here. Interesting maltiness build. Theres overriped fruits and dark fruits, caramel note, candy sugar, some yeast and spices, toffee, some hops. Moderate sweetness with light bitterness.
Well balanced and highly enjoyable brew.
Very very good belgian strong ale, it is perfect ethalon for the class. I mus rerate to gi it propper quality notes. But what can I say for sure the balance lvl is perfec

Every year on the 24th of February, the birthday of "Charles the fifth", the Brewery brews the Gouden Carolus "Cuvee of the Emperor" in a limited quantity and with an eye on the highest quality and tradition. This unique brewing, with only extra fine Belgian hops and with a higher alcohol level, guarantees a better evolution in the time, than the already known Gouden Carolus. This beer, as all our beers, is 100 % natural, with no preservatives, no adjuncts and no chemicals. We bottle it in bottles of 75 cl and closed with a quality cork. Excellent to store several years. Every year the public is invited to assist to the brewing process. 
Was 8% abv in 2000-2002, 10% in 2003 and 11% in 2004.
Dark red with a tiny off white head. Dark ripe fruit, molasses, light caramel, buckwheat. Sweet, light bitterness. Sticky, average carbonation.
Dark brown beer with a small brown head. Aroma is sweet with notes of raisins and red fruits. Soft sweet and malty flavour with some hints of caramel. (Bottle 33cl)

De loin lune des meilleures bières que jaille Jamais bu cest un chef doeuvre brassicole. On y note des arômes de malt caramel, de sucre dorge, de mélasse. Nuances de prunes, baies rouge, de pétales de roses. Beaucoup de corps et de persistance arômatique.
Beautiful brown textur with a sweet smell. Taste like prunes and molasse, non intense, just perfect. Great beer for a late night talk. Cheers.

Bottle kindly shared by Peter.
Amber with a minimal head.
Aroma has marzipan, raisins and loads of sweet maltiness.
Taste is sweet, slightly vinous with caramel, raisin and a light hop bitterness.
Full body, low carbonation, smooth mouth feel.

Poured from a 750cc bottle. Cloudy dark brown with a beige head. Nose is caramel, roasted malt, dark dried fruit, nutmeg, and a hint of expresso. Flavour is dark dried fruit, molasses, dark chocolate, and roasted malts. Excellent Belgian strong ale.

Murky brown with a beige head. Aroma is chocolate, toffee, nutmeg, dark fruit. Flavor is malty and boozy with some toffee, nutmeg, and dark fruit. Finish is malty and spicy. Complex. Overall good winter ale.

Assaggio da 100ml allo Zythos Beer Festival 2015:

Birra scura, piuttosto alcolica. Aromi di ciliegia e chiodo di garofano. Equilibrio un sbilanciato sul dolce ma tuttavia una birra piacevole.

This was fun. One person brought a 2007 and another brought a 2013 to the bottle share. The score reflects the 2013. The 2007 was fairly flat. It also picked up the banana bread taste. The 2013 was much more carbed. Had a much more pleasant sweetness to it. Nice Belgian taste. 8 years was way to long for the person to cellar this one.

Version 2013, dégustée après 23 mois en bouteille. Belle robe brune aux reflets rubis, aucun col de mousse, dentelle épaisse et collante. Arômes de cassonade, eau dérable, figues, raisins secs, pomme. Clairement un début de madérisation mais le nez reste sublime. En bouche, goût de cassonade, baies rouges confites, dattes, figues, lime. Aucune trace du haut taux dalcool. Finale sucrée et madérisée. Extrêmement complexe. À boire à température cellier et peut-être même plus pour en apprécier toutes les saveurs. Texture liquoreuse et soyeuse. Très faible effervescence. Corps plus ou moins rond. Excellente bière. À partager par contre!

(bottle) clear deep amber-brown colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of melted butter, powdered sugar and earth, with lots of liquorice, alcohol and a hint of sugar icing. flavour is cloyingly sweet, lots of raisins, roasted malts and melted butter, with a touch of salted popcorn and some alcohol in the finish. heavy-bodied with fizzy carbonatzion.
Weak aroma. Sweet, but not too sweet taste. Overall very interesting. Good appearance.
Brown clear with medium beige head. Mild acidic aroma. Sweet, bit too sweet for me, with good sourness, sweet aftertaste.

A: Plums, alcohol, medium intensity.
A: Dark, hazy, minimal head, brown foam, 
T: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness
P: medium body, slick feel,
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with beige head. Aroma of bready malts, yeast, and dark fruits. Taste is similar but with a nice woody hint.

August 7th, 2013 - These days Belgian beers get slotted into my drinking schedule less and less, in favor of the local brewers putting out new and innovative entries on what seems to be a weekly basis. But a return to the old country proves why I should make more trips to the store to take an imaginary trip across the Atlantic. Gouden Carolus Cuvée van de Keizer Blauw is a testament to the brilliant engineering that goes into a well balanced Belgian Strong Ale. The pour gives off a deep, burgundy red beer with a head that barely sits up for the photograph, preferring to recline and settle into the body. The nose gives off deep umami hits of soy sauce and miso paste, with a thick layer of that mouth watering cheese richness, though thinner than most BSAs. A more invokable comparison might be miso dressing, mixed with a bit of artisanal soy sauce and cocoa powder, and even a little dashi for extra warmth and tastiness. On the palate I immediately notice a smooth, velvety texture, which brings with it grape, cheese and yet more umami. The flavor firms and sweetens after it settles, giving off notes of spice and brown sugar, and where there was bordeaux grape in the foretaste, instead theres a space filled more with bakers sweets than the sugars of a farmers market. Though the alcohol is masked, its a sow sipping beer, with a strength behind the curtains. An approach to room temperature brings some pear juice to bear, upping the already remarkable quality of this brew.

Brown body, light brown head. Aroma has cola, bread and chocolate and still noble hops comes through. Alcohol is present. Belgian yeast, which in this case is one of the best strains. Carolus has such wonderful charasteristics. Flavour is without alcohol, but has roastiness and raisins with really nice dark bready malt. Huge beer.

Aroma: malty, sweet, a bit roasted plums, cherries, little cacao, coca-cola
color: very dark brown, almost black, clear
medium body, very smooth
taste, a bit alcohol, but not very agressive, its intense sweet, like Porto-wine
nice to taste something COMPLETLY different than ipa, or beer in general (not belgian way ;) )

Flaska från SB, inköpt 2013. Massiva dofter av mörk fruktkaka och torkade dadlar, fikon, apelsinskal och sultanrussin. Söt smak där föregående fruktbord åter igen gör sig påmind. Mycket fyllig munkänsla med en härlig eldighet från alkoholen.

Since 2004, it is on my favorite list:)
from Year to year i taste difference, and it looks it will be never repeated taste of 2004/2005.
in any case, wort of tasting.

Very dark brown oily colour with redish. Aroma of dark chocolate, hops, malts, caramel, raisins, dark fruits, little presence of vanilla. the same is the taste. Alcohol is notable but is also very well hidden. Overall Very good beer.

Bottle shared by jheath99. Pours dark brown with beige head. Aroma is bready and cookie malts, dark fruit notes, faint chocolate, and faint oak. Flavor is smooth dark fruits, chewy malt profile, light vanilla sweetness, and faint woody notes. Medium body.

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy chestnut brown with a one finger tan head. It smells amazing. I can say with sincerity that Ive never smelled a beer like this before. Molasses, raisin, serious red wine notes, alcohol, hazelnut, walnut, brandy, black licorice, and the "original" flavour of Ricola. As for taste, sweet with heavy raisin notes, LBV port, black licorice, light hazelnut, a light cinnamon note and some definite alcohol that turns into very surprising Dutch style licorice heavy flavours, port, and some dried fruit in the finish. This beer is a beast. Good, too damn good.

Drank the 2013 edition yesterday, bought few years back at the brewery. 
Must say that the taste only got better. Still a top beer!

28.5.2014. Aroma of brown sugar, caramel, plums, dark fruits, fig, malts and warmth of alcohol. Taste is sweet, still plums and brown sugar, dark fruits, malts, some raisin. Quite soft. Great Belgian strong ale.

2012 vintage for my 100th rating. Pours dark brown body with a tint of auburn. Loose tan head that dissipates rather quickly leaving a decent amount of sticky patches of foam. Scents of dark fruits, sweet breads, molasses, and candied nuts. Thick, sweet aroma laced with vanilla, some brandy qualities are also present. Taste is of raisins, ripe apples, toffee, and sweet malts. Alcohol is hidden well. Somewhat dry, tart finish. Fantastic beer, very drinkable.

Hazy brown color with white fizzy head. Sweet aroma, caramel, apple, hints of red wine, plum and cherry. Taste of red apple, caramel, sugar, spices, cherry and plums. Extremely drinkable to be an 11% ABV beer. Really good.

An outstanding beer reminiscent of the best of the Trappists. Nice aroma with evident fruit and raisins. Pours cleanly, great white head. Lovely malt and chocolate highlights, a touch of maple sugar. Very well balanced. Lasts a goodly time on the palate. Drink it in a wide mouthed glass and it will serve you well.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2015 Gouden Carolus Cuvee van de Keizer Blauw, gedeeld en uitgeschonken in Gouden Carolus glazen. Kleur is diep donkerbruin met beige volle schuimkraag. Geur is vol en rijk, zoet, nootachtig met tonen van Belgische gist, rozijnen en chocolade. De smaak is ook zoet en mooi in balans: veel rozijnen, vijgen, pruimen, kersen, vanille en Belgische praline chocolade. Mondgevoel is zacht met een haast romige smaak, de alcohol van 11% is wel duidelijk aanwezig. Echt een heerlijk bier met een zeer aromatische smaak, om rustig te degusteren. Zelden zoveel chocoladetonen geproefd in een bier. De afdronk is fruitig zoet en vol chocolade. Deze Gouden Carolus Cuvee van de Keizer Blauw is een Belgisch bier van uitzonderlijke kwaliteit en smaak.

2013 Bottle. Pours dark brown/red maple syrup with a medium sized tan frothy head. Nose of sweet booze, fruit, cake. Velvet mouth feel. Alcohol well hidden for something as potentially punchy. Tonnes of sweet ripe fruit providing a sweet and lightly sour malty notes. Milk chocolate. Lemon drop candies. Touches of figs, melons, toasted nuts and browned butter. Finish is toasty, and sweet yeasty bread. Surprisingly non-cloying for a very sweet beer.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2015 One of the best beers in the world. Superb on the nose. Clear, dark red brilliant copper bordeaux colour with some beige head, Sour cherry, noble sweet Japanese prunes and toffee caramel. Lightly bitter full thick body. Perfect palate, thats it! Simply amazing flavours.

Very good beer. Way better than expected. Everyone must try this beer. The beer has a a slicht nutty flavor, with a light hint of caramel. The beer has a dark, almost black colour. The beer has a frothy layer of foam. The beer has a medium sweetness, is lightly bitter, with a full body. It is a nice creamy beer with a long finish.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a dark brown with thick beige head. Lots of lacing. Aroma is dark fruit like plums, dates and raisins along with some spices. A little bourbon like smell as well. Taste is moderate to heavily sweet with minimal bitterness. Lot of plum on the taste. Dark fruits, belgian yeast and some sherry like flavors. Interesting and very taste beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very nice brown beer, with a beige head. Malty aroma, combined with plum and raisin accent. The alcohol is remarkably present in the taste which causes for a port- or sherry-like taste. There is also a taste of spices to detect. Unfortunately the bottle was already opened a while before I drank of it, which compromised the taste a bit, especially the aftertaste. Will rate this again in the right circumstances.

Aroma is fruity - plum is the best description that I can come up with. The heavy alcohol is also apparent. 

Color is a hazy dark brown. Head is slight.

Sweetness dominates the taste. Just a bit of bitterness.

Body is medium; texture is slick, with a bit of oil and very slight touch of cream. Carbonation is light to medium. Finish is sweet, plum and long.

Overall this is an interesting and quite different beer, especially with the sweet plum notes. Very good.

Aroma: dark fruits, raisins, plums and spices. Taste: dried dark fruits, raisins, malts, spices, belgian yeast and classy alcohol. Great balanced sweet beer with full body. Small head, good lacing and medium carbonation. Price [Warsaw, Poland] 42PLN (0,75 bottle)

Wow! This is one of the best Belgian beers I have ever had! The aroma is strong with raisins/dark fruits. The taste is boozy with more of the dark fruit, from the Belgian yeast strain. Finished nicely on your palate. This is wonderful, will check out more from them!

Brązowy kolor z beżową, niezbyt trwałą pianą. W aromacie owoce - śliwki, wiśnie... Bardzo przyjemne aromaty! W smaku owocowe nuty dominują, alkohol idealnie ukryty, wyczuwalny tylko przez rozgrzewanie w przełyku. Niskie wysycenie. Bardzo łatwo się pije, trzeba więc uważać, żeby nie przesadzić...

750 ml bottle from the LCBO. 2014 version.
Appearance: Pours a
hazy dark brown with a finger of tan head. Retention is short and there is little lacing which is surprising for a Belgian ale. 
Aroma:
Hint of malt and I thought I picked up some baking spices like nutmeg and allspice but the aromas were very muted.
Flavours:
Malt, Belgian yeast baking spices, bit of caramel and toffee, figs, prunes, grain.
Mouthfeel:
Thin with high carbonation. 
Overall: A nice Belgian ale but with very little aroma even as it warmed up. There was a fair bit of complexity in the flavours so it was enjoyable overall.
Strong boozy raisin scent. Hazy brown with lacy head. So smooth and so good in the mouth. A flavour journey. Not nearly as boozy as expected from the scent. Warming. Pleasant. I needed this.

Gyönyörű belga főzet testet öltésének lehetünk tanúi a Cuvée Van De Keizer Blauw pohárba töltését követően, külső jellegzetességei az előzetesen elvárt módon formálódnak tökéletessé, átlátszatlan kólaszínéhez mennyeien krémes habpaplan tojáshéj árnyalata ad kontrasztot. Selymes, krémes, bársonyos illatok, mindenféle jelző helyénvalóvá válik az aromák terén is, ami egyébként leginkább a textúrát lenne hivatott jellemezni. Füge, datolya, vörösbor; aszalványok, magvak tejszínes fürdőjének nyalábjai kapaszkodnak össze puha szálaikkal - összetéveszthetetlen belga aromák. Ahogy az lenni szokott a kivételesen minőségi főzetek esetében, az illatok adta körvonalakat mesterien harmonikus módon tölti meg tartalommal az ízjegyek kifinomult játéka; utánozhatatlanul krémes szerkezetben testesülnek meg a mazsolás, aszalt szilvás, gyümölcskenyeres komponensek. Simogató, tejszínes karakter öleli körbe az egyébként igen érett, nemesnek ható szerkezetet, amit a vörösboros, egyszerre túlérett és fanyar gyümölcsös hangulatok elegáns alkoholfátyollal fedett jellege biztosít. Amellett, hogy hibákat nagyítóval sem igen találunk benne, határozottan érlelésért kiált a főzet nagyszabású teste, így aki kellő eltökéltséget érez magában, mindenképpen tegye el egy pár hosszú évre, az eredmény valószínűleg lehengerlő lesz.
Caramel, coffee, toast, bread, cereal, basement aromas, alcohol, woody, licorice, skunky
La mejor cerveza que haya probado. Una elegancia el envase. Un sabor increible. Sin duda la mejor de mi colección

Pours a nearly opaque ruby red, with a frothy head. Aroma includes notes of liquorice, plum, dates, and rich esters. Tasting notes include robust plum, liquorice, and rich dark fruits. The palate is warming, and hides the alcohol exceptionally well. This is an excellent Belgian!
Very nice and well balanced beer. Sugary/boozy flavours of raisins, plumbs, currants, etc; also brown sugar, sugar, spices, licorice, toffee. Has a nice warming.
Belle couleur brune avec un col assez résistant. Aromes dherbe, caramel, mélasse, alcool. Assez complexe, mais ce nest pas mon genre...

pours cloudy/murky dark brownn,. with a nice light beige head, good retention and lacing. loads of brown sugar, candi, loads of spices - cloves, cardamom and other masala spices, sweet licorice too, toffee, estery belgiumness, pepper, warming alcohol - almost like a barrel-aged liquor, including fairly present woodsy/woody notes. average carbonation, medium to full body - big, sweet and slightly astringent semi-sweet grassy-woodsy-spicy finish. enjoyable and complex sipper.

750ml bottle, 2006 vintage.
Pours a deep mahogany brown, with a thin brown head.
Complex, mature aroma, caramel, candied sugar, chocolate, yeast, nuts, marzipan, faintly phenolic.
Semi-sweet, full bodied, mid bitterness, slightly low CO2.
The taste reflects the aroma very well, quite mature, very complex and balanced. Lots of dried fruits and earhty notes. Lovely right now, but would probably develop well for another handful of years. (2015-01-04)

Aroma: Medium fruity, banana, candy sugar, dark fruits, prunes. Light alcohol, raisins.
Appearance: Opaque, brown body. Small, light brown head, good retention.
Flavour: Medium raisin, licorice, candy sugar, Light banana. Medium sweetness, light bitterness, sweet finish with lingering raisins
Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation, creamy.
Overall: Slightly too sweet, otherwise a very good after dinner beer. Very complex.Highly recommended.

750 ml bottle, poured. 
18E. Belgian Dark Strong Ale

0,75 bottle shared with friends at Samo Pivo pub in Belgrade/Serbia, proper glass pairing but sadly everybody was smoking inside and it felt awful! Pours dark brown with a small off-white foam which dissipates fast. Nose: alcohol forward, caramelized sugar. Mouth: highly carbonated, sweet notes of molasses. Overestimated!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Birra esclusivamente riservata per veri appassionati!! Prodotto a parere mio di grande qualità e che detiene un sapore molto complesso! Ho avuto lopportunità di poter sorseggiare una 2010 e una 2011 e fare un resoconto personale più che positivo!! Già dal primo sorso questa birra stupisce perché si può subito pensare ad un vino pregiato....al palato nasce subito quel picco di caramello e sapori di zucchero di canna con un finale fruttato e di cannella! Laroma che rilascia è qualcosa di spettacolare anche qui ci sono sentori di caramello...ma anche di cioccolato.. Prodotto di tutto rispetto che almeno una volta bisogna apprezzare!!

2013 bottle. A fantastic Belgian strong ale that reminds me a lot to Chimay Bleue. Hazy dark brown color, amazing foam develops a huge crown. Complex aroma of burnt malts, raisins, molasses, prunes, mild chocolate and a bit of smoke. Taste is also complex with sweet notes offset by a shy nutty toastiness. Velvety texture and a long lasting aftertaste round up this marvel of a Belgian beer.

0.75 l bottle from Alko. Brown colour with big tan head. Well, there is no use of talking about malts and hops here, really. This is butterscotch, caramel, Coca cola tasting wine. Quite nice, but I would prefer a bit darker bewerage. Maybe I should have waited until 2020 or something. Dont get me wrong, this is a good one, but I just expected something more complicated.

2013 bottle shared with a buddy.
This was poured into a tulip. 
The appearance was a nice looking hazy to dark brown color hinging close to black. A light one finger white foamy head appeared and fell within about a minute leaving some sticky lacing running here and there. 
The smell had a a glossed over cinnamon to raisin - esque Belgian sticky sweetness. It didnt have as much spice as I was hoping it would have. 
The taste was mainly sweet with a light champagne to raisin aftertaste leading to a sweet sticky finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. The carbonation seemed good for the style and for me. 
Overall, I say this was a pretty good Belgian Strong Ale. Id have it again.

.75 bottle. Dark brown. Belgy yeasty estery, dark fruity, malty slight raisiny, old suitcase, leathery sweet. Full bodied, smooth nice, dried prunes, malty. Very nice drinkable quad. Smooth, flavourful nice.-- bb
Oh my goodness. Glass from a magnum from 2009. Boozy, dark fruit, sweet, candy sugar, apple and pear, lovely and rich. Xmas cake. So smooth and easy in spite of strength. Winter warmer.
Nice deep brown colour, rich in taste and aroma. At first a very smooth taste but a bit too alcoholic when the beer is going through your throat. A great beer for a winter evening, pure relaxation.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown with medium sized off white head. Very sweet malts, lots of peach, milk chocolate, wine gums, vanilla icecream, spices and some cognac. Full bodied and very nice creamy feel, with quite some alcohol presence. Good stuff!
Aroma of malt, caramel, plum, sweet fruits, hint of chocolate, candy sugar, spicy notes, raisins. Flavour is quite sweet, a bit too syrupy for me. Thick and full bodied. Nice dessert beer.

750 ml bottle
Brown to ruby red beer with blonde big head. Aroma has anise, Belgian yeast, sugar, toffee, dark fruits and raisin. Flavor has sugary and toffeey sweetness with raisin and dark fruits. Quite full palate with quite strong carbonation. Very little bitterness but long aftertaste with dark sugar, toffee, raisin and Belgian yeast. A nice sweet dessert beer for slow sipping, Alcohol does not come through at all.
