Bottle from Hopduvel. Nutty brown, quite a decent head which lasts for a while. Nose is caramel, almond, hazlenut, alcohol, brown sugar, smells lovely. Taste is lots of caramel, hazle nuts, brown sugar, syrup, very sweet. Lovely beer, one of the best Belgian strongs.

750 ml bottle. Pours a clear ruby reddish brown with a short lived beige head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, spices. Flavor is chocolate, caramel, red berries (strawberry, raspberry, cranberry), brown sugar. Finish is caramel, brown sugar, warming alcohol feel and port wine. Lingering spices, pepper, menthol and tobacco. Full body, boozey mouthfeel, average to strong carbonation. Very heavy, but so good!

- Alcoholpercentage van 11%
- Uitstekend biertje destijds gedronken
- Compliment aan de brouwerij- en brouwmeester
- Sluit erg goed bij de smaken die ik zoek in zo'n bier
- Vandaar de hoge beoordeling 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Danforth LCBO obtained without realizing what I had picked up until I got home & ratebeered it. Man, people like this stuff. Pours chestnut brown with a thin slice of foam on top. Its a slow sipper, with a bowl of fruit - apples, plums, pears -- flavour profile & a candy store sugar load out. Its pretty fantastic. Warming & boozy at 11% but the booze is pretty stealthy here. Two complaints: too sugary (carbonate it some more & it could be on the soda side of things) & a little thin in the mouth. This bottle should be shared with a friend but Im taking care of it solo as I fight mages in Skyrim.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 750ml bottle from LCBO, Greektown in Toronto, ON. 11,0% Alc./Vol. Pours an opaque ruby brown colour with half of finger of tanned head. Wine - like aroma with lots of fruity notes such as apples, grapes, pears and some plums. Taste is complex and surprisingly sweet. Not as fruity as the aroma but caramel and tofee are pronounced. Very high carbonation does not get in the spectacular flavour. (Unlike Chimay Red)
drank it next to a "westy 12" - this one is just "party" in aftertase. Worth every point it gets here. "One of our belgian wonders".

1.5l bottle. Reddish dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, cloves, booze and dark fruits. There are a lot of things going on in the taste. Figs, reisins, ripe banana, cloves, caramel, chocolate and some fruity hops in the end. Truly awesome beer.
Donker bruin kleurig bier met een crème kleurige schuimkraag. Smaak zoet van rozijnen en banaan rozenbottel.Geur zoet (mier zoet) gedronken met Bryan

330 mL bottle from Total Wine, Chesapeake, VA (2014 Vintage). Dark brown pour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of graham cracker and faint flowers. Taste of raisin, apple, brown sugar, caramel, and plums. Well balanced, alcohol well-integrated. Great beer!

I first tried it in Kulminator, Antwerp! Then in Beer Festival, Brussels and then in Delirium, Brussels. 

Amazing taste and Aroma. Its a special version of the Gouden Carolus Classic with a stronger Aroma.

Its brewed only on the 24th of February every year

0.75L bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Malty aromas: caramel, chocolate, butterscotch. Flavor is quite sweet, with lots of butterscotch and some spice: anice and clove. Finishes with a chalky texture, and some herbu hop flavor along with alcohol. Full body with a thick mouthfeel and mild carbonation. Overall, a bit disappointing. Tasty enough, with lots of malt, but not much complexity.

12 oz 2013 bottle. 

Smell is huge. Dates. Plums. Sugary. Wine. Dry. Boozy. Rum. Roots 
Looks fine. Dark brown. Tan head.
Wow powwow that is intense! Flavors like the smell. Super complex. Smooth. Sweet dried fruits fade to more yeasty earthy notes with no harshness. 
Palate is smooth. Carbonation compliments and holds a good mouthfeel that fades to dry with amazing flavors lingering.

Well guys..... 277 beers in (plus 200 more from another certain site I was banned from) and its finally happened. The perfect beer. I always imagined it would be from founders but this is it. Amazing flavors, perfect on the palate and pleasing to the nose. An absolute must.

Bottle pour. Dark brown with a large creamy tan head. Great aroma with Dark fruits, cherries, dates, raisins, and brown sugar. Creamy full body. Not overly flavorful, somewhat disappointing compared to the rest of the beer. Taste is mostly dark fruits, dates, and a very light alcohol finish. Extremely light alcohol taste for the percent.

[2012] 75cl bottle. Murky reddish brown with a frothy beige head. Flavors are bread, brown sugar, molasses, raisins, cherries, dates, chocolate and alcohol with spicy notes. Intensively sweet, it hasnt really subsided in two years. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

2011 vintage, 75cl bottle @ home. Pours ruby brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, raisins, plums and dark fruits. Flavour is very sweet and light bitter. Body is medium to full, slick texture, average carbonation. Finish is sweet and flavourfull. Its a sipping dessert beer.

Bottle 0.75l taste 0.25l at Bles Bier Happening 2014 Zottegem Belgium.Pour it dark colour with medium white head.Taste and aroma of sweet cherry, candy sugar, strawberry, plum, dark fruits, wooden barrel.Great

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2014 Jaargang 2011". Flasche (75 cl) von Bierpost.com, 3 Jahre im Keller gelagert. - Tiefstes Rotbraun, klar. - In der Nase schwere weinige Süße, süßes dunkles Malz, überreife Pflaumen und eine zarte fruchtige Säure. - Im Antrunk schwere dunkel- und karamelmalzige Süße, Crème brûlée, Mokka und Weinbrandkirschen; perfekt abgeschmeckt mit zarter fruchtiger Säure. Mild rezent, vollmundig; anders als Gouden Carolus Classic nicht dünn im Mund sondern vollmundig und schwer. Im Abgang mild holziger, sonst unauffälliger Hopfen, der den idealen Hintergrund für die weinige Schwere bildet. Der enorme Ethanolgehalt erinnert an Weinbrand, ist aber perfekt eingebunden und macht sich nur in weiniger Schwere bemerkbar, ohne fuselige Anklänge. - Großartiges Starkbier, das schwere Malzsüße, reiche süße Frucht, Röstmalz und pikante Säure in kaum zu verbessernder Weise verbindet. Eine relativ frisch (2012) verkostete Flasche desselben Jahrgangs fand ich damals noch zu süß, aber dieses 3 Jahre gelagerte Exemplar ist perfekt, mit der idealen Dosis zarter Säure, die den üppigen süßen Malzkörper auflockert und genießbar macht.
Donkere kleur, kraag zakt snel tot een laagje op het bier. Ruikt zoet, likeurig. Smaakt zoet met port tonen en een beetje wrang. Nasmaak van port. Best goed maar te zoet voor mijn smaak.

Drunk in beergeek with cam and pavel. 100th rate!!!! YOURE THE BEST.. AROUND!!!! NOTHINGS GONNA EVER KEEP YA DOWN!!!!
cam had it in mind for my 100th and it was spot on. pours dark amber with a creamy head. aroma of dark fruits, caramel and spices. taste is amazing. its full of cherries, raisins, toffee, vanilla. but it doesnt get too sweet. the alcohol, herbs and hops tie the great flavours together. its so well balanced. its super smooth, not too fizzy, and warming as you go. probably my new fav beer. cheers for a great night boys

750ml bottle from LCBO.
Pour dark reddish brown with a fast disappeared head.
Aroma of plum, sweet caramel malt and hint of liquorice.
Lot of sweetness, light bitterness, strong taste of Golden Carolus.
Full body, average carbonation with a long sweet finish.
A very nice heavy beer.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 750ml bottle poured in my Grimbergen chalice. 2006 Vintage.
Thats a fantastic beer! Really, not much more to say about it. Top 50 Belgium, for sure.
A: Brown cloudy color. Nice small (one finger) creamy head.
S: The nose is just fantastic. Dark fruits (plums), toffee caramel, the wonderful (really wonderful) Belgium yeasts, oak and wine. 
T: Even better. Wonderful malt taste. Strong and Fruity. Balanced sweet. And, once again, the wonderful Belgium yeasts taste.
M: Medium body. Very well balanced sweetness-bitterness, medium to low carbonation.
D: Excellent. Despite the high ABV its very drinkable. 
Highly recommended.
[ BA Review @ 4/1/2010 ]

"vintage 2007, sampled Feb 2010. dark mahagony-brown with thin tan head. aroma fairly strong of figs, tobacco, leather , spices, and a bit of yeast, sweet malt, a touch of hops...and some alcohol as it warms to room temp. the cork smelled more of tobacco chocolate and leather, and if that aspect would have been more prevelant in the actual beer, id have been a happy camper. still very nice as it was. the body was just about right. fairly highly carbonated, but not overdone, like so many belgians, and the big body stood up to it pretty well. the flavor had many of the same aspects of the aroma, with a warming effect from the alcohol. lingering finish. the 07 was pretty soft around the edges, but I would like to hold onto one for another 2-3 years and see what it does."
toast, brown, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish

Sehr Malzig, vollmundig, weltklasse
---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap - good size creamy head, nice dark amber color, nice fruity spice aroma and flavor, sweet malt backbone, Belgian complexity, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Jaargang 2014. Dark brown, with a surprisingly big, tan head. Sweet. Low, but fizzy carbonation. Thick body. Plum, raisin, liquorice, leather, some malt and chocolate flavour. Needs some air after opening. Very good beer, even though Im not a big fan of liquorice flavour in beers.
Bottle at cedar local NYC. Pours a deep dark thick purplish color. Boozy taste with a raisin plum finish. Pretty decent and easier drinking then I expected

In bottle - 2013 (beer temple/Brussels); pours a dark brown. Aroma of raisins, fruit and honey ... when cold the alcohol really comes thought but warmer, it is well hidden .. great beer .. quite enjoyed this one and would buy again
110914. Bottle at home. Pours dark amber with a nice head. Aroma Belgian yeast, raisins, licorice. Ripe fruit raisiny taste. Sweet malty body. Very nice overall. Not Bad.

Pours dark red/brown with a small white head. Aromais sweet with notes of caramel, alchool,plums,apples. Flavor is very complex; heavy sweet in the begining followed by some notes of caramel, light chocolate, nuts?, dark fruits, light yeast. Excelent.

Transfer from BA review on 4-6-13-

 Poured from bottle into a chalice glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a chestnut-mahogany color with some red highlights shining through. Upon pouring there is a small tannish colored head that forms on the surface of the brew. The head fades very slowly over time, leaving a great level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma is sweet of dark fruits, with a big dose of prune and raisin as well as a small amount of cherry. Mixed with the sweet fruit is a caramel and candied sugar aroma as well. While heaviest in the sweeter aromas there are other nice aromas present as well. An oaky and woody aroma as well as a nutty aroma meld well with the fruit sweet aromas. When all are mixed with a nice boozy rum like smell, a very pleasingly sweet and warming smell is put forth.

 Taste  The taste begins with the big dark fruit aromas detected in the nose. Raisin, prune, cherry and fig all show up big at the start and are mixed with a bit of a roasted malt and vanilla. Some light yeasty notes bring with them a light banana and spice flavor more toward the middle of the taste. Along with the yeasty tastes so too comes a light caramel sweetness as well as a little bit of a woody taste. More toward the end a light booziness, much lighter then what would be expected from the nose, is sensed by the tongue. Overall a nice sweet and robust lightly warming flavor is left to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the average to slightly thinner side for a Belgian strong dark of 11% abv with a carbonation level that is on the average side. Both are nice for the sweeter dark fruit flavors of the brew and make this one a little too easy to drink even though it is at 11 % abv.

 Overall  A rather nice Belgian strong dark with a big sweet dark fruit flavor and a nice lighter boozy and yeasty spiced flavor that rounds out the sweet well when mixed with a lighter malty taste. It is overall quite enjoyable.

2013 in carolus glass. I am really disappointed by this beer. At the same price point there are several other Trappists that are much more interesting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared 2013, 11.2 oz.(330 ml.) bottle poured to snifters, showing a murky brown color, with abundant, tan head froth, and web-like cling to the lacing. Dark fruit, sherry, dark caramel, very sweet, with a medium+ body, low carbonation, and a quite boozy & warm presence, with a liqueur like nature. Close to cloying, but otherwise, a decent Quad.
Bottle at Appellation. Pours dark brown, nose is nutty, caramel, fruity, taste is roasty, fruity, sweet.

Bottle, tasting at Appellation Wines. Chestnut body with a thin beige head. Light lacing. Aroma of nuts, filter coffee, leather and raisins. Flavour of fig, lightly roasted malts, filter coffee, red wine and nuts. Medium body with a smooth, oily texture. Soft fizz. Rich and complex. An outstanding beer.

Bottle 0,75l. Pours a brown colour with a ruby off white head. Aroma is sweet, plums, raisins, ripe fruit and malt. Taste has sugar, plums, dried fruits and alcohol. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle aged since 2009 (I forgot about it). Pours lovely dark caramel color with small white head. Aroma is overwhelming and amazing: raisins, walnuts, caramel, even hints of chocolate. Flavor is a continuation of the aroma except much bolder and with a sweet finish. Alcohol is not dominant in the flavor, although I immediately feel the warmth from it. This brew is a contender for the top of my list and aging must have brought the best in it. Just wonderful!

A fruit forward aroma - plums, raisins, hints of figs. A solid brown pour with an off-white ring and minor lacing preceeds a palate of soft fruit sweet flavors. Plums, figs, candi sugar, and hints of cherries in the finish. Medium-full body with medium carbonation. Overall, a well crafted beer that is to relished with every sip.

Dark brown beer with a beige head. Mild citrus and other fruits on the nose, some cherry for example. Very sweet. Lots of caramel, raisins, some sherry, anis and alcohol. Medium carbonation and medium body.
Excellent beer, 750 ml bottle, poured into Trappist glass, dark brown beer with minimal tan head, caramel, slight sweetness, strong alcohol, a fantastic beer.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2015 Luxury version of the famous Classic, brewed every year in February and bottled in 75 cl bottles with cork. Yellowish beige, regular, delicate and not very stable head, bronze colour. Strong, beguiling and complexely and sweety perfumed bouquet of baked banana, cider, freshly baked bread, whisky, orange peel, candied cherries, fennel seed, Belgian chocolates, raisins, vanilla, port wine, amaretto, dried flowers, maraschino, honey, marzipan, liquorice and in the beginning an ethereal spicy smell of cloves and aniseed. Candied cherries in the mouth, candi syrup, honey, dried and spicy citrus peel, deep caramelly and chocolatey maltiness, retronasal ethereal spices (cloves, aniseed), very vinous, port-like, drying in the finish due to the alcohol, even a little bit wry, herbal hoppiness and lingering candi-ish sweetness, resinous. Still a great beer with interesting ageing potential. Older versions were less strong, less spicy and closer to the old Gouden Carolus Classic; and should have had separate entries here.

75cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a medium off-white head with low retention. Full body with low carbonation. Sweet with herbal bitterness. Dark ripe fruits, raisins, caramel, brown sugar and warming alcohol. A complex quality brew.
Zon typische smaak dat sommige mensen dit heel lekker zullen vinden, maar het was niets voor mij

750mL corked bottle 2013 vintage BB 05/12/2023
Deep ruby body, bright edges, good dense creamy tan head persists.
Dark Belgian candy sugar dominates the nose; earthy, treacle-y, burnt toffee with undertones of bitter chocolate combining with spicy dark fruits, port, clove, pepper & prunes.
Very rich, alludes big alcohol without being hot or fusel, creamy carbonation, velvety smooth on the palate.
Lots of dark, burnt sugars on the palate, plummy dark fruit esters, peppery clovey phenolics, dried fruit undertones - its all there. Hangs on the finish, drying, warming, low bitterness, lingering earthiness.
Seriously decadent stuff, a sipper, but tremendous.

Bottle. 2013 vintage. Pours an unclear ruby red color with practically no head. Very little aroma except for a few whiffs of caramel and...freshness. Taste is something entirely else though - malt, caramel, dark ripe fruits, molasses, yeasts and alcohol. Very sweet and vinous with a full body and low carbonation and a sugary and fruity aftertaste. Pretty heavy stuff. Reminds me a bit of the Gulden Draak. Very good.

Vintage 2012
Appearance was cloudy brown with diminishing tannish tiny head, no lacing. Aromas are plum, sweet cherry, fig, toffee, molasses and ester yeasts. Taste are plum, fig, date, cherry, caramel, molasses, maple and warming alcohol. Palate was silky smooth medium-full body with soft CO2, then deep glorious fruits build a great finish. A Gem, try it with age.

Bottle, 750ml. A dark ruby beer with a big creamy head. Color is darker (almost completely dark) at the top. Aroma is of cinammon, alcohol, almond and dry fruits. Taste is bitter and somewhat sweet at the same time. It has a strong alcohol finish, yet it is never unpleasant or out of balance. Dense, rich and very complex. A great beer indeed.
Grandiosa cerveza, color obscuro, retención baja por la cantidad de alcohol, aromas intensos esteres frutales, notas a toffe, caramelo, melasa. Nuez, paladar completo..,

Au nez cest sucré et riche. La Chimay bleue me vient immédiatement en tête. Des notes de cassonade, de raisins secs. En bouche, cest très peu pétillant, pratiquement "flat". Cest une bière qui se boit par contre très bien pour son 11% ABV, une bière qui réchauffe et qui est parfaite pour une soirée froide dhiver. Par contre, ce nest pas mon style préféré et je ne boierais pas cela à chaque jour... Cest trop sucré et un peu trop mince à mon goût.

2013 vintage. Pours a cola colour with nice fluffy 3 finger head that holds nicely for a good while. Aromas of dark fruits - dates, prunes, plums and cherries with toffee and dark chocolate. Wow. The taste is sweet but magnificent. Cherries, plums, raisins, caramel, with a pleasant booziness about it. Med to full bodied, slick in the mouthfeel. Excellent dessert sipper.
Dunkle Farbe mit kleinperligem Schaum. In der Nase Karamell, Rosinen, Rum und wuchtige Alkoholnoten. Am Gaumen Rosinen, Alkohol, Rum, süß und intensiv. Wärmend und mit schöner Kohlensäure-
An exceptional belgian dark ale. Complex and powerful. Lots of sweetness and malty richness. Dark fruit, apple, toffee, and sugar.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2015 -2012 vintage- Pours a dark brown with small tan head. Aroma is cherry, toffee, dark fruit, brown sugar, baileys,noble hops, complex spicy Belgian yeast and some alcohol. Vinous, fruity and slick palate. Aftertaste is sweet cherry, spice, floral, toffee and a lingering spicy/dry alcohol finish. Overall: An excellent Belgian strong ale with cherry and vinous characters.
its about as good as a beer can get. chocolate cherry cordials,roasted nuts, booze, and dark fruits, Amazing.

750 ml 2012 edition, aged 2 years. Poured a heavily unfiltered deep brown with an average tan top. Taste of caramel, candied apples and dark fruit. Medium carbonation, medium sticky body. Alcohol is hidden exceptionally well.

75cl bottle at partial S&G tasting.
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, small stable off white head.
NOSE: fruity, sweet, nice, caramel.
TASTE: fruity, nice and complex!
Very nice, easily available beer in Belgium!

Bottle at Belgian Beer Weekend. Deep dark brown, tan head. Sweet plum and liquorice aroma. Taste is initially quite light, but then hit with a rollercoaster of plum, chocolate and caramel malts. And a massive hit of booze. What a drink!

Bottle. Aroma is light, fruity, plums, chocolate. Clear dark brown colour. Taste is very well balanced. Obviously heavily on sweet side, but there is a decent unglorified bitterness in the background. Fruity, raisins, plums. Also strong malt, caramel. Warm alcoholic finish, which reveals the potency. Very good.

Bottle from a friend, many thanks Dano.Very dark chestnut brown color with medium off-white head. Strong malty, syrupy aroma with candies. Sweet malty taste, with some red fruits, syrup, molasses. Tasty.

Flasa - Cuso. Tmava hneda farba, kremova pena. Vona sladova, karamelova, ovocna. V chuti stredne telo, prijemna nasytenost, kremove chute. Je tiez citit sladovost, ovocne tony, sladkost spojena s karamelov, citrusove cervene ovocie, zlahka alkohol a v pozadi horkost. Nasytenost je velmi prijemna a robi prijemny pocit v ustach.
In eerste instantie dacht ik hetzelfde als de rood te hebben maar wat viel me dit tegen. Donkerachtige tonen, kleur en geur maken dit een zwaar bier om te drinken. Helaas was het niks voor mij.
Bottle 0.75l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Bottled 2002. Aromas and flavours: Belgian yeast, dark fruits and malts. Pretty interesting and still drinkable.

Aroma is sweet Belgian candy sugar, dark fruit and fig. Taste is sweet dark fruitiness and Belgian sugars. Some raisin and buttermilk hints. Appearance is a murky amber with some moderate fruity sediment. The pearl bubbly head holds very well.

Dark ruby red and deep brown mix colour, sweet smell of raisins in the aroma. Raisins and plum taste, very sweet taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.75 bottle. Brown color with a reddish tinge and a small, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, a lot of dark fruits, spices, and malts. Rich taste of cocoa, dried fruits, caramel, a touch of alcohol, and a lot of spices. Medium body, creamy texture, and average carbonation. Finish is a more spiced-up version of the taste. Overall the beer is splendid, worthy of buying at every occasion.

750 ml bottle. Brown beer with a ruby tint - off white head. Aroma sweet, plums, raisins, ripe fruit and malt. Taste has sugar, plums, more sugar, dried fruits and alcohol. Way, way sweet. Should age nicely but not overly pleasant now.

Mahogany brown with red here and there. Head is big and fluffy, like a cloud on top. Aroma has dried ripe fruits, some red berries, tannin. Taste has red berries, tannin, soft maltyness, brown sugar. Creamy soft texture with low carbonation. Excellent belgian strong ale, and for my taste this is a little better than the classic Gouden Carolus. Great beer.

Bottle stored since 2012. Pours clear ruby chestnut with a medium super-creamy tan head that dissipates super slowly with great lacing on the glass. Aroma is complex, spiced malty, cocoa, dried fruits, prune, banana, clove. Flavor is equally complex, spicy and malty with light pepper notes, fruitcake flavors abound. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, just a bit of heat. This is indeed a very nice beer.

Draft at Fire Works Leesburg. Pours coca-cola brown with a khaki head. Leaves a fair amount of lacing. Massive caramel and malt notes on the nose. It just lingers so invitingly like something out of a genies lamp. Rich and luxurious on the tongue if not a little sweet. Finishes clean. Nice.

Bottle - 2013. Pours unclear brown with a dissipating small head. Aroma is raisin, dark fruit, spices and candy. Taste is moderate+ sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. Finishes sweet and lazy. Not much complexity.

Bottle courtesy of Anurag. Pours a deep brown with medium dense beige head and nice sticky, soapy lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, spicy yeast, candi sugar. Full body, oily texture, well carbonated. Taste is molasses, plums, raisin, apple, caramel. Really smooth for the abv. Really nice Belgian Dark Strong.

Deep dark amber body, high creamy brown head. Aroma is deep dark chocolate, plums, pralines, light coffee bean notes. Taste is high caramel sweetness, medium to low bitterness. Very sweet, light espresso like roastiness, cherry woody in the after taste. Body is full, medium carbonation.  Pretty good.
Excelente! Aromas de toffe, caramelo, açúcar mascavo, tostado. O álcool da nota contribuição ao sabor. Recomendo

Pours a deep ruby with a persistent fat finger of tan head and heavy lacing. Nose is dark fruit - plums and raisins - with deep malty caramel and brown sugar. Taste is similar, with a strong sherry character and a fruity finish. Mouth feel is heavy yet smooth, with a distinct but not unpleasant alcohol warming.

This is a big beer, tending to the bombastic, yet surprisingly easy drinking. This would probably cellar well, and Im tempted to stockpile a handful for that purpose.
A most excellent brew. A Belgian Ale of the highest order. Thin head. Floral, fruity aroma. Sweet and smooth wash down. The sweetness disquises the booze. Regal and noble brew. Thumbs up!

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2014 Bottle. Fantastic brew with an aroma of plums, caramel, brown sugar and malt. Taste is dark fruits and intensively caramel sweet. Aftertaste feels like a barley-wine. Will buy this again as soon as i can get my hands on it.!

Pours a dark brown body with a thin head. Faint aroma with a little sweets. Rich taste full of liqourice and more.

Nez de gomme balloune, cerise, cardamome, clous de girofle, cannelle, gingembre, muscade, sucre candi et dattes. Saveurs de cerises et dattes séchées, épices, fruits et sucre candi.

A full on winner of a Belgian brew, and by far the best from Gouden Caralous. Everything youd want from a Belgian, candied sugars, fruits, malts galore, all blended up perfectly in one bottle for your palate. Excellence.

Aroma is banana esters, dark fruits, Belgian yeast and spice with a chocolate malt presence. Flavor is massive, with notes of dark fruits, subtle spice, malts and sweet yeast. World class.

2012 bottle. Pours a deep ruby/caramel with a film of a head. Aroma has big notes of dark fruits, raisins, caramel, and mild alcohol. Taste is on the sweeter side but fruity. Dark fruits, caramel, and candy sugar with a drawn out sweet aftertaste. Medium body with a medium-high carbonation. Effervescent carbonation with a dry finish. Overall very nice. Big dark fruits with a sweet taste. Would get again!

2012 Bottle .... Opened with a nice pop .... Deep plum pour with a creamy off white head .... aroma is of caramel malts, chocolate and light roasted malts with a dark fruity yeast ... think plums and figs in the aroma with a light belgian candi sugar ..... taste is of dark fruits (plums/figs), chocolate, caramel malts with a very light roasted malt and belgian candi sugar .... carbonation is soft and it has a nice creamy mouthfeel and lightly bitter in the finish .... abv is hidden well .... has aged well and has everything you want in a belgian strong
Etched glass bottle from backlog. Pours dark brown. Nose/taste of toffee, raisin, dark fruit, Belgian yeast, candi sugar and spiced prune. Full bodied.
Bottle, aroma is sweet candied dates, taste is similar with a cherry alcohol finish, nice
Drank from a plastic cup at a party. A dark, good looking beer with a sweet and smooth taste.

the scent was edged by strong metal.a sweetness dominates the first taste but the strong alcohol resides for a long visit in the aftertaste.-- via beerbasher/winphone

750ml 2013 years vintage brown corked and caked bottle, with a stylish looking golden lettered label, rated 11% ABV, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is hazy dark mahogany with a medium sized thick tan head, that reduced slowly leaving some lacing. Aroma and flavour of dates, figs, prunes, toffee, caramel, raisins, dark muscovado and a hint of spices. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, syrup like oily sticky texture and soft carbonation. Overall a majestic beer with complex pleasant flavours dominated by caramel and dark fruits, a little too sweet but the alcohol is completely hidden.

Bottle. Hazy red brown beer with a large beige head. Aroma is spicy with notes of caramel, nuts, dried fruit, black cherries and spices. Flavor is spicy, with sweet notes of caramel, raisins, dried fruit and nuts. Sweet but balanced and incredibly well aged. 
Vintage 2010.

Bottle thanks to k0mpsa. Amber to brown color, small beige/white head. Aromas of plums, chocolate and sweet notes. Light roastness. Well balanced body with flavors following aromas, also some liqourice emerges. Fantastic.

Hysteriskt dammig flaska på Moeder Lambic. 2004. Fudgekola, russin och Coca cola i doften. Subtilt dammig i doften möjligen. Förvånansvärt tunn. Känns nog som att den toppar nu, definitivt inte längre lagring. Riktigt bra. Viss komplexitet med lite belgodrag. Klar kopparfärg

Apparently Im not cut out for this one either. This brew is a brown with not much of a head. Too bitter with a metallic end. I swear it smells like prune juice. I stopped drinking after a few sips because I feared becoming ill.

Pours a hazy mahogany with a thick off-white head. Aroma is alcohol and prune juice..seriously. Its oily on the tongue with a ending that burns in your throat. The taste is figs and prunes with a ton of alcohol. This Belgian ale is not my thing. Ugh.
Bottle from brussels, belgium. Dark reddish brown color, small white head. Aroma is plums, raisin, sweet notes, little roasty. Fantastic balanced body, licorice, plums, raisins.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2016 Drank during an awesome tasting at Thijs place 28-3-2014.A lot of carbonation. Nice looks, neutral smell. Slightly sour begin-taste. Continues however with slight sweetness and hints of bourbon. Aftertaste slightly watery.

Bottle 75 CL. Notes of raisins, plums, dates, Chocolate, caramel, dark fruits. Alcohol extremely well hidden. Very much of taste, complex, smooth, goes down easy. Great beer.

It is a very good strong ale
It has a very dark brown colour and a not so strong caramel aroma
the charecter is fruit and sweet
nice to drink

Pours very dark, almost opaque red. Thin, fizzy head. Faint aromas of sugar, dark fruits, plastic, and alcohol. Big flavors, but very cloying. Brown sugar, fig, currant and syrup. Warming alcohol finish. Medium and fizzy mouthfeel. Interesting beer, but too cloying to be a top contender like St. Bernardus 12 or Rochefort 10. 

--- Cheers

Beau liquide brun aux reflets rougeâtres. La mousse est volumineuse, dense et persistante. La dentelle qui se dessine est exemplaire. Les arômes sont construits autour des fruits secs; les raisins et les figues séchées, de la cassonade ou encore dun vrai bon caramel artisanal et dépices savamment utilisées. Une texture veloutée transporte des saveurs sucrées et épicées et ce, parcimonieusement. Un goût de bonnes poires bien mûres. Malté à un bon dosage. Jamais lalcool tient le haut du pavé. Cest dun équilibre exemplaire. Tout un plaisir gustatif. Cuvée 2012 (1021-220214)
Pitäisi olla kai hyvä, mutta ei ole kummoinen. Tummaa samppanjaa. Liian Viinanen. Urpo.

Mørk brun, nesten svart med lavt skum. Aroma av tørket frukt, alkohol, plommer, gjær, karamell og søt malt. Smaken er malt, tørket frukt, karamell og alkohol. Når du tar en slurk føles den først behagelig, mild og litt søt, før neste bølge av smaksinntrykk treffer deg i form av alkohol, malt, men også en fin liten bitterhet. Malt og varmende alkohol i ettersmaken. Medium konsistens. Jeg syns at alkoholen burde vært hakket bedre kamuflert.
Smell of sugar, syrup, pepper. Dark brown colour, small brown head. Aroma of alcohol, liqueur, sugar, cough mixture. Finishes with raisins. Rich in carbon. Very sweet, lightly bitter.
2006 bottle shared at RBNG. Thanks to Brad for the trade! Pours medium brown with a touch of white head. Aroma is earthy, caramel. This is caramel, sweet, a touch of mineral, a touch of smoke.

.75l bottle from Alko JKL 
Pours deep dark reddish with low big bubbled head. Aroma is malts, alcohol, caramel, banana notes. Flavor is alcohol, caramel, sweet malts, banana. Swell!
excellent strong ale. I will definetly want to try it again next winter with a sticky fudge pudding
bottle at a bar. poured a dark brown colour with a tan head. carame, fruits as apple, roasted malts, figs, yeast, bit of a alcohol burn

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2014 Bottle, 75cl. Deep, dark ruby with creamy tan head. Sweet, spicy, roasted aroma, with hints of dry fruits, cinammon and alcohol.  Heavy, robust and very complex. Extra sweet, with a tremendous dark malt presence, stinging spiciness and strong alcoholic backbone. Very nice to have once a year. (Last update: 2014 version).

Bottle from Alko. Dark brown color, beige head. Bittersweet taste with nuts, toffee, caramel, citrus, plum, yeast, earthy notes and a bit of hops. Velvet smooth body. Bittersweet finish with toffee, caramel, dark fruits and earthy notes. Magnificent belgian strong ale.

Bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours dark reddish brown with a head that disappears completely very quickly - looks like Coca Cola. Aroma is quick to point out that this is, in fact, something much better. It offers dark, plummy fruitiness, sweet caramel maltiness, a hint of licorice and currant. Taste is extremely long; there is clearly a beginning, a middle part and a finish. It features initially medium sweet maltiness, later some ripe warming notes of currant and plum appear. The finish is very light bitter with some sherry-like flavours. A strong, warming Belgian this is, but no alcohol in the taste. The palate is full, the texture a bit sticky and the mouthfeel really soft. An excellent Belgian ale that is in the first class of beers this great beer country has to offer.
Backlog 2010 version. Bottle bought at Systembolaget during a temporary release.

Kaatuu trappistipikariin tummanruskeana ja reunalta ihan hieman valoa läpäisevänä, vaahto on noin sormen paksuinen jättäen hyvin vahvaa pitsiä. Hajussa on todella paljon kaikkea: kuivattua hedelmää, ruisleipäistä mallasta, suklaata, anista, lakritsia ja hieman rusinaisuuttakin. Anista ei läheskään niin paljoa kuin yleensä het Ankerin oluissa, nyt vahvemmin suklaata ja leipäisyyttä. Maku on hyvin täyteläinen, anismainen lakritsaisuus päällimmäisenä, suklaa ja rusinaisuus seuraa. Leipäisyyttäkin on, mutta nyt se on taustalla. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen, ja täyttävä, alkoholi ei tunnu käytännössä ollenkaan. Hiilihapot pistelevät kielellä. Upea kokonaisuus, täyteläinen vahva belgi, jossa anis päällimmäisenä, mutta on tässä paljon muutakin. Monipuolinen ja täyteläinen iltamyssy.

Clear mahogany with ruby notes and short off-white head leaving just film on top and bit lacing. Love the color, bit like red port. Actually first whiff of this reminds me of a nice port, fruity with strong wine in the mix, malt bit hidden. Tilting in glass brings bit ash but not much more. Am bit in a flu but at least now I find this very strongly winey and is bit hard even find beer aromas. Well we do have one versatile drink in beer, thats why I like it. Good palate. Soft and round, carbonation is present but it just is very soft, not as sweet as aroma, ash more on front and winey notes also not as much here. This is beer all right. Medium to full body, long tasty finish, alcohol is there but in a nice warming form, very Belgian yeasting, still port here. Quite excellent actually, port beer, great flavors and aromas, lovely color, good palate, enjoyable and unique (at least to me). Recommended.

Re-tasting as warms up and have read what others liked. Lacing is very nice here. Color more mahogany as glass is soon empty. Plums and raisins as pointed before me are there. But hard finding this as complex as most people here. Maybe my flu influenced too much. Anyway I really liked this. Still reminds me of good port.

Color rubí oscuro con densa espuma color crema. Aromas dulces de frutas confitadas, almíbar, caramelo y plátano. En boca tiene densidad media, es muy dulce y afrutada con toques sutiles de acidez que duran hasta el regusto. Muy rica.

bottle 75cl from Alko @ home. BBE 04/12/2023. Pours clear dark amber with a beige head. Caramel, spices, toffee alcohol in the aroma. Sweet, spicy, malty, some alcohol in the flavour. Ok but could use some ageing, feels a bit raw.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2014 2013 75cl corked bottle. Deep dark reddish brown colour, beige foamy head that didn?t last long. Nose and taste are typical abbey double with sweet dried fruits like plums, figs, dades and raisins, clove, gingerbread, chocolate, liquorice, but with an interesting hoppy bitter/sour edge when swallowed. Aftertaste is special with thick bodied sweet, sour and bitter tones lingering and lingering on. Low carbonated, oily/creamy mouthfeel, easily drinkable despite the high alcohol grade. Already really liked the Gouden Carolus Classic, but this is more complex and rounded and better balanced. Buying another one to age...

Deep dark brown pour, with a small tan head. Sweet aroma of darker fruits, brown sugar and caramel. Taste is sweet, rich and warm. Creamy texture, kind of sticky. Alcohol is almost not noticeable, except for a slight burn.

750 ml bottle. Deep dark reddish brown colour, thin but persistent head. Aroma of sweet dark fruits, syrupy malt and spices. The flavour is also rather sweet, malty, with raisins, dates, and a slightly toasted and spicy finish. Very smooth and enjoyable.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2014 Bue en bouteille de 75cl, une couleur brune et une petite mousse, en bouche grosse attaque sur le réglisse qui me laissait assez circonspect, mais ensuite on ressent une bonne attaque sur le grillé caramel et la noisette excellente

Bue une nouvelle fois en vintage 2004 le 06/03/2014 au BierCircus (Bruxelles). Grosse claque dans la gueule qui mérite une nouvelle notation, très forte en goût sur la complexité, fruit rouge caramel, avec une durée en bouche de folie. De la tuerie atomique !

Bue en Vintage 2001 le 30/08/2014 au Sherwood Pub. Grosse tenue de la bière avec une belle mousse et une toute petite effervescence. On reste sur la même complexité avec peut être une pointe de grillée plus présente que sur la 2004.

750ml bottle poured into a shaker pint. Three fingers of tan head settle to a nice cap and patches of lace leave evidence of the once great height. The beer is dark drown and mostly clear with sediment coming with later (or less gentle) pours. Aroma contains raisins, fig, caramel, cherries, and alcohol. Taste is sweet with molasses, candi sugar, dark fruits, and raisins. There is some spicy and mildly hoppy bitterness as well. Certainly a boozy burn on the swallow, but it doesnt detract. Medium-full body, lots of creamy carbonation, creamy texture, semi-dry finish that allows the residual sugars to leave their mark.
Special beer.very refined taste and very nice aromas. A beer to stored for a fex years..its brewed every year on 24 february..in a limited quantity.

2013 bottle of this masterpiece. Pours out a dark brown. A lot of smells going on here. Fruits all over the dang place. Raisins, cherries, maybe some figs. Shit I dont know. The taste is lots of sweet fruits mixed with malt. Sweet aftertaste. Smooth as heck. Wonderful. In my opinion, it kinda makes me want to move to Belgium and rethink this whole being an American thing.
Una belga molto molto interessante, con un gusto complesso che unisce note maltate, dolci, leggermente fruttate e speziate a una presenza luppolata soffusa ma non indifferente. Davvero non male!

Brune marron et assez limpide, cette grande bière noffre pourtant pas une grande mousse. Ne vous arrêtez pas au visuel assez ordinaire car vous manqueriez une célébration brassicole incroyable! Au nez, ça sent le pain aux bananes et chocolat avec une bonne dose dalcool fort. Ouf, ça fait déjà tourner la tête! En bouche, laction se passe en deux temps : tout dabord, cest le caramel, le chocolat et les fruits confits qui sucrent le bec et ensuite, le tout est nettoyé avec une vague dalcool fort. Quel délice!
Dark brown color and fruity aroma with sweet caramel vanilla bean. So much flavor in one beer. I consider it a sweet fruity dark ale champagne. A unique flavor experience.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 2011 Vintage. 75cl bottle shared in a Trappist glass. Pours a slightly cloudy dark brown with a reasonable off white head. Very much benefitted from the aging on this beer. So much more rounded with a cake like mouthfeel and texture with sweet fruits, toffee, caramel, licorice and subtle spices melding seamlessly together. One of the more nourishing Belgians I have tried. I will definitely age my future purchases as the mouthfeel, aroma and taste were all improved over the fresher examples.
Not really my thing. Very sweet and malty. Lots of caramel and thats it. Caramel and lots of it

Olfactif: Des effluves de melon au miel ou de cantaloup avec un peu de pain grillé, pain brun. 
Visuel: Brune avec une belle mousse, crémeuse, dense, qui colle bien. Bonne effervescence et elle laisse une superbe dentelle.
Gustatif: Très agréable. Dans les sucres, dans les levures, dans les épices. Extrême complexité. Les saveurs sont de sucre candi, de cannelle avec une base de levure donnant une douce acidité et venant relever les autres saveurs en leur donnant du caractère et une subtilité remarquable. En bouche, la texture est juste parfaite et léquilibre des saveurs se situe entre les sucres, lacidité et les épices. Si on la classe parmi les bières de Noël, cest surement la plus goûteuse et la plus complexe dégustée à date.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 Amazing beer. Malty, yeasty, hoppy, spicey, it has it all. Rich and lasting taste of all kinds of fruits and herbs. Had one from 8 years old as well, it had amazingly aged.

Smells of dark fruits, caramel and clean alcohol. Hints of bread and sugary cake.

The flavor is intense. Raisins, tart cherries, other dark fruits, cake, caramel and grains. The sweetness is balanced with molasses, mixed spices, breads and hints of citrus peel. Alcohol flavors are well blended and actually aid in the taste.

Rich, creamy feel. More than medium bodied, but not heavy.

Had at a tasting at 28 Springs. Aroma is alcohol and sweet malt with some dried fruits. Some dark cherries. Flavor is sweet and slightly bitter. A little hoy from the alcohol. Overall though very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2014 Sipped from a nice stemmed chalice glass from Gouden Carolus at 60 degrees. This beer definitely improved as it warmed to room temperature. 2011 addition, so nicely aged. Initially smells of alcohol with a hint of red wine. Taste of dark grape, cherry, raisins, figs some alcohol burn and carbonation on the finish . Very sweet like a fine wine or a heavenly dessert. Best beer I?ve had yet. Have not tried a fresh batch yet so cannot speak for that.

2012 Version reviewed in 2014(been aging it)11% crock smells like red wine. 1 finger head, dark brown, purple, type red, smell is caramel, dark fruit, malt, maybe little spice n wine like. Taste its crisp n bubbly a bit like beer n drinks like a beer but taste like wine or boose. plum, grape, malt sweetness, kinda heavy bodied, some caramel. no reall burn or taste of the 11% but after a hand full of sips it starts to kick in & depending on how much of the bottle you drink will determin how f-ed up you get. This beer could age like at least 3-5yrs I had it 2 yrs. Cheers!!!
This beer is fantastic! Caramel and raisins with very pleasant esters. Quite sweet compared to other beers of its style.

Flaske, 2011-årgangen, fra Holmens innerste kjeller: skibsreder Ovesen sukker henført, og det gjør jeg også. Hvem trenger vel konfekt med dette i glasset? Den perfekte avslutning på aktivitetsdag på Holmen. Vælværet brer seg i kropp og sjel. Et sublimt mesterverk på flaske.
2011 bottle. Beige head. Beer is reddish brown. Aroma of fine port, prunes, dates and dried red berries. Similar taste. Warming aftertaste of dried berries, cherries and prunes.

Bottle 2011. 750 ml (shared)
Appearance: Dark brown with a very small tan head.
Aroma: port wine, bread, toffee, (dried) red fruit and caramel and 
Taste: Starts off with a bit of spicey yeast which is run over fast by the huge malt sweetness (caramel, brown sugar).Which is followed by some fruity notes. Next this hug taste is further rounded off by a bit of alcohol. Before it finishes with Toasted malts and some wood/vanilla notes which lasts long. (Very nice) . 
ALchohol seems to work here as a booster of the whole taste palate in good way and thats how it should work.

Body is full, fine carbonation,mouthfeel creamy allmost sticky feel, but it works well.

Bottle. 2000 and 2002 vintage. Deep brown liquid with small off-white head. Aroma of raw sugar, port wine, bread, toffee, dried fruit and caramel. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, raisins and port wine. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Nice.
2010 750ml bottle pours a dark brown with a slight tan head. Big apple and fig aroma. Taste is the same with some dark fruit finish.

75 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Hogerdijk, Culemborg. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of dark fruits (raisins, plums) and malts. Taste is spicy and malty with a lot of complex fruit flavours. Creamy mouthfeel. A truly great beer.
Starts with a pleasant aroma of green apples. Sweet on the palate. As it warms the taste of caramel joins the green apple for a very nice smooth finish.

Pours a dark brown with a red tint and is topped by a thin but tenacious white head that leaves really good lacing. Aroma is of spices, sugar, fruits and feeling belgian overall. You can feel a little of the alcohol content there, too. Some light smoke too or maybe Im imagining things... Taste is really sweet with bananas and treacle. This is so close to being cloying but its not. Body is full, mouthfeel almost sticky. This is really heavy, yo. A really nice sipper and quite appropriate for the time of the year. Happy holidays, people of Ratebeer!

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 (75 cl bottle from Belgisk Bryg; 2013 vintage) Pours dark brown with a thin, tan head that quickly becomes film. Lots of beautiful lace. Aroma has plenty of Belgian strong ale treats somewhat remniscient of the Westvleteren XII or Rochefort 10: Banana, chalk, caramel and dark fruits. Creamy texture, soft carbonation, medium yet rich body and a somewhat sweet finish. Flavour is complex, multi-facetted caramel, dark fruit angel-soft yet not cloying. Extremely well crafted and very drinkable. A masterpiece.

Very strong fruity Belgium beer. 
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2006 Bottle ... called Grand Cru. Pours dark brown with head and lace. Aroma of rich malts, slight oxidation. Flavors of caramel, molasses, powder sugar, dark roasted malts, malt extract. Overall big, sweet, flavorful.
Flaske, 75 cl. Årgang 2013. Uklar mørkebrun, lavt beige skumhovede. Sødlig maltet. Kompleks næse. Blommer i madeira, svesker, krydret, anis, brun sukker, ingefær. Stor krop. Dejlig meditations-øl.

Une bière digne dune empereur pour mon 500e rating! Bouteille 750ml, 2012. Couleur brune très foncée et opaque, mousse beige foncée crémeuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de caramel foncé, alcool, pain brioché, toffee. Goût de noix, caramel, malt, sucré, alcool léger, fruité, figue, dattes. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, corps dense, collante. Excellente.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 2013/12/08 - Pours a hazy dark brown with an amber tint with a small, fizzy, khaki head that dissipates quickly and leaves ample lacing. Aroma is dark fruit (plumbs and raisins), toffee, brown sugar and sweet malts. Taste is sweet malts, caramel, molasses, plumbs raisins, brown sugar and slight vanilla. Mouthfeel is heavy with low-medium, smooth carbonation and a warming, slightly boozy finish. A very sweet, high quality Belgian strong. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 bottle poured into a trappist glass. Pours a murky amber to brown with a velvety head of beige foam. Sheets of lacing down the side of the glass. Aroma has notes of hot yeast, prunes, figs, sugary sweet. Some spice notes. The taste has a lot of sugary sweetness throughout. An alcohol heat comes through pretty strongly and especially in the finish. Thick mouthfeel and a subtle carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2014 Cuvée 2009 75cl bue en 2013 après donc 4 ans de cave. Sublime tout simplement. Proche de la perfection. La meilleure bière que jaie eu à goûter dans ce style.
Jai pu goûter une bouteille de 2004 en 2013 et là, le sublime était encore plus impressionnant. Vraiment la meilleure des dégustations !
Pours with a big head; brown in colour with a hint of red. Dark fruity sweet taste with a bit of alcohol burn compared to other Belgium beers.

Impulse buy from numerous displays at a Wegmans.  2013 corked bomber into Trappist glass, deep dirty dark brown color with light tan head. Aroma of sweet malt, dark dried fruits (raisins, plums, dates), brown sugar, toffee and a slight red wine note. Taste is huge malt sweetness (caramel, brown sugar, molasses); introducing notes of fruit (berries, pear, apples), light chocolate and slight vanilla/woody notes. Heavy body, low carbonation, soft, creamy with sweet toasty finish. Very complex sweet Belgian strong, hugely enjoyed.

2011. couleur ambre très foncé, nez sur le moka, le chocolat noir, avec quelques fruits (prunes cuites, cerises noires). Bouche puissante mais lalcool est bien intégré, caramel torréfié, réglisse, un tout petit peu de sucre, café, fruits cuits. Longue finale. Bière censée bien vieillir : vérification dans 10ans.
Dark hazy brown. Aroma of raisin and brown sugar. Taste is sweet and malty. Dark fruit and candy stand out.
Aroma is a little lacking but the taste is incredible. Feels good on the palate and looks good. Overall an excellent beer.

FROM NOTES: August 8, 12
Poured on draft at The Trappist into a Gouden Carolus tulip. 

A: Dark, malty notes of brown sugar and caramel with some plum, dark cherry and cola notes.
A: Pours an opaque, deep mahogany with bronze highlights and a finger-width creamy khaki colored head; decent retention, nice walls of lacing. I cannot fathom a better looking beer. 
T: Big, bold taste with spicy yeast up front, followed by fruitiness and sweet malt giving way to a slight crisp bitter taste at the finish, along with more malt. Im a little surprised at the sweetness of this beer. 
P: Medium to full bodied with moderate to high amounts of carbonation. Very creamy. 
O: This is one of the more sugary Belgians on the market, but that is part of its appeal. If youve previously enjoyed Chimay Blue or Rochefort 6, I would highly recommend trying this beer. My favorite of the Carolus offerings.

brown colour with reddish notes, huge beige head which lasts forever; aroma of brown sugar, dried fruits and alcoholic notes; taste of roasted malt and sugar, fruitness and some bitterness; 11%ABV is surprisingly hidden - great belgian strong ale

2012 Vintage, cellared for one year. Bottle from LCBO. Smells of brown sugar, booze, dates. Dark rich brown reminiscent of cola, thin head which is reabsorbed quickly. Tastes startlingly sweet right from the outset. A very rich full flavour of fruits, raisins, almost a red wine-like intensity. Creamy mouth-feel reflective of the lower carbonation. One of those beers that would step in nicely as a wine.

Belgian yeast, dark fruit, rum, raisins, a bit of coffee and brown sugar. Everything you look for a in a belgian strong, if not overly complex. Dark brown, long lasting off white head. Quite good, upfront dry and malty but finishes with a really amazing brown sugar note. Quite well balanced, not cloyingly sweet. Not overly complex but hits what it does quite well. Above average carbonation and light/medium bodied. Hides alcohol very well.

It's a bit of a smack on the head, but what a smack. If you want a pint if wine, drink this instead. 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10
Amber-ruby color with beige persistent head. Nice malt caramel, toffee and candi sugar aroma. At taste is sweet and so drinkable. Fruity and malty flavour.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2013 2013 vintage. Dark hazy pour with almost no head. Heavy red wine and dark fruits aroma. Boozy red fruit taste, cherries and berries,  sweet character of caramel and toffee and licorice.  Really red wine like. Medium bodied mouthfeel leaning towards dry. Very nice beer, but on the heavy alcoholic side. Nice sharer.

Feb 2012 vintage. Pours a dark red/brown with no head. Doesnt look quite the beer I was hoping for. Smell is apple, rhubarb, bourbon. Body is medium to light with nice level of carbonation. Taste - dark fruits, dates, more apple, alcohol comes through noticeably and gives the beer a whisky/medicinal feel, bit of pinot noir, raisins in the finish. Reminds me of a barrel aged La Trappe Quad. This beer has some good elements but overall Im not amazed. Im particularly disappointed by the lack of body.

Bottled February 4, 2013 (~9 months old).
Appearance: The body is an ugly muddy brown with hints of red through it, the head is tall and dense, like a latte. The head is very persistent, maintaining a dense and creamy figure with a tan hue. Even after multiple sips, the head is still thick and persistent, its a thing of beauty.
Aroma: The aroma is big on fig and mildly medicinal grape with a big malt base behind it, reminding me of brown sugar and toffee and hints of apple. This has good strength and leans sweet.
Taste: Big malts and big fruitiness here. The intro is medicinal grape heavy, which is a prominent flavor throughout along with sweet apple. Underlying that is a big caramel and brown sugar presence and a general malty sweetness. The finish is of fig and a mild lingering brown sugar, sweet and fruity.
Palate: Thick and full bodied, soft carbonation. Very creamy.
Overall: This is a big beer done well. The flavor is very strong with dark fruits and the malts provide a sweetness that accompanies it nicely. This is a beer that begs to be sipped and one to be shared.

750 ml bottle. Great nose of dark fruits (raisin, dates and maybe plum) nice yeast as well. Flavor is again dark fruits, molasses, sugar cookies and maybe flavor is sweetened dates. The fruity yeast and malt and married together really well. Soft carbonation gives a creamy smooth texture. A bit syrupy sweet with sugar but still a real nice sipper.

75cl bottle into tulip. Lille. 2013 edition. 

Appearance: very dark brown. Caramel appearance. Minimal head. 

Aroma: rich in caramel, roasted barley, alcohol, prune.

Taste: sweet, slight bitterness in the long finish.

Palate: full body good level of soft carbonation. Long, dynamic finish. Vey rich.

Overall: a really terrific beer. I am exited to get more for cellaring. Very rich and full, a great beer for winter. Not as much berry flavor as some strong ales. No sour. Rich and sweet.

Bottled 06.28.12.
Metallic strong. Sweet cherry, tootsie roll candy sweet, root beer soda, vanilla. 
Lower CO2 feel for a Belgian, smooth as could be, syrupy sweetness, no booze. Brown, lighter chocolate. Drinking near room temp. Mouth gets a little numb after each sip. Light fizz sensation near the back adds to the rich chewy malts without alcohol burn.

75cl bottle at the Waterhuis, Gent shared with new friends made at the INSEP Conference. Pours thick and darkdarkdark brown with slightly off-white head. Smells like licorice, raisin, and caramel. The first taste assaults the senses with a heavy sweet-bodied taste with a tinge of burnt bitterness to finish. Intense and rather abrupt, like a beery kick in the face. Absolutely delicious beer.

Very dark brownish red. Light beige colored head. Aroma of sweet dark fruits and jelly, caramel malts, and vanilla. Taste is slightly boozy, quite sweet, mildly bitter and woody. Medium-full bodied; a little syrupy.
Couleur brun foncé avec un petit col. Malté et doux avec des notes de fruits noirs, de caramel et dalcool. Très riche en saveur.

Pours a brownish red amber with a quickly settling brown head. Aroma is raisins, caramel, molasses, ripe apples, figs. Taste is lovely, with caramel, dates, raisins, molasses, apples, butterscotch, slight vinous and vanilla tones. Aftertaste is overripe candied apples, vanilla and honey. Fantastic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2013 versie: Donker, bijna zwart bier met mokkakleurig schuim. Aroma is een overdaad aan rood fruit, gist, caramel en suiker, maar dat laatste zonder al te zoet of te kunstmatig aan te doen. Zeer zacht palet, licht tot medium co2, volle body. Erg zoet, maar op een prettige manier. Medium bitter. Ben benieuwd hoe deze is na een langere tijd, maar vers dus al erg aan te raden.

33cL bottle, 2011 edition (aged 2 years). Beautiful pour, brown cloudy beer with a medium head. Nice aroma, sweet & alcoholic. Pleasant flavor, with plum and licorice tastes, dark fruits, figs, heavy and dark. Good, but not quite epic. Still very tasty, quite complex.

Small head. Low carbonation. Fruity plummy notes. Some caramalty aromas. Quite sweet. Strong alcohol feeling. Some spicyness. Not impress. I am not on the sweet site though.

Simply Epic beer. Was lucky enough to get a case of these from the brewery and couldnt resist drinking a couple this last week. Very sweet, but you wouldnt want it any other way. Worth hunting down.

750ml bottle shared at home. Pours a clear brown, lighter than expected, with a long-lasting off-white head. Aromas of ripe, perhaps cooked, plums. Almonds, demerera sugar, touch of higher alcohols. Hmmm. Sweet. But the prickly carbonation cuts through it to reveal a faint bitterness. The perfect after-dinner beer!
UPDATED: OCT 29, 2013 Dark ripe black fruit aroma. Raisins maybe. Veru complex. Goes very well with chocolat.

Brune rougeâtre, pétillance moyenne, col beige fin. Caramel rôtis dominent en entrée avant de se faire rattraper par le sucre candi et les fruits noirs, sans oublier les notes de chocolat. ABV un peu trop présent à mon goût. Plus complexe quelle nen a lair, dautant que le vieillissement doit clairement la bonifier.

typical of the style, it was heavy with dark fruits and grains in both taste and aroma. lots of figs, dates, currants, raisins and a bit of whiskey bite. sweet and somewhat oily finish. good example of the style.

A 750 ml bomber purchased at Liberty Wine Merchants on Commercial Drive in Vancouver. This is the 2012 version.
Damn, this is good shit! Oops, sorry, that just sort of slipped out of my mouth. I cant believe I said that! Too bad this site editor doesnt feature emoticons. ;-)
Anyhoo...a very dark liquid concoction with a quite fulsome reddish-tan head and substantial lacing lingering on the glass. Nosing imparts impressions of sweet fruits and malts, with promises of more delights to come!
For full appreciation of the taste, first swill some Budweiser (or some such), then have a wee sip of this nectar. Aha! Unfortunately (after the big buildup) I do not have the all-discerning palate (imagination?) that some members apparently do, so Ill stick with generalities: fruits, but not citrus, malt, caramel, perhaps a bit of spice. No hop detected. Very complex taste impressions to be found here. Finish is long and oh so sweet!

Refrigerated 11.2 brown bottle, produced on January 7, 2011, poured into a trappist glass. Pours dark brown with medium light brown head. Dark candy sugar aroma, medium body, medium carbonation, and medium small bubble lacing. Taste is dark candy sugar, caramel, some dark fruit, and a hint of heat in the finish.  Great beer.

A very good grand cru. Pours a beautiful dark red/black. Smells like cherries and bananas. Lots of cherries in the taste, along with some green apples. Very rich, starts sweet, and finishes like cheese cake. Leaves a great thick aftertaste. Can get a little bit intensely sweet though, hard to drink a lot. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brown almost black beer with a small tanned head. Dark dried fruits, yeasty, malty caramell aroma. Dried dark fruits, smooth, malty, caramell and yeasty.
Had at around 10-12C. Big typical belgian strong ale flavours, with a little extra emphasis on caramel/toffee. Great beer, and can not wait for another one.
Koppar brun med litet skum. Doft: Plommon, övermogen ananas och äpplen, vin, skumbanan, mjölkchoklad, örter. Smak: Plommon, äpple, mango, örter, lite madeira, alkohol.

750 ml 2011 bottle opened Aug 2013 poured a dark brown hue w/ a small beige head that reduces to a small lingering cap w/ thick lacing. Big aromas of sweet caramel, raisin, and brown sugar. Initial flavor is a heavy sweet w/ a light bitter finish of short duration. Tastes are plum, fig, molasses, toast, toffee, caramel, raisin, prune, brown sugar, and chocolate. Medium to full bodied, lively carbonation, creamy mouthfeel and a moderate warmth in the finish.
Delicious. Blueberry and not at all bitter. I wonder how it would taste if I'd kept it for ten years. Don't have that kind of patience though.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2013 750 ml bottle into tulip glass, 2010 vintage. Pours moderately hazy and cloudy dark reddish brown color with a 2 finger fairly dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Good spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big caramel, raisin, plum, fig, molasses, toast, toffee, brown sugar, dark bread, dark candi sugar, pepper, light clove, light chocolate, light roast, and yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with huge complexity and great balance of dark malt and fruity/spicy yeast esters; with big strength. Taste of caramel, molasses, toast, raisin, prune, fig, brown sugar, toffee, dark bread, light chocolate, herbal, light roast, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, molasses, toast, brown sugar, toffee, raisin, prune, dark bread, light chocolate, light roast, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Absolutely incredible complexity and balance of molasses/bready malt and dark fruit flavors; with a big malt presence and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and full bodied; with a creamy, slick, and lightly crisp mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible Belgian strong dark ale! All around incredible balance and complexity of dark malt and dark fruit flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the gravity. An insanely delicious offering.

Draft. Hazy deep brown pour, small tan head, little retention/lace. Aroma of prune, raisin, molasses, fruity ester, caramel. Taste is quite sweet, prunes, raisin, brown sugar, fruity ester, port, booze. Palate is soft, sticky, coating, sweet finish.

Une merveilleuse brune aux arômes incomparables. Douce et puissante à la fois  fruitée, sucrée, juste à point. Le dosage peut parfois faire la différente entre une excellente bière et une mauvaise bière; cette cuvée Van De Keizer penche du bon côté de la balance. Un classique belge à ouvrir jalousement.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 Gouden Carolus Blue on tap at the Thirsty Monk in Asheville (and revised with botle consumed April 2014). 
Very dark reddish-brown; clear, with a small but very durable head. Decent lacing. 
Nice, fruity, plum dominated aroma. Slight solvent-like note to the flavor, probably an alcohol ester. Still, not terribly boozy for 11% ABV. 
Medum-full body; very smooth.
O: disappointing due to very high expectations.
Its very sweet. Doesnt linger on the tongue. Dark and smooth, but with an unabashed sweetness upon the first touch of your tongue.

On tap, pours a medium Brown with hints of mahogany and a unique antique white head with some lacing. The aroma is light of roasted malts, some dark grape juice, and a lot of sweet sugariness. The flavor follows suit with a rich roasted malt flavor that its really not very heavy, some Belgian yeast fruits of grape/raisin and apple/pear, with a massive sugary sweetness. That sweetness overruns most everything after a while but it still makes for an amazing beer.

ES-PEC-TA-CU-LAR!. Esto es una Sra. Cerveza, si me pidieran que eligiese bebidas representativas de la tierra, para una civilizacion extraterrestre: La Carolus Cuvee Van De Keizer Bleu, sería una de ellas.

From bottle at a tasting at Bar & Cigar. Dark ruby with a beige head. Aroma of raisins amd other dried fruits, malt, caramel and notes of Belgian yeast. Reminds me a bit of fortified wine. Sweet with strong flavour of dried fruitd and only a light bitterness in the finish, but still quite well balanced. A bit too much on the sweet side for me, but still a very nice beer.
This beer, though unsuspecting at first, upon encountering the aftertaste turns out to be incredible. Id describe it as a dark ale with an aftertaste of the best Jolly Rancher youll ever have.

Tried in a group tasting. Pours a beautiful red with little head but lots of perfect lace. Aroma is a big dried fruit with lots of big plum. Fantastic. Taste and palate is big syrup and sweetness, but in a great way. The alcohol is also really big. Great aftertaste with lots if warming alcohol throughout. Feel is big and full the whole way through. Spectacular beer!

No head, looks like cherry cola. Aroma of dark fruits, boozy sweetness. Tastes of port soaked dates, brown sugar. Doesnt taste as boozy as the nose suggests. Alcoholic plums on the finish. Overall starts with a lot of sweetness but levels out to reveal a very well balanced beer.

Pours all bubbly and soda-like, wafting of darkfruits/plums. Tan-white head is thick and slow to fade. Color is a rich honey brown and slight cloudy garnet in direct light. Tastes of sweet, sweet malt, plum and ripe bananas. Yeast comes through in a nicely thick mouthfeel. Aftertaste has echoes of wine. Alcohol is largely disguised by the sweetness. A very fine beer.

Dark cider/brown color; Medium slightly cream body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, some yeast, caramel, syrup, rich dark fruit (notably plums & figs), and spice; Nicely balanced; The alcohol is well hidden; Overall, quite sweet - but tasty.

Colour: Dark ruby. Thin head.
Nose: Fruits (plum, raisins, banana). Like wine. Malt sweetness with coffee and nuts.
Flavours: Wine-like fruitiness. Roasted almonds, vanilla, syrup. Very sweet and slightly sticky. No indication of alcoholic content. Licorice, bubblegum. Biscuits and toasted bread.
Finish: Long and intense, sweet with a slight hint of bitterness. Lingering.
Verdict: Astonishing. Superb barley wine, one of the best in my opinion.

700mL bottle from Sherbrooke Pours a deep dark brown with an average tan head that fades fairly quickly. Medium carbonation. Aroma is a complexity of spiciness, roast malt, and a slight yeasty whiff. Taste is perfectly smooth, a subtle mix of numerous flavours (black currant, plum fruitiness, strong sweet malt/chocolate/alcohol character,hint of yeast), that are extremely well balanced. Magnificent.

Huge malty, banana, vanilla, honey, spiced aroma. Sips moderate to full bodied. Actually thinner than expected. Big banana flavors surround this beer. Also a slight cough syrup flavor mixed in. Very spiced and sweet. Nice complex flavors and the abv is very warming. This brew would be great w/ some gingerbread cookies by the fire in the dead of winter. Not so much in the summer in S.Fla
Uit 0,75l fles @ proeverij Charlies. Aroma van gedroogd fruit, kleur kastanje bruin met fijn laagje crème schuim. Smaak vol zoete gerstewijn butterscotch, boerenjongens, alcohol en volle afdronk.

2006 vintage. 11 per cent. Drunk from 75cl bottle. Dark, strong ale similar to the rochefort or westvleteren 12s. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brune Aux reflets rouge. Banane. Caramel. Tire dérable. Très sucré. Rhum. Malté. Ronde. Crémeuse. Fruité. Pomme cuite. Tarte. Beurre. Fine chaleur dalcool. Épice. Anis. Fruit confit. Vanille. Datte. Raisin sec. Crème brûlé. Riche. La plus belle oeuvre jamais créée sur terre.

Bottle at home. Ca. 3 years old. Has a dark brown colour with a beige medium head. Sweet aroma with dried fruit, chocolate truffles, wood and wild berries. Much of the same in a sweet, complex and fantastic flavour. Has a rich and slick mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A wonderful, sweet and totally balanced ale.
2012 750ml bottle pours dark amber with a silkey tan head. nose of vanilla, caramel, and burnt sugar. taste is slighty sweet with additions on cherry and plum. body is silky smooth. epic.
Mooi donker bier. Ruikt, caramel, koffie en, chocolade. Smaakt bijzonder, maar iets te zoet.
Pours a nice brown reddish beer with a good white head. Smells like red wine. Taste is licorice. A bit to sweet.

Bottle->Trappist.  Dark murky brown with medium frothy offwhite head.  Aroma is sweet, with figs, dark fruit, spices.  Taste is sweet dark fruit, malt, molasses.  Quite sweet, boozy.  Very good, and best of the Carolus series.

Cloudy brown. Has all the characteristics of a quad except good head. The aroma is basement, dark fruit and bitter hops. The taste is ripe plum, ginger, dark sugar and yeast. The body is both fizzy then flat one after the other. The alcohol is well hidden and the beer finishes with a kick of bitterness.

Been wanting to try this for a while.  Wonderful aroma of figs and sweet fruits.  Taste is a rich caramel, a little nutty.  This is a great beer - sorry I waited so long for my first but will not wait long for my second!

Bottle. Brown almost black beer with a small tanned head. Dark dried fruits, yeasty, malty caramell aroma. Dried dark fruits, smooth, malty, caramell and yeasty. Really a wounderful beer :-) Love in a bottle :-)

Cerveja excepcional, complexa, encorpada, notas de caramelo, castanha e ameixa, álcool bem presente com agradável sensação de calor do palato e retrogosto com sensação de quero mais. Certamente uma das grandes cervejas que já tomei, também porque foi degustada no aniversário de minha mamãe. Inesquecível !
I am not the biggest Belgian style fan but this brew blows me away! Really enjoyed having the 2012 at the 1 year mark!

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. This is a very dark brown beer that pours with a creamy tan head. It has sweet, rich red fruity and vinous flavours, chocolate notes, spiciness, candi sugar and a warming vanilla finish.
Aroma: Red fruit, caramel Appearance: Red amber, fine foam, fine lace Taste: Red fruit, raisin, porto

Dark brown. Aroma is dark fruits and caramel richness. Taste is liquere sweet, dark fruits. Flavour deepens and lingers as it warms; mild bitterness. Palate is fruity sticky. Overall, very rich and tasty. Abv well hidden. Only critique -  not super complex.

Poured in May 2013 from a 750 ml bottle dated 2011 and cellared since March 2011. Virtually opaque, dark-orange rusty brown with a 2-finger creamy khaki head and that lingers and eventually leaves excellent lacing. Aroma of raisins, dark fruit, figs, prunes, cherries, sweet roasted malt, toffee and English trifle. Taste of raisins, brown sugar, prunes, cherries, sweet roasted malt, toffee, chocolate, Russian black cherry loaf and sweet sherry. Sweet, but stunningly delicious. A fabulous dessert by its own right. Full/medium body and medium carbonation. The aging has removed all bitterness, leaving a sweet, fruity, complex and utterly delicious dessert beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 bottle. Dark red brown with a slight off white head. No noticeable carbonation. Big aroma, really good. Malt, treacle, licorice, caramel, candy - just lovely sweet shop aromas, and booze. And beautiful flavour, all kinds of caramel sweetness and so well balanced.  So smooth. Just lovely.
Wow. A honey sweet Belgian strong ale with champagne bubbles and a silky smooth palate. This tastes like the promise that braggat never lives up to. My new favorite beer.

2011 version. Dark brown pour with slight reddish hint. Massive and lasting thick head, and sweet aroma of malt and ripe fruits. Taste reflects the aroma, but is even more intense with raisin, plums, sweet carmel. I find it intensely sweet to the point of being overdone. Finish is lingering sweet malt with all the flavor notes in tact. Looks like this one gets aged a lot, and I can see why.

In a 750 ml bottle, sounds great when popped, lots of aroma in the pour, cherries, apple, blackberry, blueberry, sweet caramel malt, rich Christmas pudding. A slow sipping fine Belgian ale, the abv is well hidden. Very sweet, tasty and delicious.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2013 EDIT:THE SCORE REPRESENTS THE 2012 BOTTLE. 750 ml bottle, vintage 2000. The oldest beer I have ever drunk. ABV 8.5% this time, again into a tulip glass. Colour is a beautiful deep red ruby one, with one thin line of beige head on top. Low retention and no lacing left on the glass.
Very nice aroma of fortified wine, like a porto or a mavrodaphne. A bit of sugar and spices. Taste is sweet and less wine-y now. Some sugars on the taste and a bit of caramel.
Quite thin body and much less carbonation than what I remember, to the poitn that you could say its watery.
Overall, if you have a bottle that old in your cellar still, open it before its too late. The 2012 was an exceptional beer, this one lacks in everything, the aroma, the taste and much more on the mouthfeel.

750 ml bottle, vintage 2012, at home, all alone. Poured into a tulip glass. ABV 11%.
Great appearance, with a very deep ruby colour on the body, even more beuatiful when the light happes to pass through it. On top of it a two fingers tall head, beige in colour, with good retention and medium lacing left around the glass.
The aroma is to die for! Very wine-y, lots of black grapes, less caramel, sugars, spices. Trully excellent!
Wow, what a taste! Also very wine-like, brings to mind the greek mavrodaphne (or mavrodafni) wines. Alcohol very well hidden, no way I could tell this is 11% if I hadnt see it on the bottle. Again, some sugars, some spices, a little bit of prunes too.
Nice thickness on the body, with the carbonation being as much as it is needed.
Overall this is a great beer, its hard to believe that is so widely available and in a such a low price as well. I would give it a perfect score but I think Ill reserve that for the bottle I have from 2000.
Pours dark brown with medium head.  Aroma is hot and sweet. Flavor is candied fruit and sugar, again with the heat. Like the best fruit cake youve ever had.  Great beer.
aroma,  alcohol, maybe some notes of bread.    fine maple color,  the head is thin,  sweet beer with a slight bitter aftertaste with long body,.  fine soft carbonation.
Sweetness really hits you on the nose and hints of the full body. Taste is plums and almost licorice like. Yum
My favorite... Great lacing and taste... Color is great... Nothing bad to say.... Love it

Hard to describe this beer because it was different than anything Ive had including other Belgians. Bit in a good way, it was amazing. Alcohol was well masked. I remember it being dark with red, head that doesnt last. Well balanced and very complex. A whole array of malt and fruit flavors melded together.

75cl bottle from dranken Geers in Oostakker. Bottle date 2013. Dark brown body with beige head. Aroma of smoke and roasted malts. Taste of drop, caramel and drop. The previous year was less "smoked" what i prefered. ***

75cl bottle. Dark brown with small to medium, ivory head. Nose : toffee, vanilla, red fruits, dried raisins, dates. Milk chocolate. Sip : smooth and oily. Decent carbonation. Sweet and fruity with very well balanced complex aromas. Really good .

In a 750 ml bottle, sounds great when popped, lots of aroma in the pour, cherries, apple, blackberry, blueberry, sweet caramel malt, rich Christmas pudding. A slow sipping fine Belgian ale, the abv is well hidden. Very sweet, tasty and delicious.
Very dark, sweet and fruity. Extremely smooth considering 11% content. A shame that they dont brew larger quantities.

Pours dark brown with a quickly fading head.
Nose shows chocolate fudge, rum and raisin, dried prunes, spicy phenols, golden syrup. Lovely.
Equally rich and decadent flavours. Brown sugar, rum and raisin, dried dark fruit, soft booze, gingerbread. Stunning.
Carbonation could be just a bit higher.

I went to my favorite store in Atlanta, Hop City, home of Male and Female Beer Guru's, and asked for recommendation based around, lost Abbey's Judgement Day, and the Abt 12, and SHE recommended this. The bottle wasn't very appealing and I've never heard of the brewery, so I was a little shaky.... When I opened the cork, it sounded like pearly gates opening! This is an awesome Quad (full palate, lovely aroma, appearance, and superb flavor, I think it's at the top of my list... Note to self- listen to every recommendation she has for you. Thanks!

---BeerCh3f on BeerBuddy App
August 2010. From a 750 ml. bottle. Pours dark amber with a beige head. This is one balanced and complex beer. Lots of dark fruits, caramel, yeats, and spice with a slightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2013 2011 Cork and Cage 750ml @ 58°; clear deep amber brown body with a 2" light khaki head fading to a thin sheet, leaving cave painting lace; Aromas and flavors are complex and well integrated, dates, figs, apple pie, vanilla, white grapes, berries, cherries, caramel, faint soft milk chocolate, light spice; a mmh body is silky and slightly creamy, restrained carbonation, but enough to know its Belgian, a touch of heat leading to a drying, slightly roasty finish with coffee and cream blending into all the fruity sweet goodness; a great quad

2007. Quite fruity: smells of blueberries, figs, dates, and a kiss of Belgian yeast. Taste follows the same path, adding caramelized malts to the fray. Strawberries in the background. And deceptively easy to drink! Tasty stuff.
750 ml bottle. Excellent beer. Pours a murky brown colour with a medium white head. Aromas of fruits, toffee. Falvour of caramel. Full body.

Bottle @ home. Aroma è di frutti rossi acidi , come ribes o amarene. Cè un sentore di caramello e (forse) liquerizia.  esteticamente è molto bella, con schiuma color kahki , colore rosso scuro con acceni in controluce color rubino, ferma nel bicchiere. In bocca ha una carbonatazione soft, un corpo medio di consistenza oleosa, che rimane a lungo su lingua e palato. Il luppolo cè ma non si avverte dato il ggrado alcolico ed il gusto dolce/acido. in bocca ricorda le strong dark ale di natale. La prossima bottiglia la farò invecchiare perchè mi apsettavo più complessità e più tenore alcolico.

75cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear ruby/brown with tiny tan head. 
Aroma cherry, apple, dark fruits, caramel, vanilla, yeast, spice.
Taste vanilla sweet, bit sour, little bitter. 
Mouthfeel slik, creamy. 
Really nice beer. Complex, great nose and taste.

75 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100722.
Pours murky brown color with a medium sized head. Aroma of ripe fruits, caramel malts, some wooden notes, yeast, spices and toffee. Flavor of licorice, caramel malts, ripe dark fruits, spices and mild yeast. Full bodied and quite complex. Top notch.

11.2oz bottle, 2011 vintage. From Party Source. Cloudy dark brown / red color. Good thin creamy khaki head. Good lace. Kind of an oaky, vanilla nose. Dark fruit aroma. Raisins. Bigger body.
