Moderate carbonation. More dry overall. Bitter, more sweet. Light spicy bite in the finish.. Some brown sugar. Some peat. Sweet taste, light bitter... Some alcohol in the finish, but no burn or bite, just light warmth with sips. Long, complex, spicy dark fruit aftertaste. Alright belgian strong. I see the appeal, just not really my thing. Best thing I can say about it really, is that the alcohol is well-hidden. Taste is a bit sweet for it to be drinkable, though

750 ml bottle (2012 vintage) from LCBO.  Pours a murky orangey brown with lasting tan head.  Aroma is full of sweet, rich dark fruits, toffee and spice.  Flavour is very sweet with raisins, prunes, toffee, molasses and a gentle spiciness.  Booziness is apparent but drinks nicely for the ABV.  A little sweet to drink a lot of, but quite impressive.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. An old favorite. Bready, dark fruits and light floral notes. A must have. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a cloudy raisin brown with half a head of effervescent head.  Dark fruit and brown sugar notes.  Brown sugar prominent in the taste.  Fairly heavy.  not bad but not my favorite of the style
Bottle gift from SJ. Belgian strong day. Nice notes of dark fruit, raisin, bread, caramel and hop. Nice sweet and bitter finish. One of the best strongs I ever had.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Color legno scuro con pannosa schiuma beige. Bilanciatissimo bouquet di toffee, uvetta, zucchero caramellato, pane, spezie e albicocche sciroppate, intensissimo negli aromi e nei sapori. Corpo pieno, liquorosa, vellutata e beverina; raccoglie tutte le caratteristiche delle strong ale scure e le eleva ad un livello superiore.

75 cl. bottle.  Pours a dark brown with a nice tan head.  Aroma of malt, yeast, fruit, and caramel.  Taste is malt, plums, yeast, other dark fruits, caramel, and spice.  A bit sweet.  Very nice sipper.
Bottle shared with northropfrye.  Aroma of figs and malts. Nice ivory head. Deep deep caramel colour. Flavour of roasted malts and dried fruit. In conclusion, I like this beer a lot. Go Belgium!

2012 bottle. Dark brown, almost black body with brown head and some lacing. Aroma of dried fruit, molasses, bubblegum, black felt markers and booze. Taste has an interesting acidic bitterness at first, but lots of fruity sweetness, and almost a cola quality. Id like the palate to be a bit more coating. Overall, I enjoyed it quite a bit.

2012 Vintage bottle from the LCBO. Pours a darker brown-red colour with a nice mocha cap that lasts quite long and gives out good lacing. Beautiful aromas of raisins, chocolate, roasted malts, caramel and even hints of rust. Lots of it reminds me of wine with the yeast and grapes. The taste is pretty sweet with toffee and caramel the whole way. Notes of plum, cherries, apples, cola and light nuts in the finish. The mouthfeel helps by not being to sticky or syrupy with the sugars. Quite complex, loaded with flavours / scents and pretty easy to drink for an 11% ABV. brew. Wish I would of bought more. Hope to see it next year.

Här hade jag något höga förväntningar och dessvärre infriades de inte, inte för att den var dålig men inte tillräckligt bra. Jag skulle nog ha låtit den ligga i ett år eller så. Fruktigt och kraftig men kanske lite i obalans.
[Ölprovning @ my place 20130301] Söt och jäsig aroma. Har lite svår för de belgiska ölen, brukar ofta tycka att aroman är mer behaglig en själva smaken.

Top 3 beer for me, I especially loved the one I had that I let age for half a year, cant wait to have my next one in a couple of years! Belgian Strong Ale that is dominated by the warm alcohol feel and a complex mix of yeast, malt, caramel, and dark fruits. My second bottle was heavy in prune, plum and dates in its flavour, with a caramel and warm aroma. A sipper to be sure, but one that never feels overbearing. Those who prefer their beers a little less sweet might not like this beer as much as I do, but this remains one of my favourites.
Beautiful 0,75l bottle. Rich aroma. Brown, caramel, a tad sweet. The sweetness covers up the alcohol so quite dangerous. A sipper, Nice present because of the bottle. very nice.

Bottled, 0.75l. Clear dark brown color with medium creamy tan-like head and moderate lacing. Aroma of rich malt, strong caramel note, raisins, figs, plums, yeast and spicy hops. Taste starts with sweet and rich caramel malt, while followed by dried fruits, fresh and spicy yeast. Alcohol was not in the first plan, but slaps you from the back soon after. Sweetness prevails on mild bitterness. Full body, sticky syrupy texture and average natural carbonation in palate. Felt like a king when drinking it, although a bit too sweet...
2011 bottle, maybe should have left it a few more years to see what flavors were still to come. Lovely beer. Only downside is a bit too sweet so was a slow drinker.

Dark brown with a small amount of head. Fruity yeasty smell with apple, caramel. Very sweet fruity taste with some noticeable booze. There's a little weird bitter in the aftertaste that is a little off putting, but not terribly noticeable. Mostly the sweet fruit in the taste and some yeastiness. Too sweet overall, but decent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Black Bottle Brewery.  Dark, dark brown with an off white head.  The aroma is white wine, sweet malts and dark fruits.  Medium body with nice carbonation and feel.  The flavor is strong, sweet and rich and similar to the aroma.  Smooth and easy to drink for 11%, but definitely a sipper.

2012 vintage. 750 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a snifter. Pours clear mahogany with a tall, creamy tan head that remains and leaves lots of dense lace. The nose is malty with big molasses notes, along with figs, raisins, Belgian yeast, and hints of banana and caramel. The flavour is quite sweet throughout, with molasses, banana and figs paired with just a hint of grassy hops. On the palate, it is full in body with a smooth, syrupy texture and moderate carbonation. Overall, this is quite a nice Belgian strong ale, with a high degree of complexity and a very nice malt profile. It is a bit too sweet, and I feel that the sugar may be hiding some of the complexity. It would be interesting to age this one to see what flavours develop. 2012-11-16

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 
75 cl bottle vintage 2009 @ home, BBE 2019
Aroma has lots of raisins, some toffee, ripe fruits and hints of mold. Flavour has raisins, some toffee, alcohol, plums, brown sugar and ripe fruits. Good.


75 cl bottle @ Tammela vintage tasting, BBE 11.12.2017. Rated on 17.09.2016
Anise and licorice overdose but I love it! Harsh score estimate : 4.0.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dark brown with some red tints and a frothy head that settles into a thin layer. The aroma is burned chocolate and dark exotic sugars. The taste is predominantly sweet, almost as if it has been flavored with sugar after fermentation. To reach this sweetness with such a strong beer is remarkable, however maybe the beer itself is a tad too sweet. Not a bad beer at all.

The famous Emperors beer...bottled 12/07/2011. Heavy butterscotch and caramel aroma that doesnt hide the high proof at all. Dark tan color, looks blood mixed with brown sugar. Dont expect to see any head, this beer has the consistency and strength of barleywine or icebock. Taste is sweet like brown sugar and vanilla extract, tangy like dates and currants, and boozy like rum. Sort of like the Classic Carolous, only tune up for taste and strength, and down for body, which is viscous and slimy. Charles retired to be a monk, so this beer is appropriately named for him.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a thick frothy tan head. Nose is sweet and has some dark fruit elements. Taste is very sweet and darkly fruity - this is just a couple shades short of cough syrup. No me gusta.

2013.02.18 - Cuvée Van De Keizer Blauw (Blue) - 750ml bottle in goblet.

Pours a cloudy raisin brown, similar to Carolus Classic and others.  Not much head, whatever there was dissipated to almost nothing.

Aroma is a bit neutral, honestly, to me.

Mouthfeel is pretty light, really, given the abv.  It is mildly creamy, though. Not much carbonation.

Taste is fruits like figs, raisin, plum.  Some candy sugar, maybe.  Very similar to Carolus Classic.  Tasty, tasty stuff.  Not my first bottle but I never reviewed, apparently.  Several Het Anker brews are in my favorites list. This one does not disappoint, either.



Aroma 5/10, Appearance 4/5, Taste 9/10, Palate 4/5, Overall 18/20

Deep brown pour. Soft nuts and fruits - figs raisins, brown sugar. Very well balanced. Slight maltiness. Fantastic Belgian

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark beer with light brown creamy head. Aroma of malty, fruit and spices. Very smooth taste of sweets, dark fruit with a full body.

Light brown creamy head. Brown colour. Aroma is malty, fruity (raisins, dates) with spicy (cloves) and licorice notes. Flavor is malty too with dark fruits, candy and light alcohol notes., ending in a fruity, candy finish. Full bodied.

Murky dark brown with a beautiful creamy/foamy beige head. Sweet yet earthy nose with raisins, blueberry, honey almond, unsweetened granola and earthy toffee malt. Carbonation was a little lacking but the flavor is sublime. Dark fruity notes like raisin and date combine with toffee, honey, and earthy dark sweet maltiness. Wowee.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2013 330ml bottle at BXL East dated 11/7/2011 at 11.0% ABV. Very excited to try this beer. Pours amber/plum a bit cloudy. Aroma is fruity and boozy. Taste is fruity and malty and boozy. Taste has huge fruit notes: cherries, plums, raisins, and prunes. Fruit abound. Delicious.

Cellared bottle - vintage 2006 - popped this one open for the Super Bowl - pours a murky brown color, thin film head (nice pop with the uncorking was nice to hear).  Aroma is very sweet and inviting...dark fruit, loads of malt, grape notes, slight hint of booze.  Flavor mimics the flavor nicely - very sweet and rich, loads of dark fruit (raisin shines), a wine-like feel deeper inside the beer...slight bitterness at the end to round things out a bit - quality.  Palate was good - slick and full with a nice warming at the end.  Happy to have another one to give a few more years to...
Dark brown colour. Aroma has some alcohol, caramel and dark fruit. Its very sweet with dried fruit flavours but that matches well with the high alcohol. Thick and warming.

Pours a clear iced tea colour with some offwhite head. Intense banana, dried fruit, and corn syrup aromas. Very sweet flavours....fake banana and dried fruit flavours. Boozy finish. I found this cloyingly sweet, and the flavours were too artificial for my taste.

2012. 750ml bottle. A deep amber body, medium mocha head with an orange shade. Good retention and plenty of lacing. Aroma of yeast, sour cherry, caramel, dark chocolate, spices, figs. Taste is very smooth and sweet: tons of caramel, molasses, dates, aromatic herbs. Alcohol well hidden. Sticky.

Dark cocacolaish with nice head.Aroma strong cherry, dark fruits, malt. Taste well balanced with sweet candy malt, dark fruits, cherry, and some bitter hops also some alcohol. Full body, finish bittersweet.

It pours copper with ruby highlights; the head is beige and foamy. The aroma has notes of: soy sauce, toffee, alcohol, figs, pumpernickel, and nuttiness. The taste is heavy sweet and medium umami; there are notes of: soy sauce, figs, cough syrup, liquorice, candy-sugar, toffee, and molasses. The palate is full medium-full bodied, sticky, light carbonation, and a long finish. Overall, very well balanced for how sweet it starts.
Bottle shared by marcus. 2006 vintage. Aroma is sweet some grapes. Taste is sweet with a candy flavor. Has lots of dark fruits.

Shared with my wife at the Bayou. Poured from a 750 ml bottle. Huge malt character, raisin, prune, burnt sugar, slight tartness on the finish. Alcohol is very well hidden. Truely an amazing beer. Happy New Year!

Appears dark brown with a small tan head. Smell is like spices, light roasted malts, vanilla candle. Taste is slightly candy sweet, smooth spices a hint of tang and roasted malts, very balanced and complex. Body is med. Carbonation soft. After taste is long and complex. This is one of my favorites instantly.

Ansprechend süßlicher Duft, Pflaume, Lebkuchen und Wein schwingen mit. Süßer, malziger Antrunk. Anschließend gewürzig, malzig, Trockenfrüchte und leicht alkoholisch. Abgangs Mandarine, süßmalzig, Schokolade und Toffee, dabei wärmend, weich und samtig auf der Zunge. Ein großartiges Bier!

750ml Bottle - Copper in colour. Spicy and fruity aroma with notes of fruitcake and aniseed. Fruity, tangy and spicy taste with notes of dried fruit, spice and yeast. Would like to age this and see how it improves.

75cl bottle shared with Steve.Poured a dark brown with small brown head.Lots of aromas on this one including malt,caramel,fruit and bread.Tasted sweet and malty and the dark fruit came through well alongside bread,yeast,figs,raisins and plum.This was well balanced and delicious.2011 vintage.

Appearance: very dark brown, very thick tan colored head, laces nicely, head so thick you can walk on it Aroma: very fruity, orange, chocolate, caramel, very aromatic Taste: very rich, malty, roasted flavor, sweet, plum Palate: leaves a lingering malty aftertaste, thick on the tongue Overall: this is an intensely flavorful beer, not a session beer, hides the alcohol well, 2012 vintage ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled, thx rlgk. Pours dark brown with a small brown head. Smells caramel malty, fruity, abit figs and raisins. Tastes creamy, caramel malty, fruity, figs, raisins, very well balance.

Pours a dark murky brown with a small tan head.  Aroma is sweet with bread, malt, dark fruit, and brown sugar.  Taste is very sweet with dark fruit and bready yeast with a bit of alcohol at the end.  Delicious beer.

Bottle.  Dark brown pour, head which reduces to some nice lacing and an aroma of plums and caramel.  Flavor is nice meld of rich alcoholic stone fruits, vanilla, some spicy herbs and a little vegetal alcohol on the finish.  Really nice beer.

2012 bottle. Pours brown with a fluffy tight sudsy head that settles to a foamy film. Aroma is light tart raisins, bananas yeast and toasted malt along with alcohol. Taste is boozy bananas more raisins and yeast with a little plum and fig and shows some medicinal characters that are off putting. Palate is medium fizzy and dry warming finish. Like to try this with 2 or 3 years on it. This bottle is about 10 months old.

Une délicieuse brune qui dénote beaucoup de caractère en entrée ; elle laisse des arômes boisées et caramélisées en finale. Épaisse, elle possède une couleur rouge-brun et des saveurs bien maltées. Légèrement fruitée.

Pours a dark brownish-red color with a minimal head.  I got plumb, caramel, and molasis on the nose.  Probably the sweetest thing Ive ate or drank since I was 10.  Medium bodied, but was thick and oily.  Plan on sharing the bomber.  I was a bit dissapointed, but this could be because of high expectations.  I would welcome a small glass in the future, wont buy again.

Aroma is unique, similar to a grilled BBQ oddly enough. Dark black with a tint of blue and nice lacing against the glass. Very smooth flavors of roasted caramel, cocoa, toffee some nutty flavors and burnt sugar. Alcohol is well masked and body is full. Overall, absolutely delicious and very unique must try! Id give this an A+ rating.

Caramel color with good head and great lacing.  Sweet cherry and fruit with an alcohol laquer aroma.  Very sweet up front with dark fruit, cherry cough syrup like finish with the alcohol taste.  Too much alcohol for my taste.  Full mouthfeel.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a chestnut color with a light tan head.  Smell of sweet fruit and slight alcohol.  Taste cherry with alcohol, cherry cough syrup.  Bit of yeast taste and smell.  Lighter mouthfeel than expected with good lacing.  Not great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep brown with garnet hues.  Nose is overripe, candied apples, dark cherries, and plum.  Additional notes of yeast spice and toasted bread/biscuit.  Flavor is sweet cherry and plum with banana bread/burnt biscuit, Belgian candy, spice, and peppery alcohol.  A bit of a burn on the way down.  Alcohol does clear the palate a bit, but some sweetness and spice resides.  Alcohol and sweetness is somewhat detracting.

Bottle, Voldby Koebmandsgaard, DK. Pours dark brown with medium diminishing tan/off white head and medium body. Aroma and taste sweet caramel malt, hops and sweet dark fruits.Great mouth feel as it caresss the palate, both complex and gorgeous in equal measures. Lovely.

Pours a darker clouded rusty brown with a large tan cap. Moderate natural carbonation. Aroma is wonderful, caramel, roast,figs,raisin,cocoa,some musty earthyness. Flavour is very rich in sweet malts and dried fruits, so roasty-cocoa tones, vanilla, toffee...very rich and sweet. A long wet finish where some hop bite shows up to lightky balance the sweet malts. Laves a vinous like warming. Very eich complex warming brew, if it has a fault it is a bit too sweet to my tastes to drink more than one, But I will certainly share a galss of this with a friend any day.

750ml bottle. Poured a hazy deep brownish amber color with a thick off white head which reduced to a thin cap quickly. Aroma is a malty and fruity with notes of caramel and vanilla, along with a sugary brandy like quality as well. Taste is sweet malts in the start, followed by, liquorice, dark fruits, malts, raisins, figs, dates and a little more chocolate-alcohol at the back end with some warming dark malts. Mouthfeel is full and velvety smooth with a crisp finish.

Bottle-  Pours clear deep ruby brown with a nice beige creamy head leaving lacing. Aroma is sweet, malty, slightly yeasty, spicy, dark fruits and brown sugar. Flavor is sweet, fullbodied, spicy, cloves, yeasty, apricots, malty and has a nice bitterness. Finishes sweet malty, spicy and a bit bitter.

Reviewed 12/25/2012. 11.2 oz bottle (2011 vintage) into a Duvel tulip.

A: Pours a hazy dark brown color. The head is a one finger light cream color with nice texturing around the edge of the glass. Retention isnt that good, unfortunately, but lacing is attractive but sparse.

S: Theres a strong aromatic bouquet of raspberries and chocolate, with underlying notes of cream, crisp pears, toffee, brown sugar, honey, and lavender. I really love inhaling this beer, theres so much here to take in and enjoy.

T: Sweetness explodes on the tongue right from the get go - chocolate and malted milk balls dominate the palate initially. It sounds like this will be hella sweet. Luckily, this features the hallmark of most great BSDAs, that being impressive balance to help tie together the great flavors. Some earthy, flowery hops will try to nudge into the flavor profile midway through, while the finish is (balanced) alcohol, honey and tart dark fruits. The complexity is something you can really chew through and analyze while remaining a delicate, subtle suggestion.

M: As a nitpick, this beer sits a bit too heavily on the palate. Otherwise, its a silky smooth beer thats clean as a sheet, but with a great residual aftertaste. A little boozy, but nowhere near harsh on the palate. Not quite as carbonated as it seems initially - but maybe thats because I let it rest for about 15 minutes.

O: Wonderfully crafted yet immensely enjoyable. Right up there in the same conversation as Rochefort 10 and St. Bernardus 12 in my mind.

robijnrood met schuimige creme kraag.
lekkere aroma van wijn, caramel, iets zurigs, toffee, port.
smaak: zeer complex met veel tonen zoals; zoet, caramel, wijn, candij, peper, rozijnen, port, gedroogd fruit, vanille.
het frisse zurige van de aroma komt in mindere mate terug in de smaak, overheersend in de smaak waren wel de behoorlijke zoetigheid, en de vele overige smaken.
dik en cremig mondgevoel, erg goed bier.

(Bottle from Voldby Koebmandsgaard, DK) 2012 bottle: Pours dark brown with medium diminishing tan/off white head and medium body. Aroma and taste sweet caramel malt, hops and sweet dark fruits (plum/raisin) and brown sugar, light spice and fruit cake flavour. Great mouth feel as it caresss the palate, both complex and gorgeous in equal measures. Lovely.

15/12/2012 Grande esposizione della birra fiera di Roma - alla spina.
Spettacolare.Di una bevibilità incredibile nonostante la gradazione.
Bel colore dorato,profumata.

Pours an average frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is flat and dark ruby. Aroma contains light bread, orange, lemon, dough, raisin, plum, date, apple, cherry, cassis, red wine, ruby port and spices. Flavor starts off sweet and light acidic, to be followed by sweetness and roasted malts and to finish in sweetness, light acidity and very faint bitterness. Finish is light astringent. Palate is medium to full, with creamy texture and soft carbonation. Very complex, very balanced, very very good.

Location/Date:2010 Bottle on December 214th, 2012 with Dave.
Appearance: Pours a cloudy dark brown. 
Aroma: Aroma of dark fruit.
Taste: Dark fruit, very faint bitterness, faint caramel.
Palate:Medium body, covers alcohol well.
Summary: Really enjoyable aged beer. Nice amount of dark fruits, enjoyable.

De muy buen gusto en boca, equilibrio en lúpulo, y cuerpo fuerte, la nota acaramelada hace de esta cerveza un maridaje perfecto con carnes y aves de caza.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 750ml bottle
amazing beer one of my favorite
lot of caramel, dark fruits, lots of sweetness(more then in previous vintage)
brown-red  with beige head
very nice beer

Having a 2003 bottle oh my goodness the cork was aching to get out. At bottling was was at 10% ABV

A: Dark Belgian brow color that you cant see through but now the

Smell: aroma is AMAZING!!! Fruity and floral more complex than traditional Belgian beers

Taste: incredibly smooth for how old this beer is. Nice notes of caramel, toasted malts, and fruit. Really got a lot of dark fruits flavors mixed in with mild bitterness complex of a pungent Belgian quad.

Mouthfeel: wet

Overall: all around great Belgian beer. Verdict A+

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-17-2012 19:31:10
Starts out woody, I get the alcohol, some honey and dried fruit, some red wine flavors I think, and a little bit of Belgian yeast towards the end,but not strong.

Bottle shared at CBC- Clerkenwell, London during the 1st Birthday Celebration. Cant recall who brought this - thank you! Vintage 2008 bottle. Pours lightly cloudy amber-ruby. Boozy and rich, loads of ripe fruits, cake. Full bodied with lively carboantion. Warming finish with lots of attenuated sugars, taost, ripe berries, golden raisins. Very tasty, warming beer.

750ml bottle 
11.0% ABV 
King/Spadina LCBO Outlet (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
November 20, 2012 (45th Birthday Beer) 
2012 Vintage 
Pours a dark semi-translucent reddish brown with a rocky cap that laced well.  Aroma is yeast, raisins, caramel and bread.  Mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with good carbonation.  Flavour is over sweet and syrupy (just as the label suggests).  The raisin flavour is very strong.  Flavour is rounded out with caramel tones.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2014 at horecabeurs ghent 2012
pours brown, no real foam or scent
taste is just sugary again. very sweet, chemicaly, so common  taste...  3,1 

Rerate at bierhuyske , 2013 edition , 
Way more complex than the previous one . 
Like an intencer version of the classic . 
3,9

Bottle @ astral beers. It pours dark with a beige head on top. Fruit, tofee, spicy and something winy and wild. Very complex beer with many flavors and tastes, where the bitterness from hops is not a great deal. Great beer!
750ml bottle. 2012. pours dark brown with a tan almost white head. aroma of malt, dark fruits, caramel and alcohol. flavour is sweet but the alcohol is not all that well balanced. quite nice though.
Bottle, pours a dark brown, aroma is of dark fruits and flavour is as well, its got a nice complexity with a nice smooth full bodied beer. Yummy stuff

Pours dark with a slight reddish tinge and a hint of tan colour head.  Aroma is strong from a variety of fruit.  Taste is bold and sweet.  Almost reminds me of a wine at first sip and then mellows into a caramel note.

Appearance:  Almost ruby but slightly lighter, like caremelized brown sugar but with a reddish tint. Small off white thin head, fades quickly.  Small bubbles adhering to the glass but I think that was my bad for not rinsing with cold water before pouring.
Aroma:  Cornucopia of boozy dark fruits, port like smell.  Barnyard but in a good way (likely a by product of the yeast).
Flavour:  Lovely resiny (like honey) and fruity taste balanced well by nice toffee/caramel toastiness. Plums and prunes or figs prominent.
Mouthfeel:  Warming due to the 11% ABV but not overpowering and quite welcome on a cool evening after an afternoon of raking leaves!  Not harsh in the finish at all.
Overall:  I am going to the LCBO tomorrow to pick up 3,  which I will compare to this one, per the company this one is excellent to store several years!
2010 bottle.  Pours  a dark ruby color, clear.  Head laces to edge.  Fruity aroma.  Nice gentle fruity taste sweet.  Like drinking velvet.  Smooth to drink.  This was wonderful!

750 mL bottle.  2012 vintage.  Pours a deep brown with a thick beige head.  Doesnt last long but laces nicely.  Very complex, layers of sweet caramel, plum, raisin, and oak.  A very winey finish, long lasting flavor, with a good warming alcohol.  Full bodied and quite sweet, but balanced out by the alcohol, minimal carbonation, silky smooth and lasting on the palate. A real piece of work, will buy a couple for cellaring!

Pours dark and clear, with a fully diminishing head. Aroma is rich, sweet, and yeasty. Caramel, red fruits, plumbs, and some spices are the main drivers in both aroma and taste. In the mouth delivers also a light alcoholic feeling that well balances the sweetness. Almost flat carbonation and a long finish flavour. Just incredibly good with Italian sausages and potatoes.

2011 vintage
Dark brown colour, diminishing cream white head. Sweet aroma, caramel, malts, dried fruits, light coffee, light porto. Sweet caramel flavour, malty, brown sugar and lots of raisins. Malty sweet finish, raisins and dried fruits.
Nice and well done beer, but a bit too sweet for my palate.
(From 75cL bottle @ home)

1.5 Litre bottle: 2011 version. Shared at home with the wife, daughter and son-in-law during a random tasting night on 23 Nov 2012.

Every had Dandelion and Burdock? This reminded me of that old staple from my youth: more body and less fizz than the old pop bottles but still very simular in smell, taste and look.

Demerara sugar and raisins also came to mind in this fairly sweet yet very drinkable brew. The alcohol is detectable but it adds to the enjoyment rather than hindering as some weaker/watery beers often suffer with because their flavours are not strong enough: these flavours certainly are hefty enough to take the alcohol and help it to enhance the brew.

I had the lions share of the bottle and knew Id had enough when I stopped drinking and started making my notes: just about readable!
2012 Bottle. Dark brown color with small head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, sugar. Flavor is rich, toffee, dark fruits.

Draft at Eulogy. Opaque red brown pour with a foamy off-white head. Sticky sweet blue plum goodness. Raisins. Figs. Dates. Fruitcake. An ocean of deep red fruit. Delicious. ABV not quite hidden, but this one remains exceptional.

Pours mahogany with creamy head and great lacing. Smells like toffee and caramel - not even caramelized malt, just caramel. Taste is a little tart and very sweet. Its a great beer but the sweetness is an overdose for me personally. Soft carbonation. Viscous and creamy texture. 750ml bottle.

This was the 2012 vintage that I got a glass of at a tasting. Ive seen this on the shelves plenty and never bothered to pick one up, good thing. Dark brown almost black color. Smell is sickly sweet fruits and belgian yeast. Flavor is more of the same, a heavy melange of spices, fruits, sugary sweetness, just overwhelming. This was not bad it was just too much.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-08-2012 01:03:09

Bottle shared with and courtesy of Deanso. Poured a deep ruby red with a broken tan head.The aroma is fruity and sweet. The flavour is very rich and sweet with ripe fruit, yeast and a hint of spice on the palate. Carbonation is high. A special beer!
strong malty nose.  silky smooth with enough body and an excellent balance.

Poured a deep chocolatey brown, with a glorious, creamy head from a 750mL bottle.  The head dissipated slowly, leaving beautiful lacing.  The nose is full of robust, chocolate and fruit notes, with a strong hint of the 11% ABV.  Mouthfeel is thick, warm, and nice tingling carbonation.  Taste is loaded with the aforementioned dark chocolate, with dark dried fruits (cherries, figs), and surprisingly sweet.  The alcohol lingers a long time on the tongue, warming nicely.

2011 vintage bottle. It poured a dark brown color with a light tan head. The aroma was of malt, cinnamon, some cocoa, coffee and fruit. The taste was complex; malty but with a tart bite and yeasty flavors. Some smoky burned aftertaste as well.  Very good.

Very dark, brown with reddish tinge. Light head, retentive. Aroma is ... Beery, sweet, boozy. Candy apple and caramel. Flavour is white grape candy, very sweet. Brown sugar comes in as it warms. Extremely sweet, no hops to speak of. Too much sweet. Ugh.

750mL bottle from LCBO.  Pours very dark brown, clear, with thin beige head.  Sweet aroma of caramel, grapes, chocolate, a little oak, and some alcohol.  Very sweet white grape candy taste, brown sugar, with a little dark bread, and some mild spice.  Feels flat, and sticky due to the sweetness.  Good, but Id like it more if it were less sweet.

Rich molasses-brown with alluring, creamy off-white head. Lots of dark sugars and muted spices in the nose backed by flavors of dark, dried fruits, Belgian yeast, figs, brown sugar, toffee... a very nice, smooth dark ale that drinks oh so easily with wonderful, lingering flavors. If youve previously enjoyed Chimay Blue or Rochefort 6, I would highly recommend picking this one up. My favorite of Carolus offerings.
750Ml bottle from the LCBO. Malty super sweet, molasses. Lingering biscuity malts. Notes as balanced as Chimay, but nice.

750mL bottle from the LCBO. Pours a dark brown, almost black, with a bit of fine tan head that dissipates and rings fairly quickly. Smell is very interesting, some banana, caramel, something a bit fruity and tart. Palate is on the thicker side of medium bodied with some softer and long lasting carbonation. The taste starts out a bit tart with some grape/cuvee character then gets quite sweet. The aftertaste is also sweet, complex but a little too sweet I find, some aging would do it good.

2012 from LCBO. 0.75l bottle all to myself. Poured in a tulip. Appearance: Transparent dark orange, fine frothy beige head, some visible carbonation. Aroma: Caramel, banana, hints of grapes, roasted chestnuts, chocolate. Palate: thick bodied, fizzy, smooth, kinda syrupy. Taste: super sweet start, has more of a savoury finish. Nice complex flavour here.
From a bottle dated 2011 at home.  Pours a clear dark reddish brown with a thick tan head.  Aroma of cherries and caramel.  Thick and creamy mouthfeel.  Somewhat boozy, but smooth and very tasty.
Dark brown with medium head. Taste and aroma of chocolate, malts and yeast with a sweet candy sugar finish.

Vintage 2009, on tap in 2012.  Pours deep red with creamy head.  Smells of candy.  Tastes sweet, creamy, spicy.  Mild lemon, caramelized sugar, carbon, malt, yeast, molasses.  Finishes sweet, sticky, spicy.

Bottle at home
Aroma; caramel, resin
Brown color one finger white head

medium sweetness
Really nice ale

75 cl. corked bottle - 2011 "vintage" - served with a rich chocolate dessert. Poured in to trappist glasses, lightly chilled. Dark brown colour with a reddish hue. Medium sized, creamy light tan head. Very complex and fruity aroma with dark dried fruits, overripe exotic fruits, caramel malts and leather from the yeasts. The alcohol shows as a sherry note. Taste is sweet with lots of malts. Full body with an oily to thick texture. Carbonation is on the softer side - could use just a little bit more to be true to the Belgian style. Long lasting finish with lots of overripe exotic fruits, syrup, bread and caramel malts, spices and finally a vinous note. Very, very good - and a good match with a hearty dessert.

750 ml. Hazy, deep brown body. Frothy, off-white head. Nice aroma of dark fruits, plum, raisin, toasted bread, cookie, overripe bananas, brown sugar, mustiness. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes moderately sweet and lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. Wonderful combinations of Belgian yeast mustiness, overripe fruits, sweet malts and spice in the taste. Its sweetness never turns cloying.

20-OCT-2012, bottle @Ulkløbben, @Ole.
Dark - clear amber with lasting tan head.
Aroma is alcohol, dried fruit, bread, yeast, caramel. Taste the same.
Sweet. Way too sweet.
Does not live up to the hype. Fine drink but no rebuy.

Flaska från 2011. Brun öl med vitt bubbligt skum som lägger sig ganska snabbt. Doft av muscovadosocker, banan, marsipan och kola. Detta kommer tillbaka i smaken tillsammans med starkvinstoner och fikon. Något söt och överväldigande i starten men växer för varje cl.
Fantastica cervesa hem probat la del 2011, color fosc paladar potent, però lleuger,caramel, xocolata, un punt alcohol al final.Aromes complexes .
2012 vintage, shared rating.   Carmel flavor and heavy sugars overwhelms every aspect of the beer.   Not what was what we were expecting compared to 2008 to 2011 vintage.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2012 This stuph is fantastic!!! 2011 vintage bottle - the pour was a deep brown, but clear, and with a thin head. Aromas were thick, FULL of brown sugar, yeast, caramel, graham crackers and toffee. The taste was just as good as the nose hinted. You are enveloped in the sweet flavors of brown sugar, yeast rolls and what reminds me of Pepsi in the finish. Im angry about how many times Ive passed up the opportunity to try this gem of a brew.
Bottle 75 cl, shared. Poured light brown with a whitish head. Malts and belgian yeast in aroma. Also some spices in there. Flavour similar with malts and sweet brown sugar mostly. Decent.

Caramel, toffee, dark fruit, and spice in the aroma.  Flavor has bread dough, caramel, toffee, and maybe some apple and cinnamon.  Spicy finish with a creamy mouthfeel, and no sign of the alcohol.  Its just not fair that Belgians have so many great beers in such a small country.  At least they share with the rest of us.

A dark brown beer with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet and yeasty, notes of dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is sweet and malty, notes of caramel, chocolate and licorice. Nice texture and carbonation Spicy finish. Very good beer

Oh my what a brew, Full Head and lots of aroma. Very strong almost....No deceptively strong. This beer will sneak up on you. Its so smooth and the flavors speak of strong caramels. like a perfect Merlot this beer \has flavors of grapes and earthy tones that make you wish you had another chillin in the frig. The color is a deep rich brown to auburn. Pair this beer with a great steak and you will be in heaven.

11.2 oz bottle from buffalo NY store downtown. High carbed dark caramel in color with a plum thick laced head with great retention. Aromas of rum, toffee, oak, caramel, big banana, and just a lot of big toffee/caramel! Flavors of banane candy, toffee, fig, caramel, slight rum, light wood, slight pear ester and some spicy belgian yeasts. Highly sweet, light smoky aftertaste, and leaves every sip wanting for the next. Fantastic belgian that has a great overall flavor with the mixed complexities of malts, yeasts and aging.  Wow this one is truly sweet. There really is a quick finish with almost no sign of the last sip. Quite good, quite......good.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Pours a dark unfiltered brown with little head. Smells of dried fruit and molasses with lots of malt and yeast. When you first take a sip the 11% abv shows itself a little but it isnt overpowering at all it adds to the complexity really. Lots of sweetness on the palate and a long rich finish. Very complex and very delicious.

An amazing Grand Cru (Quad). A: Pours dark and luxurious with a light bubbling head that dissipates quickly leaving beautiful lacing. While the aroma is understated: hints of malt, chocolate, figs, the taste will knock you on your proverbial Keizer. A sublime blend of sweetness:  caramel, dark roasted malt, honey, ripe bananas with a well defined velvety underscoring of alcohol. At 11% ABV it is far too drinkable for its own good (and mine). In all honesty as far as quads are concerned i favor the Rochefort 10 and the Val Dieu Grand Cru (I find this to be just a tad too sweet for my taste) but this is nothing to sneeze at none the less.
So I wonder as my birthday falls on the same day as Charles Vs, do I get a free one?

2011 bottle consumed 9-8. Split 4 ways. Reviewed from notes. 

A: Thick brown with a fluffy lasting head. Sticks to the glass.

N: Malty raisins. Lots of estery yeast. Cloves. Plume and caramel/toffee. Candi sugar.

T: Belgian yeast, raisin, bananas. Plums and raisins. Noticeable alcohol, but as is the case with most BDSAs, it melds well with the flavor profile. Lots of the sweet sugar flavors, caramel and toffee. 

M: Very smooth with a light, airy overall feel. 

O: It is so incredibly difficult to match what the Belgians do so easily with their big beers. In an era when sub 300 bottle counts are king and the readily available is oft avoided, this is a reminder to pick up these traditional beers off the shelf more often.

Draft recently and bottles back in the day. Pour is orange brown with thick medium head and lacing. Aromas of dark fruit, belgian sugar and malts, yeast, caramel, vanilla, and fig. Taste is raisin, bread, apple, plum, caramel malts, and other dark fruit. Medium bodied, with a balanced sweet and crisp flavor. Alcohol heat was light for 11.

Fantastic beer! Great aroma, strong fruit smell. You cant taste the alchol and the older it gets the less sweet it is. One of my all time fav

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2011 bottle. Pours cola brown with a medium, tan head and good lacing. The aroma is black bread, cinnamon, apricots, tart apples, and caramel. The flavor is very sweet and a little tart. The palate is medium to heavy, grainy, and lightly acidic. Overall, this is a very complex and delicious beer.

Sample on tap at Bières et saveurs (Chambly). Pours dark brown with white head. Nice lacing. Aroma: alcohol, roasted malt, yeast and hops. Excellent balance. Outstanding taste. Full bodied. Amazing beer.

Bottle from vinmonopolet oslo city enjoyed at home
Dark dark brown, tanned head. Smells of banana, bubble gum, roasted malts and caramel. Taste is heavy sweet, quite fruity, caramel and roasted malts, dark fruits, raisins, port and some hint of alcohol. Light to moderate fruit bitterness. Palate ends up quite dry for a while. This is a very heavy belgian, the aroma fooled me a bit, when sipping the secret complex depth of this beer really comes through. Smooth, balanced and complex, can it be much better?

Vintage 2008, now 2012.  Pours a dark golden-amber, with little head since it has matured. Aroma is subtle, can detect a bit of vanilla. Has a very natural and refreshing taste. Crisp hops and spices up front balanced with a hint of something sugary. Alcohol is present but is also well balanced. Smooth finish leaving you with notes of citrus fruit. Probably the best beer I've ever tried

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Overall this is a tasty treat. From plums, sugar, belgian yeast in the aroma. To toffee, caramel and sweet fresh apples in the taste. Alcohol is noticeable, but it is not overwhelming. No wonder they brew this for winter enjoyment. Recomended for BSDA and or Quad lovers.

From notes: My favorite beer of a 10 beer flight. Very complex aromas and flavors. Brûlée sugar, brown sugar, spice, vanilla, cookie dough, baked goods, and raisins... Kinda reminded me of an oatmeal cookie. Palate was a little thick and boozy, though the complex aromas and flavors make you forget any complaints about the palate. A treat to enjoy. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

A long time favorite of mine. Bottle shared by Paul during an impromptu session.

2009 vintage

The beer appears sunburst brown with a half inch of thick, tan head. As the head slowly recedes, it leaves a sheet of thick, heavy lacing behind.

The aroma is delectable, with scents of sweet malt, Belgian yeast, and dark fruits.

The flavor brings more of the same, with an awesome bouquet of Belgian yeast and dark fruit. The beer is still a bit sweet, and could easily sit in the cellar for a few more years. Alcohol presence is noticeable throughout, particularly in the finish. Overall, a terrific beer and a great addition to ones cellar.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-19-2011

ceci est une excellente bière.

Une arôme puissant, avec une note de caramel. la robe de cette bière est sombre ce qui laisse suggérer sa puissance.
Tout dans cette bière est une invitation à la dégustation. Une bouteille magnifique, une série limitée à 1 brassage le 24 février (aniversaire de la mort de charle quint).
Je recommande de laisser cette bière vieillir 5ans minimum pour la laisser trouver de nouveau arômes plus puissants encore, et devenir liquoreuse à souhait.

Seule note négative à cette bière, elle est quelque peu lourde après un verre. Cest le seule différence que je peux lui faire avec la westsvleteren qui elle est dune légèretée incomparable.

Aroma: The smell is very sweet, caramelized sugar syrup and nuts.Appearance: The beer is dark amber with ruby notes, an off-white head, good lacings, very good curtains.Flavor: The taste is sweet, brown bread and brown caramelized sugar, butter scotch, honey, apricots and almonds. A nuance of sweet kicorice.Palate: Mediun carbonation, small bubbles, mild, smooth, oily but a very full body.Overall: This was the 2010, very young, sweet and fresh, no Madeira character yet.Note: Bottle 750 ml. (Vintage 2010)

75 cl bottle, 2012.
Opalescent dark brown with a pillowy beige head on its top, which laces.
Intensive, dried fruity, vinous smell.
Yeasty aroma with dried fruits (cherry, raisin), caramel, mild chocolate and alcohol underpainted gently by hops.
The syrupy mouthfeeled brew finishes vinous and warming escorted by citrusses and spices, which leaves a long tart aftertaste behind.
Delicious and noble one for special occasions.

750ml 2005 bottle, bought in Belgium. Hazy and very dark mahogany with a creamy dark cream head that fades slightly to a film. Light port and tanin notes, caramelized figs, prunes, some brown sugar. Low carbonation, moderate body and becomes thinner on the finish, sweet, malts come through a bit but the fruit and port really overwhelms, alcohol is very well hidden. Maybe a little past its prime but very interesting.

Une bière réellement extraordinaire.... (Cuvée 2011)
Dabord sa création est strictement circonstancielle, cest-à-dire lanniversaire de
Charles-Quint, excusez du peu....
Ensuite tout dans cette bière est conçu pour être un élément de fête.
La couleur est superbe, dun noir très profond.
La clarté nest interprétable quen transparence, mais elle est limpide.
Les bulles sont généreuses et réparties dans tout le verre.
La mousse beige nappe le liquide pour le protéger des intrusions intempestives...
Les arômes sont dune complexité très belle : céréales, bois et fruits mûrs.
Le volume est dun soyeux sublime.
Lentrée en matière est superbe, dune générosité incroyable dans le goût.
La rondeur est sublime.
Le second goût révèle un grand ensemble fût de grand vin et malt caramélisé.
La 3ème bouche est un équilibre merveilleux de vérité. Elle allie la douceur dun
Yquem à la profondeur dun brassin de trappiste...
La longueur est extraordinaire.
La levure est digne des plus grandes créations.
La finale est prodigieuse, grandiose.
Lalcool est la structure de lédifice, un vrai programme : fort et chaleureux.
(Nous trouvons à laffiche 11 % abv, ce nest pas rien...)
En conclusion, nous sommes ici en présence dune bière fabuleuse.
Coter cette bière en dessous de 4,8 nécessite de réviser ses critères de 
dégustation...
Pour moi, le 5 est même ridicule, je cote à 444 sur 100 ...
Small white head quickly gone. dark brown color with nice red glow. smells like dubble nice smell. taste yeast little bitter like a dubble. very good beer.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2012 Draft at craft ale house. Pours deep brown with a small tan had. Aroma is full of brown sugar with some dark fruit. Taste is incredibly sweet and is covered with fig and raisin notes. This is nearly Quadlike and hides the 11% completely.
Deep color with a nose of dates, and brown sugar. Head doesnt last long, which is common with this style. Incredible beer, fits the category and excels in flavor.

Okay Im a little bombed right now and I drank this yesterday so Im going to tyrt and describe best how I remember this beer.  I might miss quite a bit and I just want to first apologize for that.  Very malty, figs, molasses and prunes really come through in the aroma.  Flavors are pretty much the same.  Figs, malts, etc...........with a little chocolate and booze.   Leaves a prune and fig finish.

per essere una special edition o quasi mi aspettavo molto di più per una birra che comunque non è da disprezzare. di difficile bevibilità, presenta note torbate con una presenza nel gusto dellalcool, cosa non proprio positiva.
Draft @ Vlaamsch ReusI had high expectations off this beer, but I was disappointed. Its mostly alcoholic in taste. Far less tasty than the Gouden Carolus Tripel.

From bottle. It pours hazy deep brown, with a thin off-white head. The nose is fruit cake, spice, dark fruit, raisin, roasted malt and coffee. The taste is caramel, spice, Christmas cake, marzipan, wood, toffee, leather, raisin and boozy fruit. Medium-full body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Flavoursome and complex, yet smooth and well balanced. A very well made beer.
Doft av nagellack och vingummi. Rund och söt smak av banan. Intressant men behöver lite mer harmoni.

Bottle shared in good company. 
Dark brown color, light brown rocky head. Burned aroma with raisins, wood, caramel, dark fruits, and lots of it! The complex taste includes all of the above, with sweet sugars, some alcohol, and a long lasting warm finish.
For its style its one of the best Ive had.

2011 release. Classic Belgian, smells nice, but not powerful. Dark brown colour with little head. Taste is complex and sweet with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Doesn't beat Westvleteren 12, but what does? ;)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2008 bottle @ CBCs 1st Birthday Party. Thanks to whoever brought this along. Deep brown with a big white head. The nose is spicy red apple peel and cinnamon. Some maple syrup. The taste is sweet apples and more cinnamon, toffee and light yeast. Light balsamic. Big malty body. Nice. Full bodies, medium carbonation. Good.

Aroma tenue y ligero, punto no tan positivo para una cerevza del estilo Belgian Strong Ale elaborada por la reconocida casa cervecera Het Anker.

Aromas florales con toques vinosos intesos.... Notas elegantes y sabrosas a maltas tostadas y caramelizadas.

En cuanto a apariencia, cerveza obscura, turbia con tonos rojizos a la luz. Corona ligera pero de alta permanencia, cuerpo medio y carbonatación de ligera a media. 

En boca, excelente!!. Cremosa, elegante y alcohólica.

Al paladar, compleja e interesante. Con notas dulces en virtud de que los azucares no son convertidos completamente en alcohól, no obstante sus 11%. Es dificil distinguir con facilidad su combinación de excelentes sabores, pero invariablemente destacando su sabor caramelizado, su potecia alcohólica, dejando un final de larga duración y sumamente intenso.

En general, una muy buena cerveza. La cual debe degustarse con tranquilidad, para poder disfrutarla teniendo cuidado con su alta potencia alchólica, quedando únicamente a deber la intensidad esperada de su aroma..., sin embargo una muy buena opción para probar año con año...

750ml bottle. Darkest brown-ruby, tight bubbly brown head. Fruity pear, tart dark fruit. Dry bite over really tasty darker red juice. Incredibly well put together. Nice carbonation, caramel, heavy alc, creamy. Very nice

UPDATED: APR 27, 2013 750 ml bottle. Pours a very murky brown with soft light head. Aroma of caramel, spice, and malts. Tastes of malt, brown sugar, fruit, and spice. Quite sweet. Warm but 10% ABV is actually well hidden.

Also tried 2000 vintage of Carolus DOr at Delirium. 750 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with no head. Aromas of wood, port, and sugar. Flavors of nuts, butter, roasted malts, molasses, and cognac/port. Quite nice. Would have rated this a 8/3/9/4/17 = 4.4
Best beer ever.. Been drinking since 2002. Best after 5 years. Keeps up to 10 years. Its in between wine, beer and port. Very complex, but rewarding.

2007 bottle brought by a club member. Pours a deep, almost murky brown with a fluffy head that dissipates. Sits thick in the glass. Nose is sherry, light oxidation, candied fruit and some banana esters. On tasting, really reminds me of a barleywine. Big sugary notes, balanced by yeast and hop derived bitterness. Vinous, never cloying. More dark fruit comes through the palate. Really great stuff and I see why people keep this one around.

I keep rating winter beers in the summer, but just like I have a favorite season, I tend to favor the Belgian strong/barley wine styles. This is such a pretty beer! I wish I had the patience to cellar this beer, but I cracked the 2012 right open. Thin yet not disappointingly so, head. Rich ruddy color like aged varnish on an antique mahogany bureau. Aroma needs to be a rewrite because my allergies are acting up. No one flavor is too robust, an easy sweet sipper for a cold winters night.
This beer tasted more like wine than beer. Very tasty. I wish it wasnt so expensive. Very sweet. The high abv can barely be tasted.

spicy aroma with hints of yeast, malt and rice
flavor is alcoholic with a slightly sweet finish
medium mouthfeel with light carbonation
a solid brew

I had a vertical of 12, 08, 06, 05 and I am rating th 12 to be the most fair.  Big sugar nose w/plums up front and dark fruits.  Very sweet, didnt dry out enough for me. Could have used a tad more carbonation to kick the sweetness, or lower FG. However, the older years got pretty damn amazing!  Still a fine beer that just needed a bit of time.

2011 vintage bottled. pours dark brown with red highlights and a large frothy light tan head. x aromas of malt, cinnamon, cocoa, coffee and fruit. taste is complex , malty but with a tart bite and yeasty flavors. sweet and sour elements, some pear, plums and a smoky burned taste too. this is one of the best beers ive had.

13th January 20102006 Bottle. Hazy dark brown beer. Unsweet chocolate nose, bubblegum too. Also something rather unpleasant, like rotting wood. Semi dry palate. Cocoa powder like chocolate, something unpleasantly sour. Plummy fruit, artificial chocolate powder, sherry. Warming boozy finish despite the 4 year age. All over the place - a real mess. Weighted Average of 4? You are all mad!

I think Im rating this less than 5 overall simply because it will get better with time. Beautiful brown with a ruby tint. Caramel, grape and apple nose. Full bodied with spiced pit fruit and more caramel. A bit hot on the finish, but the stunning mouthfeel keeps things balanced.
Draft.  Beernutz.  Hazy brown color.  Big creamy head.  Medium sweetness, at least.  Flavors were raisin, fig, candy, brown sugar.  Big time complexity.  Really enjoyed this one.
brown, clear, tan foam, soy sauce, cereal, bread, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2012 750 ml bottle courtesy of Jonas (non-RB). 2010 vintage. Pours tiny hazy dark reddish brown with a rather small creamy pale brownish beige head that is rather quick to dissipate while leaving some lacing on the glass. Smell is sweet, malty and spicy with dark sweet bread, rose pepper, prunes, dark sweet cherries, burnt caramel, orange zest, black pepper, wood, alcohol, dark grapes and hints of lemon juice and vanilla. Taste is sweet and malty with dark bread, wood, prunes, orange zest, plums, alcohol, liquorice root, black pepper, dark grapes and hints of toffee, pears and apples. Mouthfeel is sticky sweet, tiny boozy, very tiny tart and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet an tiny tart with dark bread, apples, pears, toffee and orange zest.Sample during tasting @ Ölrepubliken. Blind tasting! 2002 vintage. Pours hazy dirty brown with no head. Smell is sweet and fruity with sweet bread, overripe pears, hay, alcohol, calvados, wood, solvents, compost, leather, moist soil and lots of esters. Taste is tiny sweet, tiny bitter, slightly sour and fruity with sweet bread, cereal, overripe pears, red apples, leather, moist soil, dry wood, yeasty ester, cloves, allspice and hints of caraway. Mouthfeel is tiny round, tiny dry, tiny tart and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and fruity with biscuits, crackers, orange zest, slightly dry grass, pears, apples and dry soil. Bit past its prime...
tulip. brown unclear body fluffy head maybe two finger tall. aromas are caramel, ripe pear, piloncillo, berries,  and it has alcohol and a sense of char stake. Flavors are strong in sweet and fruits.
Bottle.  Cloudy copper pour with off white head.  Caramel, raisin, dark berries, cinnamon, brown sugar, flower spice.  Better as it opens up.  A bit sweet for me but a nice beer

Bottle for Sunday night Game of Thrones viewing.  Pours deep amber with finger head of beige fluffy fun.  Great nose of candy and soda.  Tastes of root beer, caramel, malt, molasses, licorice, and yeast.  Really delicious.

Catching up on old reviews - 
Deep mahogany brown pour with tan head. A sweet aroma of dark fruit, bananas, caramel, cherries. The taste was extremely sweet and even overpowering at first. The warm and farther into the beer I got, the better I could pick out the tastes...malt, brown sugar, various fruits, cinnamon, cloves, molasses, candy. There also was a nice presence of earthy and bready yeast.  Fairly moderate body and carbonation. Interesting complex beer, that I enjoyed in a small dose, but I dont think I could handle the sweetness in more than that.

pours light root beer brown, minimal head compared to the blond, ringed retention, lots of slow-moving CO2 streams. Strong thick and heavy malts on the nose. Drinks with 8/10-level sweetness up front, alcoholic presence is apparent from the start, tastes of heavy malt, brown sugar (demerara/turbinado), figs, scotch, caramel, mild-medium bitter finish. Med-high complexity, med-high depth, good transitions, great carry, okay drinkability (less as the temperature raises). A potent dark beer with lots of flavour but also heavy and hits harder than the blond.

Draft. Pours murky amber-brown with a med-large tan head. Buoquet of dark fruit. Raisin, plum, prune, fig... you name, its in there. Very sweet aroma that matches the nose. Yeast and alcohol as well. Full body, sticky texture, and a very lengthy finish. A little too sweet for my taste, but still a great beer.
Bottle, 2011 vintage. Colour is amber brown with a beige head.  Fruity aroma. Taste is fruity with some sourness.

On tap at TnD. Aroma of caramel, figs, nuts, licorice, ginger, honey. Flavor is the same. Pillowy tan head with opaque brown body. Smooth, creamy body. Moderately sweet but in a non-intrusive way. A trailing hint of spicy sourness on the back palate was interesting.

Highly rated for a reason, I'm sure, and my undiscerning mouth would have to agree. Seems like a nice sweet carmel with some lower fruity flavor and malty below that. Very nice change from all the IPAs I've had lately.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A lovely looking dark-chocolate brown beer with a huge, fine, light-dusty-brown head.  Aroma is mild spicy yeast with some candy caramel.  Flavor is more intensely sweet in the line of st. bernardus but with a touch more candy.  Lovely.  medium bodied.

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a hazy dark brown color with a light tan head which leaves limited lacing. Aroma is of banana, raisin, nut, and maybe some orange and alcohol. Taste is initially sweet with maybe some raisin but it ends on a heavy banana bitterness with some alcohol in there as well. Mouthfeel is very good but not overpowering with average carbonation. Overall an excellent beer. Maybe not akin to the style of a strong ale but very very delicious.

pours dark brown with low quite frizzy and thick head
sweet aromas of oranges, peach and of course belgian yeast
nice sweet taste, honey, sweet fruits, alcohol is there, slight tasteof burned sugar as well
taste stays a while which is nice, it has sweet roundness that is very attracting. a very good belgian
UPDATED: AUG 5, 2014 311211/160113: Havy, good body. Aroma and taste of prunes. Sweet and strong alcohol flavor. (actually a bit too strong)..

This beer has two distinct recipes, and as such is difficult to rate singularly. The first has a high tobacco profile that might remind one of the waft of old sitting room gently tanned by years of social activity. It finishes light but with a lingering, almost 'matte' quality on the palette.

The second incarnation is at least a factor more potent-sharp, sticky, heavy flavours punch through and then peak into sugary textures-like a brown resin.

Both beers are dark, and pour with mild heading. Highly recommended for ageing and for warm nights.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2014 Bottle 750ml.
Pours brown(reddish) with low beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is of bananas, caramel, alchool, raisins, fruits. Taste: sweet, some spices, malt, alchool, raisins, fruits, caramel, some earth, very slight acidity. Palate: Full bodied. Overall: Well balanced, but still on the sweet side. Great stuff.

2011 bottle from Systembolaget. Pours dark amber / red with medium off-white head. Nose is alcohol, brown sugar, figs, raisins, spices and belgian yeast. Taste is is initially very sweet with the alcohol clearly present - lots of dried sweet fruits - dates, figs, raisins. Towards the finish, a clearly and somewhat funky bitterness takes over and stays for a lingering and long aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium to full, quite creamy. An enjoyable beer, best enjoyed at at least 10-12° (initial impressions of it, served too cold, were less than stellar).

25oz bottle - pours super dark amber with rich tan head and great lacing. Nose is of red forest berries. Flavor is candy, plums, apricot? - ok this is fruit fruit and ethers. Taste is way sweet. Alcohol is very prominent. Full body and thin to oily texture. Its been a while since Ive had a beer like this. Very fruity.
The taste is off, caramel, roasty, coffee the aroma is, earthy, raisin, woody. Very good palate.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2013 2012 vintage with nearly a year of ageing: Mostly same notes as below. Fruit is very present up front. Alcohol maybe less pronounced. An outstanding beer. Like to try this vintage again in a couple of years to see if any difference then as aside from maybe mellowing the alcohol not seeing a lot of difference after a year.

2010 vintage. This is an amazing beer, no question. Big massive dark fruit up front, almost like a barley wine. Middle is sweet malt with hints of molasses and maybe dark bread. Alcohol is very present but in a good way. Pours coffee brown with a light head. Creamy in the mouth with medium-low carbonation. Stunning.

Sia ringraziato Carlo V e il Carlo doro! Vellutata e morbida come un soffice cuscino. Accarezza la bocca e trasporta le papille gustative in un viaggio tra sapori dolci di zucchero di canna e di frutta. Birra diversa dalle altre. Se chiudi gli occhi vedi quasi la lingua correre per prati mentre lancia fiori tuttattorno.
An extra refined beer that deserves attention.  The appearance with its light crisp head sparkles.  The grains come through with the finest hop taste and bright notes.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.
En flaska från 2009. Väldigt estrig och söt. Mycket vingummi, mogen banan, mandelolja men också drag av karlssons klister. Bra till ost men annars i sötaste laget.

Bottle 750 ml [2011]: Red brown color with almost no head. Aroma of bubblegum (yeast?), dark fruit and notes of caramel. Flavor is extremely sweet, dark fruits. Very rich and complex. Could benefit from aging.

(bottle)  An interesting find from the Keg_Juggler.  Slightly metallic aroma with alcohol. Complexion is translucent red-brown with tan head and persistent lacing.  The flavor is a complex blend of dried fruits with some nuttiness.  Fairly sweet but not cloying.  Carbonated palate with smooth finish.  A perfect winter sipper.

I love the dark brown color. Thin white head nice lacing. Intense floral aroma with a hint of oak/vanilla. Powerful taste of Sweetness and belgium hops. Alcohol taste is def there, but The balance is right on.  Great Belgium selection. Over the course of the bottle though, or as the bottle warms up, the alcohol is more present.

Amazing! Easily one of my favorite beers. Just try to find a better Grand Cru. Perfect balance of sugars and alcohol burn. Smooths out magnificently over time...if it lasts that long!  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into Chimay glass, dark ruby color with magnificent head and lacing all the way down the drink, aroma at first is funk, metallic, but gives way to multitude of notes of raisin prune molasses, oily mouthfeel perfect carbonation alcohol completely hidden, very nice strong dark Belgian that is rewarding if you drink slowly over an wvening

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown. Thick, almost like sirup. Loads of raisins, plums and figs. Very sweet and could be more balanced. Works well as a desert beer.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 Bottle 2011. A dark brown beer with a medium and beige head. Aroma is intensive and fruitfull sweet, prunes, madeira, raisins, anise; tastefull aroma. Taste is also mainly sweet, raisins, dates, syrup, anise, alcohol is great totally disappeared, some drying herbs. Full- bodied, moderate carbonation and slippery to drink. Very sweet beer, sweetness is fruitfull and not sugary, thus still balanced and enjoyable; nice beer for a dessert or winter warming.

750 ml  bottle acquired trough Ipb 2011 edition. A: grappy, 
licorice, vinous, brown sugars. App: its clear brown with some red highlights. small head nice lacing. T/p: full body finish is sweet and medium long. Carbonation is med-high. O: super classy a must drink Belgian.

75cl bottle @Kaisla. 2007 vintage. Poured murky brown with sediments floating around, dense white head. Sweet fruity and yeasty aroma, dates and raisin comes to mind. Flavor is sweet, dates and raisin, with some spiciness and yeast. Alcohol completely hidden. Very drinkable despite the sweetness.

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden.
Light brown lingering head. Dark brown color. Fruity aroma with spices and nougat. Sweet taste but not complex as I wish in a belgian beer.

2010 vintage. Bottle 75 cl, bought it 2010 somewhere in Belgium. Pours clear deep ruby brown with a nice beige creamy head leaving lacing. Aroma is sweet, malty, slightly yeasty, spicy, dark fruits and brown sugar. Flavor is sweet, fullbodied, spicy, cloves, yeasty, apricots, malty and has a nice bitterness. Finishes sweet malty, spicy and a bit bitter.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2014 2010 bottle (Jan 2012).
Dark reddish brown, large beige head leaving lacing.
Aroma: malty, candy, cherries.
Taste: malty, honey, licorice, candy, chocolate, the alcohol is well hidden.
Full-bodied, almost sticky, maybe moussy.
Very nice stuff! 
2012 bottle (early 2013). 
Marmalade candy, Anton Berg, licorice, malty, floral, fruity with yellow pears, bubblegum, quite sweet. An aged bottle is tastier for sure.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2013 Vintage 2006 and 2010. Caramel, coffee, chocolate, herbs, basement aromas, leaves, butterscotch, cooked vegetables, skunky, smoke, rotten eggs, black, cloudy, brown foam, light sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, umami, full body, thick feel, flat, long finish,

From backlog , bottle from 2000 shared with GothGargoyle @ Kulminator 
Head: none 
Colour: verey dark brown 
Smell: dried fruits like raisins, figs, plums, overall sweet with malts 
Taste: candy sirup/rock candy , toffee, caramel , bit of yeasty for the slight bitterness, end is oily , after is sticky , a good one !!
Bottle. Pours brown with an off white head. Sweet and dark fruity aroma, with some toffee, spicy yeast, and molasses. The flavor has sweet dark fruits, molasses, and spicy yeast. Tasty.
Dark amber color with small head. Very sweet beer, but also a well balanced beer. From my Backlog.

Bottle:
Vintage 2009:
Small off white head changes into a lacing fairly quick on top of a beautiful ruby colored beer.
Smell autumnal herbs and stuff,  butter, butterscotch, caramel, toffee, malts, hint of alcohol.
Taste is a very rich mix of butter, butterscotch, caramel, toffee, malts, barleys, dark (dried) fruits, raisin, prunes, dark/brown sugars.
Barley toffee malty caramel aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, full body and a creamy texture.
Good brew, very tasty.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: This is a very good beer that should be taste if you can. Its a tastier version then the classic.

2009 bottle...pours a murky brown amber with little or no head.  Aroma is sweet...raisin and candy sugar.  Flavor follows suit and adds some caramel and some yeasty fruitiness with a mild tartness...some earthy wheatiness.  Mouthfeel is medium/full and silky with a mildly roasty raisny finish that arms a bit.

12/07/11 on the 11.2oz bottle. Deep reddish brown in color with a tannish-white head. Aroma is wine-like. Smooth, sweet, and syrupy with a touch of sourness. Tart, but not overly so. The alcohol content is well masked.
This one is very vegetable, and wildness. A great balance full of surprises of tart fruity goodness. A bit much carbonation, but that is typical of the style. a real palate cleanser.

Kyseessä on tumman ruskea olut valkoista lähentelevälä vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on mausteita, sokerista makeutta ja tummaa hedelmää. Sama tuntuu maussa, mutta makeus korostuu. Mausteisuus on lempeää ja olut onkin hyvin juotavaa sorttia.

Bottled 2000, tasted Dec 2011
AROMA: rasin, red wine, cheese, basement aromas, leather
APPEARANCE: brown, clear, minimal head, quite a lot of deposit
TASTE: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour
PALATE: medium body, thin feel, but still has a good body, long finish
OVERALL: fantastic beer with a real wine quality; mellowed out and has a large number of aromas; one to savour over a whole night
Pours a darkish red/brown. Aromas of spice, coriander, yeast, and alcohol. Flavor has an alcohol taste to it, mixed with a nice smoky dark fruit. Also has a strong hint of spice.

0,75 bottle. Brown beer with a thin, creamy tanned head. Alcoholic aroma, fruitness, cookies and malts. Dark chocolate malts. Flavour is sweet alcoholic with ripe dark fruits and kandi sugar. Nice tingling feeling to it.

Bottle. 2011. Murky brown with hints of redness. A nice beige head that disappears. Nose is not overwhelming but is of raisins and sweetness. The taste however, is a knockout. Rises with a candy sweetnes (raisins, cherries, festive sweet fruit) but fails to drop in to a sweet mire. So well balanced. The finish ignores the promise of sweetness, finishing with a light acidity rather than a bitterness or a sugary tang. The fact that this is an 11% beer is unbelievable. So smooth. Very difficult to quantify exactly how good it is.

#500: No head at all, Brown colour. Very sweet nose with raisins and oranges, powerfull. Fullbodied an fine length. Taste is fruitcake, orange curd and prunes. Really nice and wellballanced, though heavy!

75cl bottle. Pours a lovely chestnut colour with some chinks of amber light through the middle. The nose has chocolate, oranges and ginger. Overwhelmingly there is cherry cola. The taste has liquid tiramasu. Let me explain, theres coffee, caramel, plums, spices of some sort (maybe cinnamon). The palate is medium to large in structure, creamy and it falls away perfectly. I cant imagine how this could be any better. The best beer Ive had to date!

A classic.  Had on draft to my liking many times, out of the bottle now.  Pours a dark, muddy reddish brown with creme colored head, nice lacing and retention.  Aroma is caramel covered apples, butterscotch, toffee, a hint of spice, nutmeg or cinnamon, and a hint of pear.  Flavor is nice, at first sweet malty butterscotch, toffee, and caramel, with a long finish that begins with belgian candy and sweet bread and finally ending with fruity tones, plenty of apple, also some white grape, and pear.  Nice, nice, nice.
Bottle 0,75ltr: Dark brown coloured brew with an red glow, good dried fruits, caramel and spices taste, and some warm feeling in the mouth.

750oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours very dark brown with lacy, light tan head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, caramel and light chocolate malts, some floral hops, and a little alcohol.  Flavor about the same with strong caramel some sweetness and alcohol.  Smooth texture.  A really good Belgian beer.
Date: October 29, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Quad Tasting Event Minneapolis. Full description not available as I was sampling many beers as part of a tasting event.

2008 bottle. Pours a brown colour with a lacy light tan head. Aroma of raisins, alcohol and plums. Very plummy flavour with raisins, caramel and treacle. Nice and oily mouth-feel with mild carbonation and CO2 prickle. Delicious!
Gorgeous red color, too deep to see in ambient light but fantastic with backlight. Rich, fruity, malty aroma with no back end bitterness, though a slight smoky aftertaste.

Bottle, poured into a tulip glass. Pours a dark brown with a large fluffy head. Lacing all around the glass and top of the beer. This is a very smooth Belgian dark beer, especially considering the 11% ABV. There is virtually no alcohol burn. Nose and taste is all Belgian Trappist style...brown sugar, maple, malty goodness. The smoothness was about the only thing that set this beer apart from any other of this style. Certainly a fine quality, well crafted beer.

Clear red with good tan head. Wonderful rich aroma - dried fruits, chocolate. Full bodied, mouth filling with soft but plentiful carbonation. Fantastic rch flavour - dates and raisins, caramel, chocolate with a little spice and a hint f bitterness in the finish. A truly exception beer.
Pours a deep red with a thin tan head. Smells like soda, toast, and orange. Plenty of spicy bitterness smooths out to citrus and sweet caramel. Finishes with the same sweet malt.

Bottle 2011 edition... ip pours hazy reddish brown with a creamy very long lasting tan head..... the aroma is sweet, dark fruit, yeast and alcohol... and flavor is sweet,spicy, dark fruits malty, raisins and sugar.... very nice creamy, thick mouthfeel....very nice.....

08.10.2011.0,75l Bottle. www.vinmonopolet.no. Dark brown colour with off-white head. Aroma is strong with lots of flavours of malt. Very strong beer. Rich body with lasting malty flavours. Sweet. Moderate bitterness. Veru good beer!!

Csak a jó sör, Budapest.
Egészen sötét, vörösesbarna színe van ennek a sörnek, ami szépen ragyog, ha fény felé tartjuk. Habja bézs színű, igen nagy, krémes de hamar összeesik, köszönhetően a magas alkoholtartalomnak. Illata igen összetett, aszalt gyümölcsök, amiket finom likőrben áztattak, selyemcukor, édes pipadohány és maláta keksz. Olyan íze van, mint egy ritka, ünnepi süteménynek, ami tele van finom szárított gyümölcsökkel, különleges, alkohollal töltött cukrokkal, karamella és csoki darabokkal, fahéjjal, vanília likőrrel leöntve. Igen sűrű, szinte olajos teste van és apró buborékokkal van tele. Utóíze édeskés és kissé ragadós. Ahogy melegszik, úgy jönnek elő belőle az ízek, zamatok, ezért nagyon lassan kortyolgassuk. Nagyon finom és különleges sör, de nem a minden inkább az ünnepnapokra való! Super!
Very sweet/ fruity but no over powering. Like a fine dessert port wine. Has 11% ALC/VOL. but smooth. Caramel aroma. A must try of Belgium beers.

(bottle, 75cl, vintage 2006) The taste is awesome.it starts out smooth with a light sweet start, then fades to some complexity with some light hops, and finishes with a little hops.This is a very well balanced and complex beer.

0.75l bottle. Have been saving this bottle for a good years time now, so decided it was time to pop it. It pours a dark cola-brown body with a small islandy and sidesticking lightly tanned head. Aroma is quite sweet at first with lots of burned dark caramel, rum raisins, figs, wood, ripe plums, hints of bubble gum, malts and snow! Yeah, fresh snow. Really complex and quite nice! Average to lively carbonation, quite full-bodied and it has a beautiful almost creamy mouthfeel. Flavors are strong and complex. Intense sweet caramel, lots of wood, nuts and some rum raisins. Continues with dates, some mild hints of fruity (melon)-yeast before it ends in a strong and malty finish. The aftertaste is really warming - almost heart burning - and the light fizzing and almost creamy texture glides over to this smooth and delicious thing slowly gliding down the throat. Damn, this was one helluva beer, and a perfect sipper at a cozy candle-light date now in the autumn.

Monstrous Belgian brew. 2011 bottle. Pours dark brown, with a muddy, pinkish, head. Strong aromas of heavy Belgian candy sugars, molasses, caramel, and mixed dark berries. Tastes of syrupy molasses, chocolate covered berries, thick malts, ends in a sugary sweet note. A bit on the sweeter side of typical Belgian ales, very complex brew. Lots of warming alcohol mixed in as well, cloying sugars, a sipping beer. Powerful, tasty beer.

Bottle of the 2000 vintage at Kulminator, shared with BelgBeerGeek. There was some serious sediment in the bottle so pouring had to be done carefully. Dark brown with no head. Rich aroma of raisins, brown sugar. Syrupy on the palate, quite sweet, with flavours of raisins, toffee, brown sugar, chocolate. Delicious!

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 2009 Vintage

A: Rich red-brown body. Light beige head. Quickly recedes leaving behind nice lacing.

S: Dark fruits. Raisins, figs, caramel, grape skins. An ever so slight hint of booze.

T: This delicious beer is defined by delicious dark, sweet fruits. Almost like a fig newton with prominent raisin and grape components. Slight caramel, chocolate, toffee malts.

M: Medium-full bodied. Clean carbonation. Rich.

O: This is a wonderful beer. A bit to rich to be more than a slow sipper. Cant wait to get this beer again every year.

It is a nice color with a darker amber to mahogany brown and red tone with a thin but durable head.  The aroma has a solid balance of sweet malts and a punch of hops.  The body is a bit better than medium. The taste boasts sweet, candied malts up front and a pleasant finish.  But I also found it to be remarkably drinkable.
750mL corked bottle poured  hazy brown with big tan head and nice lacing.  Earthy aromas with yeast on the nose.  Flavor is caramel, yeast and some spices.

75cl bottle - cuvée 2011. Caramel all the way - pity. There is no balance in the beer. Yes, it is strong and with the age will come the nutty and madeira touch but no "waauw" effect on me. Try a Struise Pannepot instead :-)

On tap at the Livermore Saloon. This one pours dark brown with a tan head. The aroma is super fruity with more of a hard candy quality. Also some molasses, maple syrup, and overripe dark, pitted fruit. Any Belgian yeast in there is completely covered up. The flavor is incredibly sweet with all the above mentioned qualities and a nice richness to the fruit which brings to mind raisins, plums, and figs. The alcohol was barely noticeable at all, and it was surprisingly easy to drink despite the overpowering sweetness. Seems like it would make a nice desert beer. I would have liked a little more complexity from the yeast, but still a good beer.

750ml bottle from Brewery Creek in Vancouver. 2010 vintage. Pours a deep brown with mahogany highlights. Head was medium khaki, full and creamy. Aroma is very rich with bread dough, molasses, raisins and plums. Some light spice as it warms. Taste is rich malt with notes of bread dough, caramel and molasses, vanilla, dried cherries and raisins. Some light smoke and spice. Alcohol is soft and pleasant. Medium dry finish. Top quality, well crafted beer.

75 cL bottle shared at Het Anker Brasserie in Mechelen.  Dark brown and a bit gassy, with little head.  Rich, caramelly, yeasty with lots of alcohol, licorice.  The aroma is delicate, fruit, caramel, creamy.  Really good stuff.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2011 (2011, 750ml) This has been  in my fridge for ages as if its some special  treat  ,when in reality I can get this any time  .  Im receiving  abrasive   licorice and burnt roasty notes ,. some oranges  , some spice,  The boozy 11%  body is an unelegant and erratic showing.. This  needs a year or three to mature and become refined ;

2011 Bottle; Pour is murky dark caramel with an average fine bubbled khaki head that isnt very impressive in this tulip. The nose is perhaps the most impressive aspect of the brew for me; It is heavy on the candied sugars and focuses on the malt profile, but in such a way as to feel like a fine desert. I found this bottle to be overcarbonated and prickly by my tastes; the flavor profile couples caramel, belgian sugar, toffee, light florals, dark fruits are present, as well as baked breads; the center of this brew feels a little light, and it finishes on the sweet side. Overall- very nice. Perhaps some age on it would do it good.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 750 ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. 2009 version.
Pours a dark brown, slightly red colour with a lacy, slightly off-white colour. Aroma of sweet caramel, raisins and tannin. Flavour of lovely sweet caramel, raisins, oak, some sweet berries and mild bready malts. Very smooth mouthfeel with a rich, long, warming, fruity finish. Very pleasant and quite complex.

750 ml bottle. 2007 vintage at 9 years of age. Pours a dark brown colour with a small beige head. Aroma of rich dark berries, raisins, tannine and oak. Flavour of heavy sweet malts, oak, berries, sweet raisins, caramel and bitterness. Full bodied. Thick and oily. Brilliant!
Sampled from a bottle at SIB. Pours a clear, rich mahogany. Aroma of citrus, wheat and syrup. Flavour of syrup, red wine, and booze. Superbly smooth and well balanced.
