2008 vintage. pours a deep dark brown that matches my dresser very nicely, nice little beige head with some good lacing. smells of apples, bananas, plums, cherries, raisins, lots of fruit here. malty taste with some fruits present mostly the same ones as on the smell with a strong lingering finish. the 11% is obvious in this one but its very fruity and rich overall. very solid brew, highly suggested.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2009 鲤th rating) Bottle, 2008 Vintage, second tasting. Dark brown with a thin white head and heavy lacing. Aroma is definately heavy on pears, carrots, caramelized sugar. Taste is fruity, pears, small fruits and alcohol. Good mouthfeel.

Source:750 mL bottle purchased at McScrooges in Knoxville. 
Glass:Orval. 
Appearance:Dark brown/red pour with a two finger beige head.  
Aroma:Dark fruits and berries with caramel and earth. 
Flavor:Sweet fruits with bread and caramel and an earthy bitterness. 
Palate:Full body with solid carbonation.
Overall:Excellent beer.  Wish I had bought more at the 6.99 price.

wicked aroma of ripe fruits, plums, apples, raisins, and cherries, also an oustanding sweet bready yeasty aroma. Like a great sweet load of sugar loaf. Flavor is very sweet, but also has a nice bitterness. Lots of flavors, more fruit, some licorice, more sweet breadiness. SOme vanilla lingers, with some sweet malts. Jesus, this is a party! wow. incredible beer! very complex!

750ml compact bottle from Vinmonopolet shared as an aperitif. Gives a good, smoky shot when the cork and wire cradle are released from the bottle. Initial huge, dense beige head over a deep, ruby body. Aromatic to the nose with prunes and other kinds of sweet, dark fruits. Dark fruits and dark berries in flavour with well integrated heating from the alcohol. Sherry-like textured. Full bodied. Slow sipper and just the right choice before dinner (weekend at Elsas in Skibotn, 28.08.2009).

A brown pour with light tan head and lace. Aroma is brown sugar and a musty hay. A thick sweet flavor of almost molasses with some breadiness, Abv is there but not in a bad way. Aggressive to smooth in one drink carbonation on a full bodied beer. Very nice

Bottle from 2001 - LCRBM 2009. Dark brown, small head. Complex malty and old aroma. Starts soft like velvet, fine malty, modest alcoholic, very well balanced. Finish still soft malty, fruity notes and some cinnamon. Great beer!

smells of dark malts but is very overshadowed by banana and fruit. A dark reddish brown that seems like its just brown until you get some light right through it. The dark malt REALLY comes out in the flavour, almost no aftertaste, just a bit of alcohal. Smooth and creamy on the tounge, eases up the alcohal falvour. A really nice beer, this was a 2008.

2008 vintage. Cork was hard as hell to get off of this bottle...but it was worth the fight. Redish brown pour with tan head. Belgian yeast and dark fruits on the nose. Flaor is full with caramel, malts, dark fruits, spice, fig and happiness.

Vintage 2007 drank 9/11/9.   Cork pops off nicely and aromas of dark fruit and yeast fill the air.  Pouring brings out some sweet carmalized malt and bannana.  Pours brownish-red with a head that dissipates fast to an off white lace around the glass.  Flavor is sweet, there is some bannana that hits you up front and a nice caramel and fig finish.  A little alcohol burn in the finish but not too bad for a big beer.  Mouthfeel is oily with low carbonation.  Overall this brew hits you with strong fruit flavors and a shot of alcohol in the finish.  This brew had 2 years on it, I think it can go easily 2-4 more years possibly up to 10 years.
I consider this beer as the best of all beers from Het Anker. One of my best strong ales. Not the absolut emperor of Belgian labels, but surely one of them.

Extremely high carbonation and overly foamy head fills 3/4 the glass. HIghly carbonated, dark caramel-amber body. Airy, clean yeast aroma that hints at distant esters and phenols, but you need to seek them out. Full yeasty body, sturdy amber malt backbone. Alcohol is well-masked. Strong caramel and prune overtones. Smooth bodied and rather viscous.

Flaske 0,75l delt med Rune & våre fruer på bærhelg i Skibotn 28 Aug 09. Pen gylden farge. Mørk brunrød på farge. Svakt brunfarget skum. Lukt av frukt og bær - og litt malt. Sammensatt smak - men helhetsinntrykket blir vel søtt: Frukt & bær & karamell. Søt bitter ettersmak som varer lenge. Nesten som søt sherry i avslutninga. KI=2.

2006 vintage, enjoyed August 2009. I have had this beer many times, and it definitely improves with age.  Big pop when the cork comes out of the bottle.Very dark brown, and a thick, lacing head that never quite fades.  Aroma has fruit and Belgian yeast.  A very complex beer, with figs, sweet malt, very light anise, and some chocolate. The high abv is well hidden.  One of the richest, heaviest palates found on any beer.  It is without a doubt one of the finest beers in the world.

( 750ml) Pours a clear chocolate brown with nice light tan head and bubbles taht stay around forever. Nose of brown sugar, beet sugar, alcohol and sweet crackers. Taste is sweet malts, milk chocolate. The mouthfeel is very creamy and velvety carbonation. An excellent Belgian beer.

Pour was insanely heady, with a moderately light pour the glass was over 3/4ths head.  The other way around is an easy way to get a five.  This rounded the bases and went backwards because of overkill.  Stays at a four because of fantastic lacing and a nice light brown murky liquid.  Down to about half and half as I finish typing this.  Aroma is malty, yeasty, candied, very belgian if that makes any sense.  Now that the head is at a managable level, a sip: I can see why this one has a pretty good reputation.  Dark fruit, light rasin, a little banana bread.  While the flavor isnt typically what I look for, I can step back from my own bias and see that this is a good mix and it is done well.  Palate is really great, thick and creamy with low-med carb.

bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  deep brown with a cream head.  nose is fruit, alcohol, spices and yeast.  nice thickness with a flavor of fruit, spices and light yeast.  alcohol was not noticeable in the finish.

Charles the Fifth should feel honored because this beer is special.  Vintage 2008.  Aroma of candy sweetness and alcohol.  Slick body with plum, raisin, licorice, and caramel taste.  Well-balanced.  A great Belgian Strong Ale.

I bought this for my self for my 25th Birthday. If it is good enough for the kaiser on his birthday then it is good enough for me on mine. Pours hazelnut brown, sweet aroma, dark fruit and raisins. Bread. Lots of suspended sediment. Slightly alcoholic aroma. The flavour is that of dark fruits and home made raisin bread. Malty yeasty and dry. Great!

Julios Belgian Beer Festival. Sample. By the time I got to this one I was seeing double. Rating it to keep track but dont have any particulars. I do remember really liking this one and made a point of writing the name of it on my notes for followup tasting.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2009 750 ml. bottle. Vintage 2008. 11% ABV. Pours  a thin yellow white head over a clear reddish amber (SRM 20) body.....nose is of plum pudding with currents/raisins, dried cherry, plum, clove, nutmeg, cinnamon, molasses....taste initially is a bit of malt, then the aforementioned dried fruits barge through bringing major sweetness, finishing with a mild dry ending. Mouth feel is remarkably light, carbonation makes for a creamy richness. I do love the great Belgian Strong Ales.

Dark red brown, thin head. Rich malty aroma, alcohol, grape juice, jam. Very strong rich flavor, yet rather deft and carbonated texture. Tastes like wine. Something very savory in the flavor, raisins. Well made, hits the spot, holds its own compared to similar Westy/Rochefort offerings.  Quite the heavyweight and very satisfying. Why cant Trois Pistoles be this good?

Bottle: 2004 thanks Mike (Eyedrinkale): Ruby purplish with a tannish head. Sweet aroma- quite sugary with candyish Belgian malt giving off honey, plum and candy sugar. Slick body and sweet flavor- rich and candy-like with honey plum character and some old notes of paper and rotted fig. A bit past its prime, but still a rounded rich Belgian Strong.

75cl bottle 2008 version, shared with gf on her birthday in rhodes, greece. found in a carrefour supermarket @ 10 eur.
appears clear brown, huge smooth thick light brown head.
spicy aroma, nuts, dark fruits, raisins.well blended aroma, hard to take the various aromas out of the very pleasant whole.
flavor is sweet malty, licorice, dark fruits, fresh raisins, alc, caramel, vanilla, cardemom, cherries, banana. Flavor is definetly best at room temperature, beer got more and more body and varied flavours as it warmed up.
Had this at the Hopleaf in Chicago.  Delicious! Dominant prune flavor... loved this beer!

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2010 2007: Unbelievable nose...like Jack Daniels and raisins. This beer has aged so damn well. Nice, lightly carbonated, viscous, huge head, dirty brown with a hint of red. I cant believe the nose. Taste of malts, dark fruit/raisins, alcohol, and wood. So many flavors and so well blended, its hard to pin down. I get some mushroom in there as well, but in a good way. Definitely still has some sugar present. This beer, IMO, has reached a crescendo. Tasted @ 62F from the bottle.

2006...yummy! A little more carbonated than it should be I think...cork just blew out and richochetted off the ceiling...no idea where it is now. Great beer as you all know. Frothy head, larger bubbles than expected, and tremendous flavor. Out of the bottle @ 63F. What can I say, I have cases of it! :D

Every year on the 24th of February Gouden Carolus brews the Cuvee de Keizer Blauw, or "Grand Cru of the Emperor" to celebrate the birthday of Charles V. The Cuvee de Keizer is brewed uniquely with only fine Belgium hops and with it being 11% ALC/VOL. this beer will age extremely well over the next several years with a complexity and intensity usually reserved for only the finest wines. This beer pours with a deep caramel color and golden tan head with aromas plums, raisins and wood leaping out of the glass. The palate starts of with sweet caramel that soon gives way to fruity flavors of figs and plums with a slight tart quality. The finish is long and mouth filling as the Belgium hops flex their muscles making it both sweet and bitter at the same time. It is still a little young so if you can keep your hands off of it the 2008 Cuvee de Keizer will only continue to develop over the next couple of years. What a treat!

Much thanks to the Queens RB crew! 2004 bottle. Pours a lovely ruby red with a brownish tint. Intense aroma of bourbon, vanilla, and caramel. I can feel it in the eyes as I take in the bouquet; I presume this will be strong. Actually, it was much smoother than expected. Flavors of brown sugar, honey, and Werthers Original candy. Quite sweet with a surprisingly quickly fading finish. It teases you into thinking it will sting your throat but pulls back and gives you a boozy candy treat instead.

(750 ml bottle (2007) from 1828 Vintage House, cellared for 1 yr. after purchase) Pours a solid dark, rusty brown with a finger or so of sturdy, level tan head. Attractive-looking beer. Aroma of yeast, wine, brown sugar, molasses and caramel. Mouthfeel smooth and almost buttery soft. Lightly sticky on the back end. Wonderfully-laced, fine sheets and sold rings coat the inside of the glass. Flavor of brown sugar, red wine, yeast and spice (cinnamon-like) with a bit too much alcohol presence. As it warms a nice chocolatey note develops. Tastier as it warms/gets deeper in the bottle. Borderline excellent if it werent for being a little too hot and not exceptionally complex.
BOTTLE: pours a deep brown, with a reddish glow when held up to light. Nice lacing. Aroma is sweet/sugar, fruit, and malt. Taste is molasses, apricot, fig. Fantastic beer - one of my favorites.
2009 bottle. Pours black with a medium brown head. Aroma of honey, sweet malts, and some friuts. Flavor a bit wierd for my taste. Very carbonated.

2008 bottle. Pour looks like Coca-Cola, aroma is sweet and strong, fruity and complex. Flavors are a wild mixture of most every sweet fruity description I could possibly add here. Hard to describe, but not bad. Syrupy, with a alcohol burn to go with it. A very different beer, to be sure.

2004 bottle courtesy of IPFreely. Shared with Jacob, Rudolf & IPFreely. Dark quad like pour. Dried fruit. boozy, sweet malt aroma. Taste was dried dark fruits, raisiny, grape soda like sweetness. Nice fuller mouthfeel. Nice beer looking forwrd to the 2006 bottle at home.
This is a wonderful beer all around if you like dark beers.  Great flavor and aftertaste.  Well worth the price.

This poured a dark dark red color with a small of white head. Aroma was very spicey, sweet malts, and some dark fruits as well. Flavor was very interesting, starting out very sweet, then dark fruits and spices, then a nice alcohol and vanilla finish. Lots of things going on here.
The sublte note of green apple along with all of the fig, caramel, vanilla, etc. make this beer fantastic.  It also has a wonderful texture: creamy and delicious.
Pours a deep dark brown. Aromas of treacle toffee, candy sugars, marzipan. Flovours of raisins, sweet spices and vanilla. Good vinous finish can really feel the alcohol!
Had this at tasting at 3 Sons. Dark Honey, very sweet, tastes just like Sherry, some oak, with a littlke carbonation.  Not my prefereance but great for the type.

2008 bottle. Pours a cloudy dark amber with a medium creamy light tan head that lasts awhile leaving behind good sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is vanilla and spice with a lot of alcohol. Medium mouthfeel with a fruity malt with caramel, raisin, oak with a nice spicy finish. Alcohol very present but not too overpowering. A good Belgian strong ale.

Big bottle (2000) from Pelgrims, Aarschot. Arome is of red wine and oak. I would say its dark red, not really dark brown. Head dissappears unappealingly fast. Flavor is really sweet, mild, soft. But it still keeps something of that tippically wooden taste of a strong ale. Palate goes from sweet to the bitter wooden finish, not too refined. Overall a very impressive beer!

Dark brown brew with a beige head. Aroma is fantastic of all sorts of fruit, mostly berries, apples and bananas though. Theres also some cocoa, fat maltiness and refreshing yeasty esters. Flavour is similar but a tad too sweet, it is very sweet, very fat with a long vinous finish with very low bitterness. A real monster of a belgian brew.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2009 Bottle 75 cl, jaargang 2009. Pours a dark brown with a small off-white head and a sweet aroma of plums, overripe pears, toffee, molasses and vanilla. The taste is sweet too, with hints of dark fruits, brown sugar, vanilla, alcohol and herbs. The finish is sweet and sour and more bitter in the end. A very nice beer.

(bottle - corked & caged 750 ml) Dark brown color with a fluffy tan head. Aroma is very sweet and malty with lots of raisins, plums, and caramel. Flavor is big and malty at the beginning with lots of sweet fruit and subtle spice notes following it up. Thick and chewy and very smooth.

Original review date 10/8/2008...from corked and caged 750 to Ommegang chalice...

Only a subtle "poof" as the cork comes off. Dont fret, as theres ample carbonation from the deep bourbon barrel-colored body rising to a 2-finger, ginger-colored bready head that is thick, dense and lumpy. Awesome.

Beautiful scent of apple and pear esters are first wave. With warmth, more banana, yeast and malt emerge. Bountiful and beautiful.

Silky, sweet, thick malt presence with well-balanced esters of banana, pear and apple. Carbonation blends in Beautiful Chemistry with yeast, copious amounts of malt and mild ginger, clove and cinnamon. Malt and spice emerge even more profoundly with warmth.

The power of this offering rests in a full, deep finish. Carbonation provides tingle as a counterweight to cut the fat. Stellar effort.

Complex with balance in abundance. This is immense and a pleasure. Sip and savor.
75 cl bottle (2008) Pours dark red/brown with no head at all. Sweet aroma of banana, prunes and caramel. Sweet strong malty taste, spicy, think this beer wants to be a wine.....

Vintage 2006

Appearance:  Pours a rootbeer brown with a small foamy white head.

Aroma:  Large whiffs of bubblegum, banana, vanilla, and spices.

Taste:  Bubblegum, banana, clove, vanilla, caramel, dark fruits.

Mouthfeel: Thick and heavy.

Overall: Extra very good.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2010 ***re-rate October 7, 2010 - 2006 vintage***
One bottle left! Man, this is stellar! Pretty much same aroma & taste as before but Im very down with this beer - the taste is excellent now. The cellar time has done this beer. Smooth and sweet calmness in my glass. Amazing beer at this point. Rating was 3.5.  Wow- was this just to young 4 years ago? YES. Zero badness from aging. Wonderful brew. 4.2 is no exaggeration. 


006 vintage, reviewed in late 07. Lots of expectation here. Got another one or two in the cellar. This one is fresh out of the store.
Poured out a deep brown with red hues, small quickly dying tan head with zero retention - maybe a more aggressive pour should have been done? The aroma of sweet spice and caramel hits you quickly, sweet raisin, weak wood, hints of alcohol, faint cinnamon candy, licorice - reminds me of an eisbock. The taste is spicy but very easy drinking, allspice, clove, some alcohol, the spice really comes out as this warms and the caramel character tries to tame it but cannot. Slightly syrupy, nice soft carbonation and some alcohol as I breathe in. Surprisingly mellow young, we will see what this ages. See you in another year or so.
Pours a light brown with a thin head.  Aroma is yeast, dark fruits, cherry twizzlers.  Sweet maltiness in the taste, some caramel, cherries, and some toffee.  This is complex and rich.

Dark brown - sweet, bitter, alcoholic flavor. Spicy with toffee fighting the bitter end. I like it, but it isnt as easy drinking as I like. Still - interesting, and very good, especially if it isnt your first beer of the night (it wasnt for me).

Bottle, 75 cl shared with parket. The beer looks very dark, but surprisingly also wears a rather clear dark red colour. There is a little foam that lasts however. The smell is something like old prunes, a bit sweet and light caramel. The taste is light sweet, not too, and also the prunes come back to the foreground. There is also a bit of a warming alcoholic taste at the end. The beer starts fantastic, but doesnt stay the whole bear long fantastic, maybe because it doenst have a big pallet. Anyway a very good beer, I think the best of the Gouden Carolus-series!

75 cl bottle (2008), dark reddish/brown colour and white/beige head. Smell of dried plums and another fruity touch. Taste: warming alcohol taste, also dried plums and other dried fruits, quite sugary but not too. This may be the best gouden carolus! Very nice beer!

This is the 2008 vintage.  This is one delicious beer. I will buy a case if I have the chance.  Not too much head on this bottle, but a delicious malty, fruity, toffee tasting beverage.   I will save half of the bottle for tomorrow.

2000 Deep reddish brown colour, with an average off white head. Full aroma, spicy, toffee, light roasted, very malty, with some alcoholic-yeasty hints. Full body, creamy texture, Finish is rather strong, spicy, alcoholic ending dry. THis is the top.

750 ml bottle from a KW group order. 2008 vintage. pours deep maroon with a tan head that reduces to a spotty tan cover. aromas of, dark fruit, yeast, decaying pale malt, alcohol. the flavour is a huge complex mess of everything but its awesome. goes down super easy for its strength. really a fantastic big dark belgian ale here and theres not much holding it back from being rated higher by me. im glad i have more.
Bottle vintage 06 Pours out a brown topped with a sand head. Aroma of spice and yeast along with some pit fruit. tast was lots of the same a nice banana tast and good spice. Pretty mellow.

Bottle, with Alaskanwarren in Denver. Deep russet pour, modest off-white head. Rum, buttered toffee, banana liqueursort of a raw, sugary aroma, with quite a bit of green alcohol. Rather raw and pokey flavor, especially up front while it was still a bit on the cool side. As it warms, viney sweet walnut, currents. Very big beer with lots of noise. Seems like it has packed for a long journey, and is rather awkward now, but in five years or so will have things all sorted out and be an impressive beer.

2006 edition. Very dark but yet clear reddish brown, an off white cap that lasted a few min. the last skiff lasts the rest of the beer. Now thats a tasty aroma strong and yummy, grape, perfume, some alcohol, raisins, I swear I smell some rye, and chocolate but the chocolate seems very wrong. The taste is sweet but bitterness lingers in the finish. Red wine, definitely taste rye, maybe a hint of piny hops, and grapes. Taste is awesome love this stuff, maybe the only bad thing I can say is its slightly thin. Cant even taste the alcohol to much. Drink this if you can find it you wont be disappointed

on tap at Novare Res..ruddy brown pour ,small tan head ,good lacing.aroma is sweet, dark fruit,caramel,molasses and slight chocolate.flavor is sweet malt,fruity ,spicy,honey and toffee.alcohol is present but not overpowering. medium bodied ,soft carbonation ,smooth and delicious.

2004 VIintage.Found by accident at Fakta in copenhagen.When I asked how much it was they said it wasn t one of theirs so I got it for FREE.Cooled it down to about 12 and opened it straight away.Pours a redish brown with a tan head.Fruit and treacle toffee with a wonderfull lingering aftertaste slips down like a dream.Hope you did nt forget it in Fakta.

Pours dark reddish brown with a small fizzy head. Aroma is very sweet, raisin, dates, sweet chocolate and toffee, and a slight hint of hops. Inviting. Flavour is definitely sweet, chocolate, toffee and honey, dark fruits and spices. Its saved from being cloying by a gentle hop bitterness in the finish. Nice and warming, alcohol very well hidden. Complex brew, there are more things I cant pick out here. Its surprisingly lacking the typical belgian yeast character. Round and full mouthfeel, subtle carbonation. Nice one!

2008 bottle, dark maple color with some light filmy foam, aromas of sweet caramel sugar and alcohol, flavor has a nice smoothness with spice, honey and syrupy sugars, some banana, raisin, good finisher as well
Bronze with some maltiness and a strong presence of alcohol which is not overpowering. An excellent full bodied beer.

bottle thanks to emacgee. poured a dark brown/ruby with great beige head and some nice lacing. aroma of dark fruit, cinnamon, spices, plum, caramel, slight coffee, and some chocolate. flavor was dark fruit, cinnamon, spices, and a little cherry. body was medium with high carbonation. i really enjoyed this thanks a bunch ethan.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2009 750mL, from Jan Primus, thanks to matt7215. Thanks guys! Pours a very dark, almost crimson-burgundy kind of colour, very unexpected but nice (gee I thought it would be blue!). Small head for a BSA. Aroma: Very nice, very different from what I expected, loads of fruit esters, cherry, apple, prune, date, purple drink (artificial grape; see Dave Chappelle). An odd mix that actually almost reminds me of Rochefort 10. Boozy but in a more inviting way than cloying. Quite sweet. Flavour is more of the same, but it comes in delicious waves, almost one at a time. A very sweet brew, the lack of yeast is noticable and the malts are left to really run the show. Nice fuller mouth-feel and the alcohol presence makes me believe the 11% claim despite the 9.9% labeling by the LCBO (theyre always such party-poopers about this sort of thing). Quite an impressive brew, not something Id call chuggable, nor would I wish to funnel it, which is a shame because this is something I tend to look for in my Belgian Strong Ales (Wait, what?). And the bottle is pretty sweet-looking too!  If I were the Belgian Emperor Id probably drink this for breakfast, or in shots off my Empress sweet-ass body. Correct style classification is more along the lines of Imperial Belgian Strong Ale. Is that redundant? Is it? I should probably cut myself off here in this rating.........

The 2004 is an especially good year- this beer ages well, poors well, has great aroma, ok color- and great lasting flavor.  I was picking up some sweet raisins- and molasses- great if you can find it.

Labeled 2007.  Reminder to self, do not drive and then drink a Belgian ale, very foamy.  Pours cloudy, dark chocolate brown, with a huge, overflowing head, and good lasting lacing.  Smells of caramel, plum, banana, apple, molasses and leather.  Medium, velvety smooth body.  Sweet malty flavor with lots of intense fruit, cherries, apple, plum, banana, some bread and citrus too.  A very big beer, spilled, all over the kitchen.

Bomber. Pours a deep and dark crimson color with a nice head when poured right.  Aroma is sweet syrup with dark fruit, plum and raspberry.  Very sweet taste, banana, plum, and powdered sugar with a hint of malt in there somewhere.  Alcohol is potent but not overpowering.  Nice beer, I prefer it a little on the warm side.

@Redlight Redlight-on tap-pours a rich tan head that laces and deep red color.  Aroma is dark fruit, medium malt.  Taste is very sweet dark fruit-raisin/plum, some licorice, brown sugar, some alcohol.  Interesting.

Rating # 6 from the danish beer festival 2009.
Among my favorite beer styles and this could easily become one of my favorites in this category! Rock solid belgian power ale with a hefty fruity and vinouse nose with notes of raisin, honey, suger and other dark fruits. Flavor is sweet and powerfull with nice alchohol notes. Awsome!
Draft.  Hazy dark brown in color, very fruity aroma, flavor is smooth, fruity, honey and caramel.  The body is full, but not heay.  It is light and creamy.  Very good.

Dark brown in color with a good sized beige head. Aroma is of chocolate, caramel, raisin, brown sugar, and dark fruits. Taste is raisin, brown sugar, booze and caramel. Smooth mouthfeel with light carbonation.

2007 750ml tasted in mid-2009. Really great aroma of caramel and banana with a little bite of alcohol. I really love the smell of this beer. Still has carbonation and no gunk in the bottom of the bottle. Nice pour with a little head and the expected grand cru amber color. Sweet and lightly spiced taste with a bitter finish.

Frothy red auburn hue, clearish body. Aroma is strong in alcohol and an underlying sweetness. Big candy caramel, vanilla, syrup, some bing cherry. Taste is more subdued; barley, Belgian yeast, slight alcohol burn at the end. Can tell its strong but still holds a nice balance.

2008 vintage poured in a snifter at Austin Flying Saucer. One finger head, nice lacing. Dark brown body. Smell and taste is fruity, sweet and alcoholic in roughly that order. A nice beer, but maybe a little too sweet.
Wasnt much of a nose or carbonation.  Nothing really tasted or smelled off.  In the glass and even on the palate this reminded me of a flat Coke.

75cl Bottle from De Bierkoning, to celebrate my 30th birthday and think of 2008, when I was still young. So, vintage 2008 it is. Never been a real fan of GCs darker beers, but this ones quite nice. Clear dark reddish brown beer, creamy off white head. Aroma of candy, raisin, caramel, a hint of metal, loads of alcohol. Flavour is very sweet, malts, dark fruits, alcohol, prickly alcoholic finish. Just like other GC dark beers this one is very sweet, but the mouthfeel is so soft and creamy it doesnt become cloying. It is rather one-dimensional in flavour though, not complex enough to be really great, but still good.
Redish brown body with very stable lacing, big foam, smooth aroma and taste, very nice palate, alcoholic finish, aroma and flavour is sweet, caramel, fruity sugar, some roastiness, herbs and spicy
Bottled: Flavor is very sweet, sticky, plums and candies. Very alcoholic, schnaps, sweet finish with hints of roasted malt. Unpleasant alcoholic.

Vintage 2007.  Enjoyed in a tulip glass via a 750ml bottle.  Pours a deep brown with perhaps some dark ruby highlights.  A nice headstand following the pour.  Notes of pruins, a touch of Munich malt, and just a bit of toasted sugar greet the olfactory senses.  On the palate, the mouthfeel is full but not heavy, and rich without being cloying.  I got notes of dark fruits (perhaps some plum) and a complex array of malty sweetness.  The finish is perhaps medium-dry.  Overall, this one lives up to the hype.  A wonderfully crafted example of a difficult and complex style.

The look is dark brown to black in color with a good sized beige to tan colored head.  The smell is alcohol, fruits, sweet, toffee, caramel, and molassess.  The taste is very smooth, fruity, alcohol, sweet, rasians, and dessert like.

750ml Bottle. 2006 Vintage.  Pours a rich crimson hued brown with a medium tan head.  The aromatics on this beer are amazing.  Prominent notes of candied fruits, raisins, toasted grain and Belgian yeast.  Has a complex sweetness that tastes like overripe dark fruits blended with toffee.  A bit heavy on the tongue with a rich luster and subtle carbonation.  Hops are kept hidden in the background throughout and the beer is sweet, but not cloying.  Alcohol notes pop up here and there, but the beer is not at all "hot". Goes out with a creamy dessert character that lingers on the tongue.  Complexity shows as the beer warms. I usually let this beer sit out for a half hour or so before the first pour. Only wish I had more....

Really nice. The Belgians know their yeast dont they.  Aroma is ripe banana, whole grain bread, butter, yeast spiciness and alcohol.  The flavor is more of the same but muted as compared to the aroma.  Nice even handed mouthfeel that feels a little slick and is heavily carbonated in the beginning.  Very good beer that I will and shall drink again.  2008 22oz.

Bottle (2004) pours brown with a thin, creamy tan-colored head. The aroma is that of dark fruit, caramel, and candi sugar.  The taste is extremely well integrated, displaying notes of apples, pears, toffee, and raisins. The overall mouthfeel is soft and full, with a somewhat alcoholic finish. This is typically one of my "go-to" belgians when im in the mood. Awesome beer, gets better with age.

Bottle at Lees house.  Tark tobaccoey brownish like color.  Smells like sweet caramel, and sugar candy.  The strength is felt from first taste.  Very malty chocolate, mixed with toffee.   Really really good.

Last sample in our Belgian tasting!  Appears dark brown with a small wispy head.  Aroma is an interesting sweet:  bubble gum, candi sugar, dark fruit, and caramel.  Flavor is just so well-balanced, matching dark ripe fruit (raisin, plum, prunes) with smooth caramel and earthiness.  It is tough to distinguish specific flavors because of the balance of it all . . . the finish is mellow, lingering, and entirely pleasant.  My favorite amongst a group that included Abbey de Rocs and Unibroues Edition 2004, 2005.

Pours brown with amber hues. Foamy, small head, quickly dissipating. Nose is big; brown sugar, caramel and dark fruits, raisin and plum. Taste is dry with caramel and raisin, some plum, touch of apple and pear. Dry wit ha touch of bitter at the end. Great mouthfeel. All around delicious. Highly drinkable

Draft at Rattle n Hum. Poured a hazy light orange-golden color. The head was bubbly and white with good retention and lacing. Attractive aroma of yeasty bred dough, mixed baking spices and subdued fruity pastry. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and a warming alcohol effect. There was some alcohol flavor accompanied by clove, dark fruits, dark toffee, yeasty bread dough, and hints of banana and flower blossom. Delicious.

Pours a medium golden color with a frothy white head.  The aroma is of sweet citrus and honey.  There are hints of chocolate and licorice.  This beer has a flavor of malty chocolate.  The aftertaste is thick and rich and leaves a creamy feeling in the mouth.
Tap at Toronado. Pours with a dark brown color. Aromas of bread, and fruit pie, caramel. Flavors of dark fruit like plums and dough. Some toffee mixed in with a very nice body. Excellent.
Very good toffee and dark chocolate aroma. Huge, creamy, light brown head. Good lacing. Clear, amber body. Heavy sweet dark chocolate flavor. Medium to full palate.

Huge beige lasting head. Dark ruby red body with intense carbonation. Strong banana and licorice aroma with spicy coriander notes. Sweet banana, licorice, and chocolate taste with spicy cardamom and cinnamon notes. Considerable alcohol heat. Full body. Smooth mouthfeel. Harmonic and complex. Long dryish aftertaste of various spices with old hop notes. Alcohol notes blend in nicely. Very nice, if maybe a bit sweet. (0.75l bottle, wine monopoly.)

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Brown colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. lots of chocolate and fruity notes. Long exceptionel great finish. Bitter and chocolate. Creamy palate. Fantastic beer.

Draft and Bottle. Pours a dark brown body with a tan coffee head.  Very rich coco, chocolate, plums, raisins and caramel.  A dark note of port wine, thick and viscous with a nice etoh warming and some chewy fruits and chalky minerals.  I love this beer!

750 mL. 2008 version. Gusher ;( Pours a clear dark brown/ruby with a sizable beige head. Little retention. Little lacing. Nose is fairly weak: caramel, Belgian candied fruits, yeast, earth, mustiness, bourbon, and soy sauce. Taste is a little rusty and metallic with an odd array of flavors in conflict: Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, caramel, brown sugar, rum raisin, black cherries, and bourbon. Could be bourbon-barrel aged. Dry, cardboard aftertaste. Perhaps this needs a bit more aging, but regardless I think that the Noel version is an infinitely better ale. I will say that for 11%, this is very light and soft on the palate, enjoyable, and complex. And for that, I give it the benefit of the doubt.

750ml bottle, 2007 vintage.  Pours a clear dark burgundy with a sizable tan head.  Aroma is candied, dried and ripe dark fruits, spicy yeast and light caramel.  Flavor is very nice, with more spicy yeast and dark fruits.  Some sweetness for sure, but not overly so.  Quite enjoyable and well deserving of the solid rating and reputation.  Glad to finally try this one, thanks for the push Eugene!

Strong vanilla aroma, almost bourbon barrel in quality. Undoubtable alcohol presence. Dark at the bottom, but becomes dark red in the light, mocha carbonated head. More bourbon barrel vanilla flavor up front, but ripe fruit (plums) and molasses in the end. Palate is lively, but clean burning. A top notch brew.

Bottle split with Pwn3d and Deputy Andy. Pours a dark, but clear amber body. Aroma is vanilla, and sharp alcohol. Taste is cherry, vanilla; couldnt believe the bottle read 11% - hidden extremely well.

750ml bottle from canals in mt holly.  Split with DeputyAndy & JRedmond. 2008 batch.  Nose was honey, malt, and macadamia nut.  Taste was cherry, nut, and spice.  The best aspect of this beer is its mouthfeel - perfectly balanced.  11% is well hidden.

Crystal clear garnet pour with ample carbonation and towering eggshell head that left significant lacing.  An absolutely beautiful beer.  Aroma is filled with banana, clove, dark fruit, and candied sugar.  Extremely sweet and somewhat cloying.  Raisin, plum, biscuit, honey, and ripe banana.  A bit syrupy.  Not a bad brew.
Bottle 2005.Dark reddish colour with small head.Feels very vinous and sweet,with taste of rasins and brown sugar,fruity mouth feels and sweet finish.

Vintage 2008. Opalescent ruby body with a minimal tan head. Vinous aroma of tannins and a hint of oak barrels. Spicy perfumes of cinnamon and clove, like a mulled vine. Some sweet roasted grains, dried fruits and alcohol in the nose too. The flavor is vinous too with some fruity character like wild fruits and plum, cherries and raisins. Some sweet roasted grains in the background, fine spicies: cinnamon, clove. When the beer gets warmed, its character develop to a higher level. Be sure of right temperature! Interesting, wondrous and exciting one, i ve waited an other character. The beer made me to buy some bottle tocellar ...

Bottled 2007. Poured amber with a dark brown head. Aroma was rich sweet malts, bread, raisin, with some big thick rich dark fruits tossed in. Flavor is sweet dark fruits, rolos, plums, bread, cinamon, and raisin. Rich thick chewy body. Rich beer.....just plain rich.

Read it and weep: 2000 Vintage. Yep. First year of production for this variety. Picked up in a small but glorious shop in Bruges, made the flight home, and shared with a like-minded buddy. This was a completely unique experience. I have only the 07 and 08 years to compare to. The years had treated this brew quite nicely, it had an almost sour bite that was unexpected, yet went quite nicely to balance things out. Im really glad to have had the chance to try a truly once-in-a-lifetime beer.

On tap at OBriens in San Diego.  Pours a very deep almost brown with red/orange highlights.  Has practically no head.  The aroma is sweet and mellow and not overly powerful with just some hints of alcohol and raisin.  Taste is sweet with noticeable booze.  The review below mine mentions chocolate covered cherries and I get that, too.  More alcohol in the finish. This one is drinkable and complex but a bit on the sweet side.

750 ml bottle.  At the recommendation of my great bartender at Tuscarora Mill, I went with the 2007 (they had the 2008 as well).  It pours a deep cloudy brown with ruby highlights.  Musty nose with alcohol, caramel, a touch of cardboard (but not in a bad way).  Champagne like carbonation with a rich, yet clean mouthfeel.  Tastes of prune, fruitcake, chocolate covered cherries, some alcohol, and caramel.  There is also a hint of raisin in the finish.  I was very impressed with this ale and definitely plan to purchase some bottles to cellar!

12 bottles of 750 ml, batch 2008, 11$ per bottle, my first order trough Bieropholies private importation service (Bieropholie.com, french site).  Opened my 8th bottle today, 8th because I have great difficulty with cellaring great beers.  Maturitys kicking in now, with a greater richer texture than the previous bottles I had, at least 5 months ago.  The word decadent has been used a few times for this beers ratings and thats perfectly appropriate.  Complexity of caramel sweetness, spices, fruits (orange, at least) and a bitterness coming afterward.  An amazing beer that I would have more often if I was rich...

Dark red ruby colored with little light brown head. Licoricy aroma with lots of spies and some ripe banana, mild alcohol and vinous note also present. Medium to full bodied. Flavor is more grainy with strong licorice still, spices and mild alcohol here too. Aftertaste dries with sherry like wine note. Excellent beer again from brewery.

0.75 l bottle (vintage 2007), thanks jukkabro! Dark brown color with big creamy head. Sweet aroma with chocolate, licorice, raisins, banana, nuts and warming alcohol. Sweet bready, nutty, toffeish, chocolatey, fruity and spicy flavor with banana, ginger and licorice. Very warming and slightly burning also. Tasty dessert beer with some cream sherry notes.

Bottles - Vertical 06, 07, 08 on March 14, 2009: Clear light brown color in all of them.  I liked the 2008 the least.  It had a hard core yeasty aroma with ripe bananas in the flavor.  It needed to be mellowed out.  The 2007 was a little more mellow.  Sweet flavors, still with the over-ripe banana and almost a bourbon flavor.  The 2006 had a tangy aroma like a sour ale and it was much more mellow than the 08, but you could tell it came from the same place.  The finish was yeasty and metallic.  It was pretty cool to have a vertical on Jake65s departure to North Dakota.  Thanks Sam for sharing on this special occasion.  I only with I was more of a Belgian guy.  I could have probably enjoyed these even more.

Vertical 06-07-08 on March 14, 2009:  Deep amber pour with a thin beige head.  2008 has a sweet and malty aroma with a light fruity element.  Lots of the abv stands out in the floral and light caramel flavor.  Still hot.  The 2007 bottle is more mellow with the sweet toffee and caramel notes standing out a bit more.  The 2006 bottle adds a bit of candied fruit, but remains a sweeter caramel based and toffee flavor.  Nicely mellowed at this point in age.  I think I prefer the 2007 bottle out of the group, but the 2006 is a close second.  The new bottle was just too fresh.  Thanks Sam for sharing this fun vert.

750ml caged&corked bottle (shared with four others, so I had only a small taste unfortunately). Pours brown and a little cloudy with short-lived tan head. Aroma is estery and malty - lots of rich malts, toffee, fruit, and spice. Flavor is straight-forward, decadent malt up front - chocolate-covered caramels, toffee, delicious... Lots of esters and spice enter at mid-palate - little bit of bubble gum, subtle pepper phenols. Finish is dry and warming - remarkably smooth for 11% - and malty with continuing spicy phenols. Mouthfeel is full-bodied but heavily carbonated for a medium/light feel and soft, creamy, gassy texture. Overall, a very nice beer. I wish I had a bigger sample from this bottle - especially I bought it! :)
Christmas present, and a real good one, thanks sis. Fruity, rich and complex. I get apples, raisins, caramel, and sweet. Somewhat dry, and maybe even a little chocolate. Fantastic!

On Draught at Track 84.  Light brown transparent pour with a thin fizzy white head.  Aroma of malt and raisins with plum present.  Smooth, though surprisingly thin, caramel taste with a mild ginger and malt finish.

Bottle at Chaucers Pub, in London ON- Deep hazed amber/brown with a frothy and long lived white cap. Nice lace here, lots of head retention. Nose of candied fruit, yeast, sherry wine, dates, some oak. Tastes fruity sweet matched with a nice hop balance. Raisins, plum, a bit yeasty, toffee, some vanilla and floral spiciness. Very creamy with a lovely spicy and fruity aftertaste, that lingers for ages. Top notch stuff.

PPWD Show. 
This was the 2008 Vintage. I would love to try one a bit older. Probably the best beer that I tried at the show. Again a little bit too cold but was able to warm in hand. Excellent beer and this as well I would like to try blind against Chimay Blue one of my favorites. Sweet dark dried fruits, some chocolate, hint of coffee and quite dry. Excellent beer.

Bottle. Pours a rich gold with a decent white head. Nose is fruity with some honey and yeast. Flavors really bready and at times tart.  Nice fruit flavors too. Mouth is very chewy and carbonated. No complaints here.

Draft @ Capones:  Poured a dark butter toffee color with not much head.  The aroma was sweet, apple cider and bubble gum.  The flavor was dark fruits, dark sugar, sweet malts and well balanced with yeast.  Overall, an excellent beer

Easily one of my favorites.  Incredible dark caramel color with a medium head.  Taste just sits on the tongue with a smooth finish.  High alcohol content but does not take away from the fruitiness of the beer.  Highly suggest.  On tap at the Publick House, Boston

2006 vintage. The main note in the smell is apples and a hint of clove, the taste is unbelievably smooth and tastes like powdery apple goodness. Perfect sweetness, cant taste the alcohol and I wonder why, the taste is suprisingly subtle. The mouthfeel is exquisite. Classy fucking beer.

Buona questa Gouden Carolus cazzi e mazzi, sto ruttando come se avessi magnato la pizza e invece ho magnato i tortellini; ho pensato di berla siccome oggi è il mio compleanno. Avrei moltissime cose da dire sullaroma e sul sapore e sullaspetto (un pochino deludente - unica cosa - per la scarsa schiuma; ma il colore splendido), ma ho un sonno terrificante.

75cl, 2008 vintage bottle split with LarryLSB at Brasserie Beck.   Dark caramel brow color with a lasting beige head of fine bubbles.   Vinous, yeasty, and fruity aroma with dates and cherry.   The flavor is sweet, yet well balanced, with complex yeast, brown sugar, and dried fruit flavors of dates and prune.   Medium-full is body with lively carbonation that lets it glide over your tongue.   This was outstanding with chocolate mousse for dessert.   Wonderful on its own, but the pairing was truly sublime.   I was looking forward to this, and it more than delivered.

2005 vintage that was saved to be shared with a dear friend of mine. Kinda exciting to taste a beer brewed 4 years ago to the day! 
It poured a deep dark brown with a small head retention. Aromas of raisins and molasses. On the palate, a very syrupy mouthfeel where the notes of raisins are still here mixed in with molasses and touches of toffee. As it warms up, notes of cherries and chocolate surface. Very warming and sweet finish. Alcohol is very noticeable - more so than when released.

It is quite interesting to taste a beer that is supposed to be able to age for up to 10 years. Later, I would assume that the alcohol would taper off and this beer would become more and more syrupy, inching closer and closer to an old ale or port.  Now I know what to do with my 2006 vintage.

Tap at Capones.  Pours a murky brown with copper notes and a medium creamy off white head that laced.  Aroma and flavor of rich ripe dark fruits, tons of caramel, a little musty, Belgian yeast esters, mixed nuts and sweet grainy malts.  Abv well hidden.
On tap at the Lucky Baldwins Belgian Fest, this beer pours a dark brown with a thin had. Nice complex aroma and flavor of dark fruit, with some nice spicy notes.

On tap at Capones. Poured a deeper and cloudy/muddy brownish color wih virtually no head. Aromas of dark fruits (prunes and raisins) and fruity. Tastes of the same dark fruitiness (plums and raisins), caramel, toffee, and some lighter spiciness. All around on the sweeter side. Lighter alcohol in the finish.

Ive been sitting on an 07 of this for a year and decided to open it up last night to share with my beer cronies. Colour was a dark amber. The nose.... oh sweet spirits of the spice world! Can you say boiled sweets?! The palate... Creamy, melodious, Leopold Stokowski on hydrocodone, faint butyl esters, dark fruits, citron, toffee, fino sherry, and it all comes together for a delightfully warming  looooooong finish!

Millésimé 2008 et dégusté à lautre oeil dans un verre de gouden carolus. Apparence brune ambré rougeâtrre légèrement cuivré et ayant peu de mousse. Arômes sucré de date,mélasse, sucre brun, caramel, noisette, levure fraiche et vanille bourbon. Goût de sirop dérable, thé glacée, vanille bourbon avec un léger goût de levure légèrement salé. Bien gazéfier et ronde en bouche. Quelle bière! Je vie un autre moment de plénitude...

Opened to celebrate my 1st ratebeer.com anniversary.  2008 Vintage.  Pour is a clear nice mahogany colored head with a big puffy three fingers of light tan head.  Banana, clove aromas, some candi sugar, prunes, and alcohol then some slight sherry like oxidation.  Taste is fantastically sweet, smooth, lots of malts, prunes, lightly spicy, raisin and caramel, with a sneaky warming alcohol finish.

Beautiful Belgian strong ale, caramel, pear, banana, clove, toffee, and just a touch of ginger. Perfectly balanced, silky, rich body, and a very long, satisfying aftertaste. This would be in a leaguewith westvleteren if only it were a bit drier. Still, wonderful stuff.

Bottle 2007. Pours dark mahogany colour with a medium tan head. 
Aroma is dark fruit, malt and caramel. Flavor is caramel, prune, raisin, sugar candy and some spice. 
Its sweet and lovely with a long sweet aftertaste.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2009 Bomber, pours dark brown.  The taste is strong, thick, vinous and sweet with a fig and prune juice flavor and savory aftertaste.  The alcohol is slightly noticeable.  I love this beer!
From Cracked Kettle. Dark brown body with medium head. Spicy nose. Taste of caramels, spices, and lots of dark fruits, also raisins. A very good beer.

Pours a rich mahogany color with a medium sized creamy tope colored head. Nose is spice, caramel, raisins, brown sugar. Taste is the same with a bit of an apple on the back end. Lively mouthfeel and decently well hidden alcohol presence. Bits you on the back end like root beer. Pretty good.
Crushed with Jakebra.  Not much nose to speak of.  Gets better as it warms.  Lots of really wicked dahk fruits in there, with a bit of poopiness, but not too bad.

2008 bottle from Whole Foods.  Dark reddish brown appearance with a small beige head.  Aroma of dark fruits and Belgian yeast.  Flavor is heavily malty and very complex, with plum, date, raisin, brown sugar, caramel, spices, alcohol, and yeast.  Medium to heavy on the mouthfeel.  Warming on the finish.  A well-crafted Belgian Strong Ale overall.

2008 vintage.

Pour: 750 mL silkscreened bottle into Westvleteren goblet. Dark mahogany color with an inch of light tan foam. Nice fine carbonation, filmy lace.

Nose: Spicy dark dough with coriander and peppery alcohol. Sweet bread and a slight chocolate tinge. The booze is a little strong, calling to mind notes of nail polish.

Mouth: Flavors of dark caramel, cocoa, pumpernickel, tobacco, banana pith, honey, bubblegum, cherry, dates, peanut skins, and alcohol. Nice complexity but still too hot. Carbonation is obtrusively high; some swirling and time is needed before I can comfortably sip this beer. Dry warming finish.

Bottle (2008) caged and cork. Nice "pop" off the cork. Poured into a snifter. Dark red in color almost brown. Good two finger sized head. Malty aroma with spices and some fruits. Taste is malty, spices, little yeasty and sweet but not sugary sweet. Very smooth, lots of tiny bubbles in the carbonation level bounce off your tounge... Easy drinking, more like dangerous drinking considering it is 11 percent and you wouldnt guess it to be over 6 percent. Overall a delicious belgian strong ale

750ml. bottle from Trinity Liquors in Spring Hill, FL. Aroma of alcohol, citrus, and some floral notes. Pours dark brown with a bit of light coming through, maple syrup color. Thin head. Fantastic flavor! Citus, malt, licorice..ends in a bit of roasty coffee...Nice warming feel on the palate....very nice. I love it...great mixture of some malt and a good amount of yeast...GREAT belgian strong....

On tap at Novare Res in Portland.
Pour is a tan-brown color with a tan head.  Aroma of figs, molasses, and a little wine-like.  Flavor is sweet at first, but finishes with a very nice boozy aftertaste.  The flavor profile is particularly complex, with a sweet vanilla molasses caramel flavor in the beginning.  I really like this!  So glad I got to try this on tap.

Bottle. 2008 vintage.  Sweet fruity and caramel aroma.  Deep reddish brown body, dense light brown head.  Flavor is moderately sweet, not cloying.  Tons of fruit, malt, yeast, caramel.  Finish is sweet and a little brief.   Impressive, enjoyable, excellent beer.  Among the best in this style.

Huh, Im actually a little surprised to see this beer rated so highly on this site.  I thought it to be good, but not exceptional.  Part of that opinion is no doubt due to my flavor prejudices where I value hoppiness, sourness, and roastiness; predilections no doubt shared by many members of this site (an opinion backed by the majority of beers in the top-100).  This beer doesnt really have those flavors, yet here it is.  

Appearance is brown, cloudy, and a little on the flat side (little head).  Aroma is very malty:  my schnoz detected caramel, spice, wine-like notes, and a certain booziness.  There was also a sugary sweetness in the smell.  Flavor was also caramel-y and spicey (and boozy), but that sugary sweetness in the nose became a butterscotch taste in the mouth.  I also got some floral tastes.  Well, Ill give it this - it is complex (theres a lot in there to enjoy).  Mouthfeel wasnt flat (as I remember it).

I would recommend this beer.  SurlySober brought this over to my house for a tasting with Flyer.  We had Beatification, Allagash Black, Westvleteren 8 and Westvleteren 12 before this beer, so maybe it was just upstaged and I might have thought it exceptional on any other night.

2008 version. You definitely cant have this one in any moment. Is like having a good botle of wine in some special moment. Nicely creamy and maybe a little excess of alcohol. I have 3 bottles left and i will keep 2 to have them LATER!

750ml bottle.  Pours a dark brown with an off-white head.  Nose is of dark fruit, some bubblegum and furniture polish.  Taste is of dark fruit and spice.  Very nice.  Mouthfeel is medium with carbonation and some alcohol warmth.  This was very complex and very tasty.  Shared it only with myself and enjoyed every drop.

750 mL bottlte from 2008. Pours hazy brown with an enormous beige head. The aroma is raisin, plum, light caramel, light traces of vanilla, oak, and berries, hints of anise, and a little bit of carob as it warms. The flavor is sweet berryish malt mostly, with prune and vanilla standing out the most. There is a soft woody quality that reminds me of French oak. There is a bit of bitter chocolate toward the finish, with a hint of spiciness as well. A sweet maltiness lingers for a while, and the alcohol becomes noticeable in the aftertaste. This is quite a good brew.

2000 version.  Pours dark copper color with thin head.  Aroma is big, initial nose is slightly of alcohol but after this warms a little it becomes malty, fruity, with hints of raisins.  Tastes of plums, spice (almost like very faint cinnamon), rich and dense.  Quite complex.  Carbonation is light so you really feel this meaty brew.  There is a lot going here so I find it best to drink from a snifter and to share with friends on a cold night.

2007 version in cellar for a year.Green apple flavor with candi sugar abound. Awesome malt balance I cant recommend this beer enough. If you can get this buy it try it. Spice is just right and all the flavors blend together to create an awesome session with a marriage of Belgian goodness.Alcohol is non present for a 10 percent beer...recommend!

Bottle 2008 edition. Hazy reddish brown body with a creamy very long lasting light brown head. Very vinous aroma of dark ripe fruit, yeast and alcohol. Flavour is spicy, malty and sugary but there is too much alcohol present. Very creamy and thick body. The cellared editions are better though this wasnt bad at all.
Thanks AgentSteve.  2008 Pours dark reddish brown, dark fruits, caramel, malty, little alcohol, slight spice.

Bottle: Poured a reddish brown with a creamy off white head. Sweet fruits, malts, and spices. Taste is dark fruits, a dash of spice, and nice sugary finish. The finish is a bit on the alcohol side, but reminds the tongue of warming sensations.

Last beer of 2008, Bottle, 2008 vintage pours a deep red with a very creamy looking off white head.  Very pungent, can smell it from a foot away.  Lots of raisin and cinnamon, like a good loaf of bread.  Candy sugar is also present as well as what smells like faint malt.  Flavors are sweet and spicy, honey, clove, cinnamon and pepper in the finish.  Long lingering finish with a nice alcohol burn.  The carbonation is moderate to high.  The finish is fantastic, lots of complex flavors that melt into the mouth for a minute after you swallow.  I really can’t wait to get the 09 and the 2010 and do a vertical on Christmas to see how well this ages.  Happy New Years Ratebeerians!

Brown, clear body; tan head.  Strong, sweet, fruity, spicy aroma.  Rich dark fruit flavor, sugary, semi-dry, faintly spicy.  Feels a bit bubbly in the mouth then warming as it goes down.  Nice lingering semi-dry sweetness.  The strong alcohol is apparent in the aftertaste.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2008 old rating:
7/4/8/3/16 - 3.8. vintage 2008.

grand cru of the emperor ABV 10%, so i am assuming that it is a 2003 vintage.

pours a deep dark brown with a medium size tan head, heavy carbonation, and good lacing.

smell is of cocoa, caramel, and dark fruits.

taste is fizzy, then creamy, dark fruit, grapes, cocoa, malt, some sweetness, roasted nuts, ends sweet on the lips and slightly dry.

overall emperor did not seem as carbonated as the blue.

Straw, light fruits, apples, wheat, pear, lemon in the aroma. Hazy golden with a huge fluffy head. Bready sweetness in the flavor followed by light spice, green apples, pear. Very dry, huge carbonation leaves an almost champagne like finish.
2006 bottle,  has a kinda of a wine aroma,  taste is a bit alcohol with a sweet taste of raisins  brown sugar, with maybe a bit of spice.  Good body, something to sit by a fire and enjoy.

Red tinted brown pour with white head.  Lots of nice lacing and carbonation.  Sweet bourbony aroma with lots of fruit and bubble gum.  Very smooth - hides its 11% alcohol extremely well!  Slightly sweet malty flavor.  Fruity with a bitter finish.  A little bit of sourness as well

750 ml,  2001 bottle tasted in September 2008.  Muddy brown color with scant white head.   Aroma of malt and figs.  Flavor of port, figs, cherries and nutmeg.  Warm alcohol mist wafts over you towards the finish.

Bottle shared at a tasting. Pours dark maroon with a thin beige head. Smell is dark fruit, bubble gum and is slightly vinuous in the nose as well. Taste is dark fruit, winelike and semi dry in the finish with some belgian candi-sugar. Medium to thin body and lightly prickly carbonation. A touch boozy, and pretty nice for the style, though.

Pours a warm brown, with a thick but dissipating head. Spicy aroma - a *ton* of brown sugar on the nose. Sweet flavor, lively carbonation, with some dark fruits as well as the brown sugar dominating. Just a touch of tartness comes through, but it’s very much a dessert beer. Spices are prominent, too - a great holiday beer.

750ml Bottle: Sweet, vinous aroma of grapes, light alcohol, dark ripe fruit, brown sugar, light molasses, raisin, slight toffee, some malts, and a hint of chocolate.  Aroma is very complex.  Poured brown/dark orange/dark amber in color with a small, fizzy, creamy, tan head that lasted throughout.  Slightly hazy.  Sparkling.  Good lacing.  Medium sweet flavor.  Tastes of malts, toffee, dark ripe fruit, light alcohol, slight vanilla, raisin, brown sugar, slight oak, light chocolate, slight rum, and maple syrup.  Medium body.  Lightly thick, syrupy texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Sweet, maple syrup, toffee, and alcohol finish lingers a long time.

2006 bottle. Pours a changing light to dark brown colour with no head. Aroma changes drastically (in a matter of minutes!). First a very floral smell then changes into molassas, yeast, sweetness I can’t put my finger on, some kind of exotic fruit (mango or papaya), raisins, very interesting! I’ve gotta try this. On the palate, molassas, raisins, cinnamon, bready yeast (tastes like raisin bread), hints of coffee and exotic fruits, touch of sourness on the finnish (in a pleasant way). Warms the palate and lingers pleasantly.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2010 75cl bottle. 2005 vintage. It poured a dark deep red, almost brown colour with a medium big beige head that settled down fast in the glass. It has a very fruity aroma that tastes of black berries, nuts, caramel and roasted malts. The flavour is slightly bitter and tastes of dark caramel, malts, nuts and dark berries. It has a short aftertaste.

75cl bottle at Kulminator 2004 edition. Amber and ruby colour with a small head. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Some nuts and toffee. Flavour is well rounded. The flavour evolves and becomes more sweet after a while. Notes of plum, sugar, alcohol, toffee. Alcohol becomes more prominant after a while as well. Long, lingering aftertaste.
Tap at Trappeze.  Poured clear dark brown with a beige head.  Aroma of dark fruit, sweet molases malt.  Taste is fruit, malt, yeast, nut.  Mouth is smooth.  A solid brew.

2008 vintage.  Pour is deep brown with a big puffy off-white head that refuses to go away.  Nice puffy cloud.  Aroma is fruity but dark.  Taste is complex with a warming alcohol hello.  Malty yet sweet.  Solid brew.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2009 Vintage 2006. It pours a nut-brown beer with a small beige head. The nose is of figs, vitamin tablets, raisins, molasses, nutmeg and plum. Rather sweet and fruity. Quite a lot of molasses and apples in the taste. Both malty and yeasty - nicely balanced. It reminds me a bit of Uniebroue la Terrible. Pleasantly woody. Notes of walnuts, vitamin tablets and figs showing up. Slightly lactic. Not much lacework. Full bodied. Sweet. Some alcohol appearing with the swallow. The finish is surprisingly good and quite yeasty with hints of rasins and mince pies. Pleasant, but definetely not a wonderful beer in my opinion. I dont share the same taste as Charles the fifth. But I agree on his following quote by the way:  Paris is not a city, but a universe. Thanks a lot bov for this beer!

Bottle. High creamy off-white long lasting head leaving nice curtains. Very dark clear red brown body. Raisin plum apple alcohol hops caramel roasted malt aroma. Smooth creamy roasted malt caramel raisin plum flavor and pleasant hops bitterness. Alcohol very well hidden.
POURS WITH A NICE BUBBLY HEAD. IT HAS A NICE DARK COLOR. YOU CAN TASTE THE COMPLEX SUGARS  AND SMELL THE SWEET AROMA. A MUST BUY..

2002 vintage 75 cl. Brown hazy cloudy body, very little light brown head with small lacing. Aroma of banana, basement, lots of malt, alcohol and nutty. Creamy texture. Very sweet flavor, little hop bitterness.

tap at monks, philadelphia, pa. pours black with a thin head, me thinks it will be a touch sweet. raisins and and chocolate dominate the nose, with touches of biscuity cookie.  taste is sweet, and thick, chocolate cookie. sooooooooooooo so drinkable. slightly sweet though. 
maybe a bit touch sweet. still good though.

Bouteille de 750 ml (2008), bu à Brouhaha (Montréal) le 22/10/08. Bourgogne très foncée, peu de collet. Arome de fruits licoreux mures, mélasse très alcoolisé et épicé. Goût très licoreux, rich de caramel anglaise, mélasse et des fruits mures. Une dégustation agréable!

[750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Bottle from 2008] The aroma is very sticky with alcohol. Beautiful red colour and much foam. The flavour is nice and thick with burnt caramel but a little bit to much alcohol

750 ml caged and corked bottle requiring a wine opener to get the cork off. Bottling from 2006. Poured muddy brown with a tan head that dissipated quickly. Huge rich aroma of dark fruits and sweet malts. Very nice. Sweet flavor full of caramel, figs, raisins, and prunes. Huge alcohol that warms the body. A sipper for sure and very nice.
Pours dark brown with reddish highlights and a large off-white head.  Very sweet aroma of malt & dark fruits.  Flavor to match with a large caramel and sugar finish with a touch of vanilla.

Pours a slighly hazy dark copper with a big off-white head that shows great retention and lots of lacing.  The aroma is dominated by the sweet sugary malts and dark fruits - figs, raisins, grapes.  The taste is just as sweet as the aroma would indicate.  Huge caramel and candy sugar sweetness with vanilla and dark fruit.  The mouthfeel is sticky and the sweetness just coats the mouth from the first sip.  This is a very complex and enjoyable Belgian ale.
Dark (brown to black), hazy. Both the  aroma and taste is extremely complex. Hints of butter, choclate and soy in the aroma. Flavor is both sweet (fruity) and salty (soy).

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Red liquid with very little head.
Soy, chocolate and liquorice aroma
Tasted of wall fern.

A lovely complex beer!

Summary: I can respect it for its complexity, but find it generally unpleasant.  Aroma: Balsamic vinegar, some caramel and floral notes.  Appearance: Clear garnet red-brown, a finger of tan head vanishes without lace. Flavor: Very understated at the front, builds in strength and complexity.  Despite the aroma, alcohol, wood, and bitterness are the primary flavors. Caramel and fusel elements play a secondary role.  Palate: Dry with alcohol warming.  Some thickness in the middle.

Dark brown, nice sizey white head. Aroma is prune and plum and brown sugar and raisin and whiskey and, I don’t know, candied fruit? Maybe? Flavor is heavier on the fruity notes, with a lot of raisin and prune, and as it warms there is a lot of rummy, whiskey-y notes. Pretty tasty stuff.

Bottle, 2005. Fantastic! Pours maroon, some sediment flakes, fuzzy tan head, with just amazing lacing. Just looks so inviting. The nose is wonderful, bread pudding, juicy sugary fruits, licks of rum, candi sugar. Sweett, bready goodness, a little alcohol comes through, but not enough to ruin anything, raisins and big yeasty flavors. Remarkably light, with lush carbonation, especially for being 3 years old, a little heat. Mmm, very good.

[2008 Bottle]  Pours a thin deep red/brown with a lively tan sudsy head with lots of larger carbonation bubbles.  Sweet vinous aroma of fruits, licorice, brown sugar, malt, raisins, yeast, light banana and alcohol.  This stuff is pretty nutty, flavors of wood, banana, brown sugar, nuts, raisins, port and alcohol.   Carbonation is very strong, soda like, medium body.  Too boozy, I suppose I should get another bottle to age for a few...

From LIC, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 110908.
Brown with nice head. Aroma is complex of berries and malt. Flavor is very sweet of brown sugar with caramel, fruit and alcohol presence.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2009 75 cl bottle from Systembolaget, thanks to Fredrik. One of the absolut best belgian beers Ive tried. Deep red/brown color with a good head. Complex, vinous aroma of berries and nuts. Lots of bitter berries in the flavour, some liquorice, caramel, brown sugar, fruit... a very balanced sweetness and the alcohol is a bit warming in the stomach. Very fullbodied, filling and smooth in the palate. Great beer! 9/5/10/5/18=4,7

Rerate: 75 cl bottle. Aged for one year and two months at home. Pours a dark brown color with hints of red, nice beige head, some lacing on the glass. Aroma is vinous, with lots of dried fruits, plums, port wine, red currants, spices and caramel. Flavour is very, very sweet (too sweet) and vinous with portwine, dried fruits, raisins, light spices, red currants and leaf. Notes of syrup and toffee. Not much stuff to balance the sweetness. Full bodied; medium strong carbonation. A dissapointment, and weird that I think its sweeter now than last year. Maybe needs to age for a thousand years or so... But it smells good.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2016 Bottle (EBF2008)
Raspberry jam aroma - huge! Port, woody, fruity, raisins, some yeastiness. Concentrated malt loaf. Oh yes!
Rerate: 750 ml bottle (7:4:7:2:13=3.3)
Crazy sweet body. Sticky palate. Slimey, ewww. This needs to age.
2002 bottle drank in 2008.  Pours a dark muddy brown, decent head.  Quite viscous.  Flavour is malty, sweet and chocolatey, a fair bit of warming alcohol for an 8% beer.  Pretty good.

Pours dark brown with un-yielding head. Aroma is dark fruit, brown sugar, caramel, raisin and molasses. Flavor is incredibly well balanced and powerful. Tons of sweetness, balanced nicely with some citrus and spice. Palate is oily, bubbly, and caressing.

pours a dark red brown with an absolutely massive frothy head- gorgeous pour. Aroma is smooth and tasty, with notes of caramel, raisin, and yeast. Head is still rising with carbonation 2 minutes after initial pour. Flavor is excellent- definite sweet notes with plum, cinnamon, and molasses. Alcohol is definitely evident, giving a nice aggressive sidebar to the sweet flavors. Smooth palate, really nicely crafted brew.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2008 Had already a lot of them on bottle. Next year i will do a vertical tasting of this splendid beer. Have already 5 different years of this bottle. Did a vertical tasting of all cuvée van de keizers. Had a very amazing experience. First 2008 still missing some body. The 2007 version was a little sour. And then came 2006. We had frm every year 12 bottles in a box. They stayed together in same conditions and then we could taste it. My bottle was very nice and good ballanced. Then asking an other table and asking them what they think of the beer and they told me it tasted as cardboard. I tasted also from that bottle and I agreeded. Then I asked a 3rd table. And their beer had a more sour taste. And I agreed. Then we went down to 2004 till we had a food break. After that break we went further down till the first 1999 brew. But yes tasting 10 different years of the same strong beer is very hard to do. But it was worth while. Tasted 10 dark Cuvées and the blond one.

Clear, dark carmel color with a fast disappearing head.  A lot of carmel in the nose, and mouth for that matter.  Only the darkest, most shriveled fruits in this beer, with some earth spices.  The alcohol is ever present and warms the throat as well as any night time cold medicine, with with a taste that doesn’t make you grimace.

A dark brown/ruby colored beer, with a foamy beige head. It disappears quickly. The aroma is typical from Gouden Carolus. Very complex, notes of caramel, wood and roasted malts. The taste of dried fruits like raisins and prunes. It’s spicey, alcoholic. The aftertaste is burning sweet. A very good beer.

Vintage 2007.  An imposing wooden red mahogany hue with a frothy cap of beige.  Sweet, decadent and vinous nose of butterscotch, chocolate, raisins, and figs in the first breath, which is a mite too buttery.  But the depth of nuance in the bitter tones and the sweet ones is unknowable; a westvleteren-like unconquerable cave.  Peppery red wine, caramel, raw cocoa nibs, tannins, cinnamon.  For the most part, the dryness of alcohol it offers is in the vein of a fine cabernet, as it seems so dark and tannic, and buried deep in that mysterious pure-chocolate soil.  The butterscotch sweetness at the beginning is a cumbersome gateway into the ocean of character here for me.

Enormously full flavor; a fully realized, deep malt and yeast collaboration at every turn.  Wildflower honey-dipped hazelnuts.  An arresting red wine with every warming caress and velvety nuance it offers; cinnamon, sweet red peppers, brown sugar, and powdery cocoa.  There’s an ebullient brightness of citrus that blends sunshine with the tartness of the wine character into something undeniably attractive.  A fulsome thickness of chocolate, blackberries, caramelized pears and alcohol nearing the finish; warm and expansive, but dusted starkly with a surprising herbal bitterness, that couldn’t be better placed to balance the delirious sweetness and complexity altogether, and to wrap it up on a succinct dry kick.  Wow.

Full palate, syrupy and effervescent, with a wholly erudite impression of cleanness and complexity from start to finish.  It calms down a bit into maple syrup at the very end, showing a touch of alcohol, generously and appropriately.  The balance and warmth of this gorgeously complex experience isn’t divine inspiration, but it’s quite breathtaking!

2008 750ml corked bottle.  Pours a beautiful golden/red/brown with a very lively frothy beige head that produces excellent lacing and has wonderful retention.  Aroma is sweet brown sugar and there is a bit of alcohol at the end, but what do you expect for an 11% beer?  Flavor is of dark fruits and brown sugar and a touch of spice.  The finish is a bit dry but I guess you could expect that.  There is a touch of warming in the back of my throat as well.  Mouthfeel is teetering on the syrupy side.  This beer is wonderful.
Poured a nice ruby red color with nice frothy head. Aroma of alcohol, brown sugar and fruit. Flavor is sweet and some spices and alcohol on tongue. Overall a good beer but not overly impressed.

Dark ruby red hue with a thick sustaining layer of frothy tan foam. Aroma is sweet malts and dark fruits with a nice background of spice, sugar, and alcohol. Initial taste of rich dark fruits and caramel malts dominate and followed soon by spices and light chocolate, finishes sweet and slightly dry. Palate is a creamy smooth texture with ample carbonation. Overall, a fair Grand Cru that is somewhat lacking in flavor and complexity.

C&C 750 from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville. Brown-amber pour with a 2-finger head. Grainy, bready aroma with dark fruit notes, caramel and spice.  very malty aroma with heavy molasses and dark fruit notes. Strong flavor kind of surprising given the delicate nature of the nose. Full bodied.

Bottle. A logn time ago though... Pours a dark brown/amber colour with off-white frothing head. Aroma is very sweet with malts, spices, dark fruit and alcohol. Mouthfeel in palate is absoloutely wonderfully thick and soft. Flavor is again malts, spices, dark fruit, caramel, and, of course, alcohol, which gives you a warm tinkling feeling inside. Not drunk as I write this. I promise!
2004 bottle- Poured a dark brownish red. Very thick head. It had a very sweet taste and smell. I would recommend this beer to anyone.
dark ruby in color with a beige head. Lacing is most excellent as well as the head retention. Being a boulevard fan it is much like the sixth glass quad. Excellent beer, but maybe a bit too sweet

2008 bottle. Would be very very nice with 3 to 5 years of age on it. A little hot right now. With a large, rocky, off-white head with a dark brown body. Aroma of alcohol, cinnamon, brown sugar, banana, and raisins. Very hot, but would age brilliantly. Taste is alcohol, spices some wheat and toastes malts. Lively bubbles.
Biere de couleur rousse avec un mince collet non-collant. Odeur d’alcohol, sucré, cerises et un peu de chocolat. Gout d’humidité, sucre et un petit coté bonbon.

(From the archive)

Reddish brown under slight greyish head. Touch of sherry on the aroma along with nougaty malts and alcohol.

Sweet nougat and alcohol in the mouth.

Pours an amber brown color with a light brown head. Aroma is malty, caramel, raisins, chocolate, prune, and a sweet sugary finish. Flavor is malty, caramel, prune, some cocoa, and a bitter sugary finish.

75cl bottle from KIngdom Liquors (Tampa, FL). Bottle labeled 2007. Pours a dark brown to black with a thin off-white head (bottle did not pop much when opened). Aroma is sweet and malty with dark ripe fruit, candy sugar, phenol comes through. Flavor is wonderful with notes of raisins, ripe plums, molasses, and bread. Medium to full-bodied with a sweet and malty finish. Excellent ale.
This beer kicks ass. I love it. I cant wait to drink some more. I want more and more and more and more and more and more. Thank You

draft @ uber - ruby reddish-orange and slightly cloudy with off white head; very sweet overall with nice kick of fruit; smooth, syrupy texture and almost juice-like; very nice, but way on the sweet side

2007 750ml courtesy of Butters. Big malty nose with belgian bubblegum fruit and spiceyness. Mostly clear ruby brown with almost no head. dark fruits, bubblegum and peppery hop flavors. Full body with moderate carbonation and some sweet sherry like overtones in the finish. very complex and good.

Brown/red color with foamy white head.  Aroma is of bananas, yeast, and other fruits.  Huge, huge sweetness.  Brown sugar, dark fruits, and spice dominate this brew.  Very syrupy and alcoholic, but still an excellent Belgian Strong Ale.

25.4 oz bottle, 2006.  Dark crimson brown with a pocked ivory head.  Nose is caramel, grape soda and wood.  Smooth and soft with a tingle.  Taste is sweet berries and grape; kind of like a sherry.  Dry finish with a touch of bitter chocolate.  This paired nicely with some Morbier.

Vintage 2007.  Pours clear mahogany with garnet highlights and miniscule tan head.  Nose of banana bubblegum, caramel, raisin, anise, molassis, peat, and just the smallest twinge of alcohol.  Flavor of anise, sweet caramel and alcohol.  Medium chewy body with low carbonation.  Warming in the finish but not hot.  Very enjoyable for such high abv and good pricepoint.

2008 750ml.  Nice looking redish brown.  Good head, laced my glass well.  Fruity nose, enjoyable palate.  Very very brown sugar flavor at first.  After it came up to temp. the flavors blended better.  Very Belgium.  Clean finish.
75cl, brew Anno 2008, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex, heavy, yet balanced, clear, good head, very good brew, the best of the Gouden Carolus range

Blah. This is a typical over the top hot Belgian beer.  Probably would be a lot better with a year or two on it. Aroma was huge. Vinuous backbone with sweet caramel malt and alcohol jumping out. Pour was a decent murky brown with no bubbles and a one finger tan head. Taste was too hot and strong. Strong Vicks Vapo-Rub, caramel malt intertwined with hot alcohol and little carbonation.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: This beer rocks. Its got everything a strong, brown ale should have. The right balance of flavor, alcohol, sweetness and body that makes a Belgian strong ale totally drinkable.

Bottles at Århus Ølfestival 2008 (tastet at the same time). 2008 version: Pours a nice dark ruby red with almost no head. Aroma is vinious, fruity aswell as the flavour, but here it is a bit to vinious (7, 4, 7, 3, 16 - 3,7). 
2004 version: Pours a nice dark ruby red with almost no head. Aroma of wonderful plum, vinious and caramel. Nice balanced flavour and body with plum, caramel and viniousity (8, 4, 9. 4, 18 - 4,3)

750ml 2007 bottle, best before March 28, 2017.  Pours murky dark brown with virtually no head in a Trappist glass. Lacing is sparse, but clingy. The aroma is sweet and fruity, very well balanced, and quite strong. Notes of berries, coriander, grape are all apparent. Its quite juicy and devoid of any alcohol burn in the nose. Mouthfeel is lively and prickly with a sticky fig sweetness highlighted by spiced notes. Some earth, grape, graham crackers, berries, and a little heat are found in the complex flavor. I really enjoy the way this one comes together.

like this about as much as getting ass-raped in a turkish prison, smells of sweatty arm-pits & turkish cheese, hope the fucking whores of turkey smell better than this vile creation, fuck them in the ass if they dont

Wasn’t sure what to expect here.  Poured a deep ruby/brown color with a fairly small white head. Initial aroma was almost pure cherries, my wife said it reminded her of cherry cough syrup.  The flavor was more complex than that though.  The cherries were certainly at the forefront, but there were hints or raisins, sugar, malt, and just the barest hop hint.  This was a fun one to taste just because of all the different flavors that made themselves apparent throughout the beer.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2008 2006 bottle shared by Eric, thanks man. Pours a mahogany color, with a small white head. The aroma is full of banana and sugar notes, some funk in there too. The taste was very nice; a sweet malty body with some fruity, almost strawberry aspects. Very smooth and full mouthfeel. An excellent beer. A high level Belgian, and that is saying something for sure.

2006 bottle.  Darker brown pour with a smallish head in  a "Grand Cru of the Emperor" official glass.  Wonderful sweet aroma of brown sugar, molasses, figs, raisins, cherries, and pastries.
